loans.name: Zumreta

texts.en:
Zumreta Halilović, born in 1956 and living in Kalesija, is a widow who is raising her son, a student in second class primary school, by herself. While not formally employed, she works a great deal in her garden and in a field, producing a variety of vegetables both for sale and her own use. Zumreta has a few chickens as well.

While she does not earn much from her business, she takes out a loan every season. Currently she is requesting a loan in the amount of $1075 to buy seeds for the autumn sewing. She hopes to thereby provide better living conditions for both herself and her child.

loans.use: To buy seeds for autumn sewing

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en:
Sabira Rahmanović, from the village of Bečići near Banovići, was born in 1947 and is married to a retailer. Sabira works a great deal in her garden and field, producing healthy food both for sale and for home consumption. Her husband helps her mostly with their cows. She earns about $225 monthly from selling milk and milk products.

Sabira is very entrepreneurial and wants to extend her business by buying poultry. She has already received loans from WWI and now is requesting a loan in the amount of $450. Through this loan she hopes to be able to offer the best quality of poultry meat.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Mirnesa

texts.en:
Mirnesa Rahmanović, 26, lives in Banovići where she is the married mother of a five-year-old daughter. Her husband has his own little business, working part time as a woodcutter and part time as a builder.

Mirnesa has three cows and calves, and periodically she buys a calf for reselling, usually with the financial assistance of her husband. Due to business setbacks this year, he will not be able to assist her in this purchase, so Mirnesa is requesting a loan in the amount of $450. Her goal is to have more cattle in order to improve family income.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Hasija

texts.en: Hasija M. anović, born in 1952, lives in the village of Toj ići near Kalesija with her retired husband.  They are both very busy in their corn field and garden, producing their own vegetables and cattle feed. They were getting a calf every year from their cow that they would sell, but the cow is now too old, so Hasija is requesting a loan of $875 to buy a new one.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira Ramić, born in 1980, is married and has two children, one four years old and the other two. Her husband is the income earner in the household because Almira is not employed. However, in addition to taking care of her home and children, she keeps busy in her little garden producing vegetables for the family’s consumption.

She also has a corn field and this autumn will have enough corn to begin raising poultry, an endeavor for which Almira is requesting a loan of $450. She hopes to thereby raise the family income and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Kadiatou F. est âgée de 52 ans et vit avec ses 9 enfants et son époux dans une famille traditionnelle élargie (beau père, belle mère et beaux frères) au quartier Somono de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, elle décida de faire du commerce des tissus bazins et des pagnes wax (des tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’Ouest). En plus elle fait de l’achat et de la vente des chaussures (de différentes sortes) depuis maintenant 12 ans.

Dans le souci de maintenir sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elle est en relation depuis 3 ans. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel après 4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous remboursés sans difficultés Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes Wax (real et hollandais), 5 pièces de tissus bazins moins riches et 5 paires de chaussures à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès de commerçants grossistes. Avec une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes salariées, elle effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et à crédit payable mensuellement au niveau des entreprises et chez elle à domicile. En raison de la qualité des tissus vendus, Madame  Kadiatou F. est connue dans toute la ville de Ségou.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA.qui lui permettra d’augmenter la taille de ses affaires et épauler son conjoint pour supporter les charges de la famille élargie.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadiatou F. is 52 years old and lives with her nine children and her husband in a traditional extended family (father-in-law, mother-in-law, and brothers-in-law) in the Somono district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) In order to insert herself into economic life, she decided to do commerce in “bazin” fabrics (damask) and in Wax-brand “pagnes” (highly prized cloth in West Africa). Furthermore, she has been doing trade in shoes (different kinds) for twelve years now. Concerned with maintaining her large and growing customer base, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which she has had an association for three years. She is on her second individual loan following four group loans (solidarity loans), which have all been repaid without difficulty. With this new loan, she intends to buy: 10 pieces of pagnes (Real Wax and Wax Hollandais), 5 pieces of bazin fabrics of lesser richness, and 5 pairs of shoes, in Bamako (capital of Mali). Wholesale merchants are her source. To customers essentially composed of salaried women, she makes her sales at the retail level in cash and on credit, payable monthly in the case of enterprises. She also makes sales out of her home. Because of the quality of the fabrics sold, Ms. Kadiatou F. is known throughout the city of Ségou. With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to increase the size of her business and to assist her spouse in covering the expenses of this extended family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Wax pagnes, damask, and shoes.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun P. is a villager in Kandal Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a teacher in a primary school and makes a small salary to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Prum Sopha, is a teacher like his wife. Aside from this position, he owns a small store in the local village where he sells different kinds of books. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so his wife, Mrs. Thoeun P., decided to ask for a loan to purchase more books to re-sell. 

Mrs. Thoeun P. is 35 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Previously, she had obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's current business.

loans.use: To purchase more books to re-sell

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny P. is a villager in Prey Pich Village in Kampong Chhang Province. She is a farmer who can get a small rice revenue because she owns a small rice field. In order to expand her rice revenue, Mrs. Ny P. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a 0.5 hectare field to cultivate rice. Mrs. Ny P. is a 53-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a 0.5 hectare field to cultivate rice

loans.name: Inn

texts.en: Mrs. Inn K. lives in Takol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chou Morn, are farmers who get a small rice revenue from the small piece of land that they own. In order to expand their revenue, Mrs. Inn K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to buy a 0.5 hectare field to cultivate rice. Mrs. Inn K. is 58 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom owns a small beauty salon, while the remaining three attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a 0.5 hectare field to cultivate rice

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 37 years old and married with six children. She is the leader of a lending group under LAPO MICROFINANCE. Hannah produces and sells yogurt ice cream. She has a bicycle boy who assists her in the sale of ice cream. Also, some of her customers buy in bulk to sell to school children. Hannah needs the loan amount of $850 to purchase one deep freezer in order to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She says when she meets the demands of customers, she will not lose them to competitors. Hannah says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To Purchase one deep freezer

loans.name: Folsade

texts.en: Folasade is 43 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions like toothpaste, detergent, toothbrushes, etc. She also sells wraps for women (sarong). Folasade needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy more provisions for sale. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible

loans.use: To buy more Provisions for sale

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mr. Van T. is a villager in Tropang Pring Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a palm juice collector who gathers palm juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Aside from from this, he is a cow breeder who raises two cows. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Sok Ros, is a housewife who cooks very delicious food for her household. Mr. Van T. is 25 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through Junior High Level. Agnes operates a small restaurant where she sells a variety of local dishes like fufu which is made out of cassava and plantains pounded together and others at Kissi station near Elmina; she has been doing this since 2003. Her husband is an environmental health worker.

Agnes uses her income to help her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and utility bills. Agnes will use the loan to purchase more ingredients, spices and food items for the food preparation at her restaurant. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to continue work on an abandonned house she started building for the children.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients, spices and food items for food preparation

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum S. was born in 1982 and lives in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She has three children, two of whom attend the local school while the other is too young to work or study, being just 2 years old.

Mrs Prum is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Porp Leang Hak, is a motorbike repairman in their village. He is facing some difficulty because he does not have enough money to purchase motorbike equipment. Thus, Mrs. Prum S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy motorbike equipment in order to meet the demands of her husband's customers.

loans.use: To buy motorbike equipment

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods, drinks and fried meat. She has been in this business for the past six years. Mary buys the foodstuffs for cooking from Ikotun main market and takes the foodstuffs to Egbeda where she has her restaurant. Mary needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more foodstuffs in bulk to cook and sell. This, she says, will enable her meet the demands of her customers and, thereby, retain her customers. Mary is 45 years old and married to Mr. A.. They have three children who are all in school. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To Purchase more foodstuffs and beef for cooking to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel T. is single and has no children. He has been schooled through the junior high level. Since 2006, Samuel has made a living selling bicycle parts at Kissi station near Elmina. He uses his income to pay utility bills and other expenses. Samuel will use the loan to increase his capital and buy more bicycle parts to sell. With the new profits from his business, he plans to complete work a building he is constructing.

loans.use: Samuel will use the loan to increase his capital and buy more bicycle parts to sell.

loans.name: Rashidat

texts.en: Rashidat M. sells smoked and frozen fish. She has been in this business for the past six years. Rashidat buys cartons of fish from the market. She has sales girls that assist her in smoking the fish on a fire. She pays the girls weekly. Rashidat is the lady standing in the photo, and the others are her sales girls. Rashidat has a shop where she sells fish; she also has a deep freezer for selling some frozen fish to those who prefer it. Rashidat needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more cartons of fish to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of more cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella O. is 75 years old. She is a widow with 4 children. All her children are grown up and are happily married. Stella is involved in an interesting business. Stella cooks food for people who have social ceremonies like weddings, funerals and birthday ceremonies. She has lots of cooking utensils like plates, spoons, and big pots for large cooking. Stella has 5 women assisting her in cooking. She buys her foodstuffs like rice, groundnut oil, tomatoes, pepper, and vegetables from New Benin market. Stella loves her business. She is happy whenever people get married and invite her to cook. She hopes for the loan amount of $875 to buy more foodstuffs and cooking utensils. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and cooking                                                                    Utensils  To purchase more foodstuffs and cooking utensils

loans.name: Djeyhun

texts.en: Djeyhun is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives in Baku. For the past 5 years Djeyhun has been running an internet cafe. He now needs a loan of US$1,200 to improve his business.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Hydnius

texts.en: Hydnius N. is 44 years old and is married with 2 children. His eldest child is in a public secondary school while his youngest child is in primary school. Hydnius is a hardworking man. He sews women's bags and wallets. He has one sewing machine that he uses to sew the bags and wallets. When he finishes sewing the bags and wallets, he takes them to Oba, New Benin, Oregbeni and Ekiosa markets for sale. Hydnius says this business is very good because he gets high patronage from women. He buys the leather and zippers from Aba market in the eastern part of Nigeria. His greatest challenge is that there is no constant electricity supply, so he cannot meet the demands of his customers. He hopes for the loan amount of $450 to buy one generator set and leather for the production of women's bags.

loans.use: To purchase more leathers for the production of female bags and to buy a generator set

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita Osarinwian is a tailor. She also sells tailoring materials like zippers, landings, needles and tailoring designs. She learned how to sew clothes from a friend. Rita is 44 years old and is married with 4 children. Her eldest child is a boy and he is in a private secondary school. Rita has a store in Oba market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of $875 to buy more tailoring materials and a sewing machine. Rita makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials for sale and one sewing machine

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty U. is a hairstylist and she also rents out home video CDs. She has one hair dryer and lots of video CDs for renting. She has a sales girl that assists her in renting out the video CDs to customers. Beauty also makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. Beauty is 36 years old and married with 2 children. Her eldest child is in nursery school while the youngest child is yet to start school. Beauty's shop is located at Agho junction, in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. Beauty hopes for the loan amount of $450 to buy one hair dryer and more video CDs to rent out. She says thank you to all to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one hair dryer and video CD's

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy I., a tailor whose customers are mainly women and young girls, makes lovely Nigerian designs and sells female wrappers (sarongs).  Mercy learned how to sew from a fashion school in Ogida, Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She currently has two sewing machines. 

Conducting her business at the front of her house, the demands for her tailoring services are high, so Mercy hopes for the loan amount of $450 to buy one embroidering machine and additional female wrappers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one embroidering machine and additional girls' wear to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn I. sells palm oil wholesale. She has lots of gallon jugs that she uses to sell palm oil wholesale to her customers. Evelyn purchases the palm oil from a palm oil company in Benin City. She is 47 years old and she is married with 7 children. Evelyn loves her business because palm oil is very important in the preparation of Nigerian soups like Egusi, Ogbono, and Banga soups, etc. This makes the demand for palm oil very high because it is a needed commodity in every home. Evelyn hopes for the loan amount of $450 to buy more gallons of palm oil so that she can meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace O., a 60-year-old widow with six children, all grown up and married, has seven of her grandchildren living with her. Peace makes the traditional Bini beads and rents out video CD's from her store, located at the front of her house. Her grandchildren assist her in renting out the CD's when they have completed school for the day.  Peace now hopes for the loan amount of $450 to buy more bead materials and video CD's for her business. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for bead-making and video CD's for her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: A. Florence is 30 years old and a single parent with a child. Her child is 5 years old. Florence has a shop where she sews women's and children's clothes. She also sells wraps or sarongs. Florence has a salon in her shop. She opens her shop by 8 am and closes by 7 pm. She is a hard-working woman. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more sarongs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen O. operates Helen's Crayfish Store. She is 32 years old and married with 6 children. She learned the business from a friend before opening her own shop in 1986. She goes to villages in Edo State, Nigeria, to buy crayfish to sell in Benin City. She sells to women who then sells the crayfish in Oka Market (one of the most popular markets in Edo State). She is asking for a Kiva loan of $600 to buy more crayfish. She hopes that Kiva lenders will help her grow her business by enabling her to buy more goods and increase her sales. She is grateful for your help.

loans.use: To buy more crayfish to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth I. is 33 years old and married with three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she sells provisions and drinks, a business she started in 2006 after watching her mother run a shop as she grew up.

Ruth is asking Kiva lenders for a loan of $425 to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks to stock her store. She says that the more selection she has, the more sales she can make to help care for her family. Ruth is very grateful for the assistance from LAPO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira tiene 60 años y está acompañada desde hace aproximadamente 35 años con el señor Segundo Gaona, con quien tiene dos hijos, Carlos y Miryan, los dos ya mayores de edad.

Doña Elvira se dedica a la venta ambulante hace ya mas o menos 20 años lo que siempre le sirvió para sustentar a su familia.

Los créditos que la Fundación le otorga los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como manteles, colchas, fundas, ropas para criaturas y personas adultas etc.

Los próximos créditos los quiere invertir en la compra de más mercaderías acorde al cambio de estación, o sea ropas y mercaderías que sean para verano.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elvira is 60 years old and has been married for 35 years to Mr. Segundo Gaona. They have two children together, Carlos and Miryan, both of whom are adults.

Mrs. Elvira has worked as a street vendor for about 20 years and it has always helped her support her family.

The loans that the Foundation has granted her have been invested in the purchase of merchandise such as blankets, bedspreads, and clothing for children and adults.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise, according to the changing seasons, which will be clothing and merchandise for summer.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets, bedspreads, sheets, and clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Dinara

texts.en: Dinara (her father is pictured) was born in 1985. She lives in Baku city. Her father has been in the construction business for 10 years. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary things like tools for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy tools and necessary things to improve their business

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
El Sr. Ever Hilario O. nació en Asunción, vive con Mirian Encina con quien tuvo dos hijos, Oscar y Génesis con 5 y 3 años respectivamente.

Es constructor de obras desde hace mas de 10 años y gracias al financiamiento de la Fundación pudo adquirir una camioneta y diversos tipos de herramientas que lo ayudaron a crecer en lo laboral ya que dirigió importantes obras de construcción.

En esta ocasión el desea invertir en nuevas herramientas que lo ayuden a mejorar su calidad de trabajo, y es por ello que solicita un pequeño crédito para comprarlos.
texts.en:
Señor Ever Hilario O. was born in Asunción. He lives with Mirian Encina and together they have two children, Génesis and Oscar, who are three and five years old, respectively. He has been a construction worker for over ten years and, thanks to financing from the Fundación, he was able to acquire a small truck and various types of tools that help him grow in his business and receive more important construction jobs. This time, he hopes to invest in new tools that will help him improve the quality of his work, and it is for this reason he is requesting a small loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction tools.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and lives in Benin City with her husband and nine children.  She buys and sells plastic containers and foodstuffs (oil, rice, beans, spices and other cooking staples) and has been building her credit with LAPO for six years now to help grow her business, using the profits to care for her family. 

Mary heard about Kiva from LAPO and would like to be part of the program.  She is asking for a loan of $675 to enhance her business through the purchase of more plastics and foodstuffs.  She says that increasing her stock will help her increase her profit and therefore improve life for her family. She is grateful for any assistance Kiva lenders can give to help her work toward her goals.

loans.use: To buy more plastics and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge tiene 27 años, esta casado con la señora Johanna Duran de 24 años y no tienen hijos todavía por que desean estabilizarse bien económicamente para poder brindarle a su futuro hijo un hogar con todas las comodidades que una familia requiere.

Viven en casa de los padres por el momento, jorge trabajaba anteriormente en una empresa privada como empleado, su hermano que también se dedica a la venta de electrónica lo llevo a trabajar con él. Un día con el ahorro que poseía decidió invertir en su propio local que actualmente es uno de los más prestigiosos de la zona en su rubro.

Necesitan mas mercaderías por la gran cantidad de clientes que posee, desean ampliar su stock de mercadería comprando mas radios, discos, dvd, anteojos para sol, relojes, billeteras, carteras para damas, en lo cual desea invertir el préstamo.
texts.en:
Jorge is 27 years old, married to 24 year old Mrs. Johanna Duran. They don’t have children yet because they want to stabilize themselves economically in order to be able to provide their future child a home with all the comforts that a family requires. They live in his parent’s home at the moment, Jorge used to work in a private business as an employee; his brother worked in electronic sales and took Jorge to work with him. One day with the savings that he had, Jorge decided to invest in his own locale that today is one of the most prestigious in the area. They need more merchandise for the great quantity of customers they serve, they wish to expand their merchandise stock by using the loan to buy more radios, records, dvds, sunglasses, watches, billfolds, wallets.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: radios, records, dvds, sunglasses, watches, billfolds, wallets, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia esta casada con el señor Eugenio Maldonado, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de empanadas, sándwiches, croquetas y otras comidas rápidas.

Sus ventas las realiza de puerta en puerta por el centro de la ciudad de Luque y por su barrio, la misma tiene buen antecedentes de pago con la Fundación Paraguaya.

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de materia prima tales como pan, carne, huevo, jamón, queso y otros.
texts.en:
Lucia is married to Eugenio Maldonado, and she works making and selling empanadas (tortillas dough filled and fried), sandwiches, croquettes and other fast foods.

She sells her wares door to door in the center of the city of Luque and in her neighborhood, and she has a good credit history with Fundacion Paraguaya.

The loan that she would like is to buy ingredients like bread, meat, eggs, ham, cheese and other things.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, eggs, ham, cheese/Compra de carne, huevo, jamón, queso.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen, who is 41years old and married with six children, lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she sells provisions. She took over the business in 1991 from her husband, as they decided that she would run the shop and he would find another income source to help meet the household expenses. Queen likes the business and dedicates her time to its day-to-day operations and planning how to make the business grow.

Queen is asking for a Kiva loan of $850 to buy more provisions. She says that the more selection she is able to offer, the more sales she will be able to make. The capital to keep a store stocked is great while the profits are small and not enough to take care of her family and buy all of the provisions she needs. She is therefore counting on capital from a loan to help her make her shop more successful. She is thankful for any help Kiva lenders can give.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing sells provisions and drinks. She started the business on her own in 2002. She had seen others selling provisions and took an interest. She thought it would be a good business that she could do with a little hard work.

She soon found that hard work was not all she needed, but also capital to purchase the provisions and drinks to have in stock. She turned to LAPO to help and has been borrowing and increasing her credit limit. She is hoping for a loan of US$ 350 from Kiva lenders to help her increase her inventory by purchasing more provisions and thus attract more customers. She says the additional profit will help her cater for her family. She is 38 years old and married with 6 children. Blessing says she will appreciate any assistance Kiva lenders are willing to give her.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María Cristina C. nació en la ciudad de Santa Rosa Misiones, esta casada hace mas de diez años con Francisco Aquino con quien tuvo dos hijos que hoy trabajan en el exterior.

Ella es comerciante, tiene un comedor frente a su domicilio negocio que la ayuda para el ingreso familiar, ahí ella vende comidas rápidas, también ofrece desayunos, almuerzos entre otras cosas. Sus principales clientes son los trabajadores de la zona.

Ella desea adquirir el crédito para invertir en la ampliación y mejora de su local comercial.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina C. was born in the city of Santa Rosa Misiones and she has been married to Francisco Aquino, with whom she has 2 kids who now work abroad, for 10 years.

She is a saleswoman and she has a diner opposite her house, and it is a business which helps the family's income. She sells fast foods as well as breakfasts, lunches and other things. Her main clients are workers from the area.

She would like to get a credit to invest in enlarging and improving her store.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refit her business/Refracción de su negocio.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La Srta. Maria Mercedes es soltera tiene 22 años es estudiante y se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas femeninas que trae desde la argentina y brasil. Actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la Universidad la carrera de Comercio Exterior.

La señorita trabajaba como secretaria en el negocio de los padres un día decidió independizarse y actualmente cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes en la mayoría amigos y parientes. En el futuro le gustaría terminar su carrera Universitaria y abrir una boutique ya que posee experiencia en el ramo.

El préstamo fue invertido en la compra de ropas tales como jeans, remeras, cintos, camisas, carteras.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is single and is 22 years old. She is a student and buys and sells women's clothing which she gets from Argentina and Brazil. She is currently studying Foreign Business at University.

She used to work as a secretary in her parents' business and one day she decided to become more independent and she now has many clients; mostly friends and relatives. In the future she would like to finish her University degree and open a boutique as she has experience in this industry.

She invested the loan in buying clothing like jeans, T-shirts, belts, shirts and wallets.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wallets, T-shirts, jeans, belts, shirts and tops/Para comprar carteras, remeras, vaqueros, cintos, camisas, blusas.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 34 years old and lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she operates a fast food establishment named "Tieless Kitchen." Selling prepared food everyday from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m., Justina has help from her husband and a salesgirl and is working hard to keep her business growing. However, due to a lack of capital, her growth has been slowed and she is not able to afford enough raw ingredients to meet all the demands of her customers and is forced to turn some away. Consequently, she is losing some of her customers to nearby food vendors. Justina cannot afford to lose business and depends on the profit to pay for family expenses.

Justina hopes that Kiva lenders can help fund a loan of $675 to assist her in purchasing more ingredients such as rice and beans to keep her business healthy and meeting customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María O. esta casada con el señor Crispin Ayala, tiene 2 hijas, se dedica a la venta de mercería y bazar al contado o a crédito. La misma se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 5 años, momento después en que el señor Crispin sufrió un accidente de tránsito en el cuál quedó paralítico.

La señora María se encarga de la manutención de su hogar con esta actividad y con la ayuda de una de sus hijas quien es docente.

La misma solicita el préstamo para aumentar el volumen de sus mercaderías a modo de incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Mrs. María O. is married to Mr. Crispin Ayala, has two children and works selling men's clothing and second hand items for cash or on credit. She has been doing this for more than five years, ever since Crispin was in a traffic accident that left him paralyzed. María is in charge of maintaining their home with this business and with the help of one of her daughters who is a teacher. She is requesting a loan to add to the volume of goods in stock in order to increase her sales and her family's income. L

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra remeras, camisas, platos y otros

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Dona is a woman full of strength. She is married with 7 children and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She goes to the villages around Benin City to buy food items and palm oil. She then sells these items in one of Benin City's most popular markets. She started this business in 1994 and has been borrowing from LAPO for 5 years now to help grow her business.  

Dona is asking for a loan of $675 to enable her to buy more food items and palm oil to sell. She will be very grateful to Kiva lenders if they can assist her. She says that it will not only benefit her business by helping achieve her goal of expansion, but also her family, who she helps support with the profits.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
El señor Mariano B. nació en Luque, esta casado con Liliana Vera desde hace dos años con quien tuvo tres hijos, Jesús, Joan y María Lujan con 7, 4 y un año respectivamente.

Se dedica a la venta ambulante de accesorios electrónicos y chipa.

Con el crédito que solicita el desea adquirir una moto para poder movilizarse de una manera mas rápida y ampliar su mercado de venta.
texts.en:
Mr. Mariano B. was born in Luque. He has been married to Liliana Vera for two years and they have three children, Jesús, Joan and María Lujan who are seven, four and one year old respectively. He works as a street vendor selling electronic accessories and cheese breads. With the loan that he is requesting he wants to purchase a motorcycle so he can get around faster and increase the size of his market.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle to be used while selling goods

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
La señora Ursula Fernandez de Medina esta casada con el señor Mario Medina, emigraron de Puerto Casado a la ciudad de Luque hace más de 10 años, tiene 3 hijos.

Poseen una despensa en su domicilio donde surte a sus vecinos de insumos de primera necesidad tales como carne, arroz, leche, carbón, azúcar y otros.

El señor Mario además ayuda a la manutención del hogar através del ingreso que genera como empleado de una metalúrgica. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de los citados insumos y opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 1996.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ursula F. de Medina is married to Mr. Mario Medina. They emigrated from Puerto Casado to the city of Luque more than 10 years ago and have three children. They have a store in their home where they sell basic necessities like meat, rice, milk, charcoal, sugar and other items to their neighbors. Mario also helps with household expenses with the money he earns working in metallurgy. The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase the aforementioned goods. She has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 1996.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, beverages, dairy products and other merchandise

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
El señor Victor A. nació en Concepción, vive con Rosana Ramírez hace mas de diez años con quien tuvo una hija llamada Jeny de 10 años.

Es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de artículos como agendas, bolígrafos, accesorios para teléfonos móviles entre otros.

Gracias al financiamiento de la Fundación pudo aumentar su nivel comercial y consecuentemente su ingreso familiar.

Desea el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor A. was born in Concepción. He has lived with Rosana Ramírez for more than 10 years and they have a daughter named Jeny who is 10 years old. He is a salesman who works selling items like agendas, pens and mobile telephone accessories among other things. Thanks to the financing provided by the Foundation he has been able to increase his sales and consequently his family's income. He is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electronic goods and items like flashlights, CDs, radios and mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Trabajadoras se formó con varias integrantes del comité Mujeres Luchadoras del barrio María Blanca de Yka´a el cual se disolvió por diversos motivos, las mismas conformaron el nuevo grupo a causa de que quisieron seguir aprovechando el programa del comité para seguir creciendo personal, laboral y comunitariamente. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 16 integrantes y se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa.

1. - Angela A. invertirá en la compra de joyas de plata.

2. - Oliva Insfran invertirá en la compra de carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas, carbón, panificados, arroz, azúcar, fideo.

3. - Analia C. invertirá en la compra de carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas, carbón, panificados, arroz, azúcar, fideo.

4. - Myrian Estela M. invertirá en la compra de hierbas medicinales.

5. - Luisa Fernandez invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short.

6. - Sonia L. invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos

7. - Otilia P. invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos

8. - María Selva M. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short.

9. - Angelina C. invertirá en la compra de químicos para la realización de productos de limpieza.

10. - Alejandra C. invertirá en la compra de carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas, carbón, panificados, arroz, azúcar.

11. - Antonia D. invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos.

12. - Porfiria V. invertirá en la compra de hierbas medicinales

13. - Cinthia Ávalos invertirá en la compra de hierbas medicinales y manzanas, peras, mandarinas, naranjas, bananas.

14. - Maida Jacinta R. invertirá en la compra químicos para la realización de productos de limpieza.

15. - Idalina A. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, discos para empanadas, tomates, lechuga, servilletas, mayonesa, mostaza, etc.

16. - Digna Bordón invertirá en la compra de carbón.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Trabajadoras" group was formed by various members of the "Mujeres Luchadoras" group from the María Blanca de Yka'a neighborhood when it broke up for several different reasons. The women formed the new group because they wanted to continue to take advantage of the group's program to continue growing personally, through business and as a community. Now the group is made up of 16 members and they are currently in the second cycle of the program.

1. - Ángela A. will purchase silver jewelry. 2. - Oliva Insfran will buy meat, vegetables, cooking oil, beer, charcoal, baked goods, rice, sugar and pasta. 3. - Analia C. will also invest in meat, vegetables, cooking oil, beer, charcoal, baked goods, rice, sugar and pasta. 4. - Myrian Estela M. will purchase medicinal herbs. 5. - Luisa F. will buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and shorts. 6. - Sonia L. will buy fabric and thread. 7. - Otilia P. invertirá will also buy fabric and thread. 8. - María Selva M. plans to also buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and shorts. 9. - Angelina C. will invest in chemicals with which she will make cleaning products. 10. - Alejandra C. will purchase meat, vegetables, cooking oil, beer, charcoal, baked goods, rice and sugar. 11. - Antonia D. will buy fabric and thread. 12. - Porfiria Velázquez will purchase herbal medicines. 13. - Cinthia Ávalos will buy herbal medicines, apples, pears, mandarins, oranges and bananas. 14. - Maida Jacinta R. will invest in chemicals that she will use to make cleaning products. 15. - Idalina A. will purchase soft drinks, pastry to make empanadas, tomatoes, lettuce, napkins, mayonnaise and mustard. 16. - Digna Bordón will buy charcoal.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: San Paulo Group

texts.es:
El comité San Paulo se formó gracias que la señora Gladis A. se informó del programa y organizo a sus amigas para formar un comité. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 15 integrantes y se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa. 1. - Gladis M. invertirá en la compra de panificados, huevo, carne, mayonesa.

2. - Leonisia S. invertirá en la compra de panificados, carne, verdura.

3. - Etelvina G. invertirá en la compra de helados al por mayor para luego venderlos.

4. - Hilaria R. invertirá en la compra de golosinas, gaseosa, lácteos

5. - Cristina O. invertirá en la compra de frutas y verduras al por mayor para luego venderlos.

6. - Eduvigis C. invertirá en la compra de embutidos, panificados, mayonesa, Ketchup.

7. - Bernarda A. invertirá en la compra de bebidas, lacteos, panificados, arroz, azucar, yerba.

8. - Blanca Domínguez invertirá en la compra de prendas en general.

9. - Lujan C. invertirá en la compra de carbón al por mayor para luego venderlo.

10. - Silvina D. invertirá en la compra de frutas al por mayor para luego venderlos.

11. - Gladis A. invertirá en la compra insumo para la elaboración de producto de limpieza.

12. - Gilda López invertirá en la compra de lacteo, panificados enlatados, bebidas.

13. - Basiliacia Troche invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, ect. 14. - Francisca T. invertirá en la compra de carne, panificados, embutidos, tomate lechuga.

15. - Eusebia M. invertirá en la compra de bebidas panificados, lacteos, frutas, verduras.
texts.en:
The San Paulo group was formed thanks to Ms. Gladis A. who learned about the program and organized her friends into a committee. Currently the group is composed of 15 members and they are in their first cycle of the program. 1. - Gladis M. invests in the purchase of baked goods, eggs, meat and mayonnaise.

2. - Leonisia S. invests in the purchase of baked goods, meat, vegetables

3. - Etelvina G. invests in the purchase of ice cream in bulk to sell.

4. - Hilaria R. invests in the purchase of candy, soft drinks, milk products

5. - Cristina O. invests in the purchase of fruits and vegetables in bulk

6. - Eduvigis C. invests in the purchase of cold meats, baked goods, mayonnaise, ketchup

7. - Bernarda A. invests in the purchase of drinks, milk products, baked goods, rice, sugar, tea.

8. - Blanca Domínguez invests in the purchase of clothing in general.

9. - Lujan C. invests in the purchase of coal in bulk to sell

10. - Silvina D. invests in the purchase of fruit in bulk to sell

11. - Gladis A. invests in the purchase of ingredients to make cleaning products.

12. - Gilda López invests in the purchase of milk products, baked goods, canned goods,drinks.

13. - Basiliacia Troche invests in the purchase of fabrics, yarns, etc. 14. - Francisca T. iinvests in the purchase of meat, baked goods, cold meats, tomatoes and lettuce.

15. - Eusebia M. invests in the purchase of drinks, baked goods, milk products, fruits and vegetables


Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables, oil, beer, coal, baked goods, herbal medicines, pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, timber, apples, pears, tangerines, oranges, bananas, soda, dough for pies, tomatoes, lettuce, napkins , mayonnaise, mustard, etc..

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero is 60 years old and lives in Benin City with her husband and eight children.  She has been selling firewood since 1988, having learned the business from her mother, and uses all of the profits from her sales to help care for her family.  

Up to this point she has operated with little capital, but with demand for firewood growing, Vero is missing out on business due to a lack of capital to keep a larger stock of firewood on hand.  She is therefore hoping that Kiva lenders can help her with a loan of $525 to enable her to buy more firewood to sell.  With the loan, she will be able to go to the forest and buy the wood in bulk for a lower per-piece rate.  She will thus be able to sell more and make more profit to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Oluchi

texts.en:
Oluchi is 29 years old and married with 3 children.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she is a food vendor.  She has her shop in one of the semi-urban areas of Benin City.  She likes cooking.  It was a hobby before she decided to go into food vending for a living.  She is happy with her decision as she still enjoys cooking and it helps her take care of her family.  

Her goal, now, is to expand the business and open a more beautiful restaurant where she can seat no less than 20 people at one time.  But for now, she needs a loan of $425 to buy more foodstuffs (cooking staples) and drinks to meet the demands of the customers.  Perhaps she will use a future loan and some of the savings she is building to realize her dreams for the future.  

She thanks the Kiva lenders for any assistance they can provide and says that your efforts are good.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Chicas De Monique Group

texts.es:
El Comitè “Las Chicas de Monique” se formó a partir de la unión de varias vecinas del barrio Barsequillo de San Lorenzo, este comité desde un principio se ha mostrado sólido en cuanto a su organización y muy activo y participativo a la vez.

Todas las integrantes del comité tienen en común la venta de productos cosméticos de la Hines Monique de ahí el nombre de dicho comité. En la fotografía tomada, se encuentran todas las integrantes del comité. Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades propias, desarrollan sus emprendimientos en un tiempo extra para acrecentar sus ingresos. Sus integrantes han demostrado su unidad estableciendo normas y reglamentos internos a ser cumplidos, a más de organizar ferias de comidas y rifas para obtener fondos para el Comité.
texts.en:
The Committee “Las Chicas de Monique” formed beginning with the meeting of various neighbors in Barsequillo de San Lorenzo. Since its beginning this committee has demonstrated itself to be solid with regard to its organization and is very active and has good participation. All the members of the committee have selling Hines Monique cosmetics in common and that is where the name of the committee came from. In the photograph you will find all the members of the committee. All the members have their own businesses, they are developing their businesses as part time businesses to increase their income. The members have demonstrated their unity establishing internal norms and rules to follow, they organize food markets and raffles to obtain funds for the committee.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty O., 36 years old and married with five children, lives in Benin City, Nigeria with her family. In 1992, after a three-year training period, she opened a patent store where she sells medicine and treats minor injuries and illnesses in her community.

Betty has been building her credit with LAPO for two years and hopes for a $425 loan from Kiva lenders to buy more medicine to help her better treat the sick and injured in her community as well as meet the expenses of her family. She thanks you for any assistance you can provide her.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her shop.

loans.name: Eudelio

texts.es:
El Sr Eudelio , de 28 años de edad,  y su hermano Alfredo T. de 29  años se dedican  juntos  a una fábrica de elaboración de cucuruchos para helados, la misma está situada en su domicilio en la ciudad de
Ñemby , y tienen mucha clientela  formada .
Ellos comentan que  cuando chicos vivian en el interior del pais  y luego sus padres decidieron venir para Asunción para buscar nuevos horizontes , entonces empezaron a trabajar en una fabrica de cucuruchos desde muy jóvenes , más adelante fueron ahorrando para poder comprar su primera  máquina y luego se independizaron, al principio les costo mucho comentan porque tenian que buscar clientela y tratar de hacer conocer sus productos, pero gracias a sus esfuerzos fueron afianzándose y  lograron tener  buena clientela tambien eran solo ellos dos pero hoy día ya cuentan con 3 máquinas y cuatro personales , el crédito invirtió para la adquisición de una nueva máquina.
texts.en:
Eudelio is 28 years old and his brother, Alfredo T., is 29. Together, they dedicate themselves to making ice cream cones. Their factory is located in their home, in the city of Nemby, and they have a well-established customer base.

They tell us that when they were small they lived in the interior part of the country, and later their parents decided to come to Asunción to seek new horizons. They began working at a cone factory while still very young, later saving enough to buy their own machine and becoming independent. At first, they recall, it cost them quite a bit because they had to build a clientele and make their products known. But, thanks to their efforts, they got stronger and attracted customers. Also, back then it was only the two of them but today they have 3 machines and 4 employees. The loan is to invest into the purchase of a new machine.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a machine to make ice cream cones.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia lives in Benin City with her husband and 9 children.  She has been a LAPO borrower for 2 years and is working hard to grow her business.  

She learned her trade from her mother who sold foodstuffs throughout Felicia's childhood.  Felicia opened her own shop in 2000, hoping to become a major distributor in the foodstuffs business.  She's still working toward that goal, but, as many Nigerian traders will tell you, "capital is our problem."  

Felicia is hoping that Kiva lenders will assist her with a loan of $425 to buy more foodstuffs.  She says that this will help her.  "The amount of goods I buy from the villages where I can get them cheaper, determines the amount of sales I make and my profits," says Felicia.  

She is grateful for your assistance and hopes that you will help her take one more step towards her goal of distribution.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ramiro Pedro

texts.es:
Ramiro R. es taxista y trabaja en la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto, el vehículo es de su propiedad. Vive en la zona de Villa Salome, en la casa de sus padres, pero es el único que genera ingresos para solventar alimentación y otros gastos de la familia. 
Solicita crédito para construir una habitación para ampliar sus comodidades. Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito en Impro y la segunda que espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva. El anterior crédito le sirvió para mantenimiento de vehículo, lo cual le permitió mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ramiro R. is a taxi driver and works in the cities of La Paz and El Alto and he owns his vehicle. He lives in the Villa Saloma area in a house with his parents, but he is the only one that generates income to provide for food and other expenses of the family. He requests a loan to construct a room to expand their facilities. It is the second time that he has asked for credit from Impro and the second time that he hopes to have the support of Kiva. The previous loan was for vehicle maintenance, which enabled him to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for investment

loans.name: Riches

texts.en:
Riches A. is 39 years old and lives in Benin City where she apprenticed to be a fashion designer with a tailor for five years before starting her own shop in 2000. She designs styles to sew out of wrappers (Nigerian sarongs) for her customers and makes profit from her work.

Up to this point her customers have picked their fabric elsewhere and brought it to her, but she has decided to expand her business by adding the sale of fabric to her tailoring/design business. However, Riches doesn't have the capital to make this improvement, so she is hoping that Kiva lenders will help her achieve this goal with a loan of $675. She thanks you for your help and says that Kiva is helping many.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for her business.

texts.es:
Rosario A. se dedica a la compra y venta de detergentes,  su esposo le ayuda en el negocio como repartidor en las oficinas y domicilios de la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto.
La pareja tiene tres hijos en edad escolar que también le ayudan en el negocio debido a que los esposos no pueden contratar asistentes y además desean que todos los ingresos sean para la familia.
El domicilio familiar esta ubicado en la zona de villa san Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz, la pareja paga un alquiler.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (detergentes de limpieza).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el historial le califica como cliente 1, es decir, buen  cumplimento en el pago de créditos
texts.en:
Rosario A. is dedicated to the purchase and sale of detergents. Her husband helps her in the business, making deliveries to offices and homes in the city of La Paz and El Alto.

The couple has three school-aged children who also help with the business because they cannot afford to hire assistants, and also because they would like to keep all income for the family.

The family home is rented, and located in the San Antonio village of the city of La Paz.

The loan would be destined for the purchase of merchandise (cleaning detergents).

This is the second time that she seeks a loan in IMRPO, and previous history qualifies her as a 1 customer; that is, loan payments were made in good form.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ashaghe

texts.en:
Ashaghe learned about selling baby things from her mother who sold before her, and she opened her own store in 2000. She says she wanted to start the business much earlier in her life but didn't have the capital to purchase the initial stock to get started. She was into small trading before she heard of LAPO and took her first loan. This loan enabled her to enter the business she dreamed of.

Now she travels to the market and buys baby things (clothes, lotions, etc.) in bulk to get a good price and sells them in her shop. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will support her efforts by granting her a loan of $600 to increase her inventory and better run her business and support her family. Ashaghe is 49 years old and has 6 children.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Romualda

texts.es:
Romualda M. tiene un taller donde elabora mantas y mantillas. Estas son comercializadas en su puesto, ubicado en la zona de San Pedro.
Romualda tiene cuatro hijas, todas trabajan en su taller y le brindan gran ayuda, de hecho, ellas son las responsables de la buena situación económica de la madre.
Romualda vive en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de lana e hilo.
Es la décima segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como una clienta excelente.
texts.en:
Romualda M. has a workshop where she makes capes and shawls. She sells them in her stall, located in the San Pedro zone. Romualda has four daughters, all of whom work in her studio and provide great help. In fact, they are responsible for the good economic situation of their mother. Romualda lives in the area of Llojeta in the city of La Paz. The loan will be set aside to purchase wool and yarn. It is the tenth time she has requested a loan from Impro; her record shows that she is an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero, 53 years old and married with seven children, lives in Benin City where she sells prepared food to her neighbors and hungry passersby. She learned the trade from a friend of hers, training for a year before opening her own restaurant in 1973. This business has enabled her to contribute greatly to household expenses and provide a good life for her children by feeding, clothing and educating them.

Vero has been building her credit with LAPO for the past three years and is now hoping for a loan of $275 that she will use along with her own savings to buy more foodstuffs and ingredients to cook with. She says thank you for any assistance you can provide.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton R. es carpintero, elabora muebles de todo tipo como también arreglos en general, tiene dos hijos pequeños y su esposa realiza labores de casa.
Su taller y casa se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Villa Armonía de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de madera (mara, roble, gabú, venesta, cola y clavos)
Es la Quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial es bastante alentador por lo que recomendamos ayudar a esta persona.
texts.en:
Milton R. is a carpenter and produces furniture of all kinds and arrangements. He has two young children and his wife works at home.His shop and home are located in the area of Villa Harmony in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used for the purchase of wood (mara, oak, gabú), glue and nails. It is the fifth time he is requesting a credit from Impro and his history is encouraging, which is why we recommend helping this person.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
El sr. Eusebio González tiene 53 años y esta casado con la sra. Francisca González de 45 años, tienen 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están trabajando actualmente en la Argentina , los mismos tienen 27 , 24 y 22 respectivamente. Los 3 restantes viven con el y el mayor que tiene 29 años trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transporte de cargas , uno de 26 años que se encarga de atender a los clientes de la parrillada y una de 20 años que esta cursando la carrera de ingeniería comercial.

El sr . Eusebio posee la parrillada desde hace 10 años sobre la Avda. Acceso Sur donde prepara carne asada a la parrilla y a la estaca. También preparan minutas como empanadas, tortillas y otros tipos de comestibles.

El mismo desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de un refrigerador panorámico para poder tener mayor volumen de bebidas para la venta, también en la compra de mesas y sillas para poder brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Eusebio G. is 53 years old and has been married to Mrs. Francisca G. for 45 years. They have 6 children, 3 of which are currently working in Argentina and are 27, 24 and 22 respectively. The other three live with them. The oldest is 29 years old and works as a driver in a cargo transport company, one is 26 and is in charge of taking care of the customers at the grill and one is 20 years old and is studying for a career in commercial engineering. Mr. Eusebio has had a barbecue for 10 years on Access South Ave. where he prepares roast meat on the grill and on large stakes over coals. He also prepares dishes such as empanadas (stuffed pastries), tortillas and other items to eat. He wants to invest the loan in the purchase an industrial refrigerator to be able to have a greater volume of drinks for sale, and also to purchase tables and chairs in order to provide greater convenience to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase industrial refrigerator, tables and chairs

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
El Sr. Federico Z. Tiene 54 años , esta casado con la sra. Florentina Santacruz de 50 años y tienen 3 hijos, una de 21 años que esta cursando el segundo año de Ciencias Contables , un hijo de 20 años que cursa el primer año de Derecho y la ultima de 8 años que esta cursando sus estudios primarios.

El mismo posee una herrería en su domicilio desde el año 1985, donde fabrica verjas, rejas, portones y sillas de hierro. La esposa es docente jubilada por lo que también aporta a la canasta familiar.

El sr. Federico desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de caños en forma mayorista para la fabricación de rejas y portones, de esa manera obtendría mejor precios por sus insumos y aumentaría las ganancias sobre los trabajos que esta realizando
texts.en:
Mr. Federico Z. is 54 years old and married to Mrs. Florentina Santacruz, who is 50 years old. The couple has three children. Their oldest daughter is 21 and is currently in her second year of college, where she studies accounting. Their son is 20 and is currently in his first year of law school, and their youngest daughter is 8 years old and still in elementary school.

He has run a blacksmith's shop out of his house since 1985, where he makes wrought-iron gates, railings, gates and iron chairs. His wife is a retired teacher, so she too contributes to household spending with her pension.

Mr. Federico would like to use this loan to buy pipes in bulk, which he will use to make fences and gates. By buying in bulk, he gets a better price on the materials he needs to do his work, and earns more for each piece he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different-length metal pipes to build railings and gates

loans.name: Jorge Guillermo

texts.es:
Jorge C.  tiene una  vagoneta  con la cuál trabaja como taxi en la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto. El transporte le permite tener ingresos decentes  y cubrir los gastos familiares ya que tiene que enviar dinero al exterior (giros) porque sus hijas se encuentran estudiando en la Republica de Argentina.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para la compra de un nuevo motor, llantas y una reparación completa del vehiculo
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial nos dice que merece toda la colaboración financiera que necesite.
texts.en:
Jorge C. has a station wagon which he uses as a taxi in the city of La Paz and El Alto. Transportation allows him to have a decent income and to cover family expenses that he has to send money abroad because his daughters are studying in Argentina. His home is located in the area of Pampahasi in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase a new engine, tires and to fully repair his vehicle. This is the third time that he has requested a loan from Impro and his history tells us that he deserves all of the financial assistance he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Florinda B. Alfonso tiene 61 años y es soltera. Tiene hijos mayores que ya son independiente, tiene una peluqueria que ella misma atiende.

La sra. Florinda se dedica en el rubro hace 7 años , empezo con un local prestado por una amiga suya, despues de varios cursos y especializaciones logro actualizarse y formar una clientela satisfecha por sus servicios. Cuenta tambien que despues de un tiempo corto logro independizarse y ya alquilar su propio local. Con sus primeras ganancias logro adquirir maquinarias y articulos para equipar su peluqueria.

La sra. Florinda desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de nuevos articulos y maquinarias ya que las que tiene perdieron su vida util, la demanda de clietnes y la competencia les exige dicha inversion para satisfacer al 100% de sus clientes
texts.en:
Mrs. Florinda B. Alfonso is 61 years old and single. Her children are older and are now independent. She has a hair salon that she runs herself.

Florinda has been doing this work for seven years. She started with a locale loaned to her by a friend. After several courses and specializations she was up to date and established a clientele that was satisfied by her services. She also tells us that after a short time she was able to become independent and now rents her own space. With her first earnings she was able to buy the equipment needed for the salon.

Florinda wishes to invest her loan in the purchase of new items and equipment because the ones that she has are no longer useful. The demand of her clients and the competition requires that she make this investment to be able to satisfy 100% of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new equipment for a hair salon

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Mabel Iluminada C. tiene 40 años y esta casada con el  sr. Nery Alberto Medina de 50 años. Tienen 3 hijos de 12 , 10 y 8 años respestivamente, todos cursando sus estudios primarios.
La sra. Mabel se dedica a la confecciòn de prendas de vestir desde hace 15 años , la misma confecciona para diferentes negocios que estan en el Mercado municipal Nª 4 donde cobra por prenda confeccionada, ya que los mismos negocios le dan la tela y los insumos para los mismos. El conyuge trabaja como diseñador en la Empresa Aldito en el dpto. De producciòn y de esa manera colabora con la canasta familiar.
La sra, Mabel desea invertir el ptmo. En la compra de una maquina de coser  para la confecciòn de remeras tipo Polo ya que tiene un importante pedido de dicha prenda de todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mabel Iluminada C. is 40 years old and is married to Mr. Nery Alberto Medina who is 50 years of age. They have 3 children, ages 12, 10 and 8 years respectively, all of whom are in primary school. Mabel has worked making clothing for the past 15 years, which she produces for different businesses that are in the municipal market Nª 4. She charges by item produced as the business themselves give her the fabric and materials for them. Her husband works as a designer in the Aldito Company in the production department and through this he contributes to the household budget. Mabel would like to invest the loan in the purchase of a sewing machine to produce polo shirts as she already has an important order for this item from all of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machines to make shirts

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy, 54 years old and married with 5 children, sells garri, a Nigerian staple made from ground and fried cassava.  Going to the villages to buy already processed garri, she returns to the city to sell to her customers at a profit.  Mercy started this business in 1983 and has been working to expand with help from LAPO for the past four years.  A faithful and trustworthy borrower, she now seeks a loan of $425 to buy more garri to sell.  The more that she can purchase on each trip, the greater will be the productivity of her travel, and the resulting increase in profit will allow her to better support her family.  Mercy says, "God bless you, Kiva!"

loans.use: To buy more garri to sell.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony has been in the welding business since 1986.  He works on and makes iron doors, windows, etc.  He trained to do this work for 3 years before opening his own business.  Now he has many apprentices working for him and learning.  However, he is having trouble maximizing their productivity with only one welding machine.  He needs an additional welding machine and materials to better instruct his apprentices and meet customer demands.  Anthony is 40 years old and expecting a new baby.  He is asking for a loan of $425 to add to his own savings to purchase another machine.  He says this will help his business greatly as well as help him provide for his growing family.  He thanks you for any assistance you can give for his loan.

loans.use: To purchase one wielding machine

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero, 48 years old and married with nine children, lives in Benin City where she sells provisions and soup ingredients, a business she started in 1988.  She goes to one of Benin's major markets once a day to buy her goods and takes them back to her neighborhood where she sells to her community.  

Vero has been borrowing for some time from LAPO Microfinance to help grow her business and has consistently repaid her loans.  She is hopeful that Kiva lenders will help her as well.  Vero is requesting a loan of $275 to enable her to buy more provisions and soup ingredients to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and soup ingredients.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comitè “Mujeres Unidas” se encuentra en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, todas sus integrantes son vecinas del barrio Ypati de dihca ciudad.

Las integrantes del comité son todas madres y a la vez trabajadoras incansables que se esfuerzan cada dia para acrecentar sus ingresos. En el comité de mujeres tienen la oportunidad acceder a creditos para poder financiar sus emprendimientos, lo que les permite contar con un capital de trabajo para dinamizar sus actividades economicas.

El comité lleva dos años trabajando y en este tiempo ha veneficiado a varias personas, pues en dicho comité pueden acceder facilmente a un credito. Las integrantes llevan entre si una armoniosa relacion y una solidaridad constante, lo que ha permitido que el comité perdure en el tiempo.

Los creditos que solicitan cada una serán destinados para la compra de varios articulos, la mayoria de ellos, materia prima o articulos de mercancia para los emprendimientos de las integrantes del comité. Algunos de estos articulos son: carnes, azucar, arroz, verduras, lacteos,queso, etc; estos estos productos son para aquellas señoras que poseen despensa, kiscos, etc., mientras que las otras personas que se dedican a la venta de dulces, fabricación de productos de limpieza y venta de ropas utilizaron su credito para la compra de articulos para la venta, tales como azucar, productos quimicos para materia prima o introduciendo nuevos productos para la venta, como ropas a la moda, nuevos productos de limpieza, etc. Por ejemplo, la Sra Mirtha Elizabeth Sanchez, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas ha invertido su prestamo íntegramente en la compra de dicha mercaderia aprovechando los buenos precios en un local. Dicha situacion le permite comprar mas barato y acrecentar la variedad y la cantidad de los productos que ofrece y a la vez acrecentar su margen de ganancias.

El detalle de las actividades que realiza cada una se cita a continuación: 1. Elsa Esther A. de R. – compra y venta de comidas.

2. Panfila C. de Gimenez – venta de ropas.

3. Ramona C. – Venta de carbón.

4. Demetria C. – Fabricacion y venta de detergentes.

5. Petrona C. – Costurera.

6. Rosa Asuncion M. – Copetín.

7. Ceferina M. – Venta de dulces y tortas.

8. Librada C. – Despensa.

9. Antonia Noemi L. – Venta de verduras.

10. Zunilda Ramona H. – Fabricacion y venta de detergentes.

11. - Daniela F. – Venta de verduras.

12. Basilia M. Irala – Venta de ropas.

13. Elida B. – Modista.

14. Gloria M. Guanes – Venta de frutas y verduras.

15. Liz Marina R. – Venta de cosmeticos.

16. - Ester A. – Costurera.

17. Gloria Fatima C. – Dspensa.

18. Mirtha Elizabeth Z. – Venta de ropas.

19. Ana Maria H. – Venta de helados.

20. Clotilde R. Cabello – venta de juegos de azar y loterias
texts.en:
The “United Women” committee is located in the city of Villa Elisa. All of its members are neighbors in the Ypati neighborhood of that city.

The committee members are all mothers and at the same time untiring workers who work hard to increase their incomes. The women’s committee has the opportunity to access loans to be able to finance their enterprises, which allows them to have working capital to strengthen their economic activities. .

The committee has been working for two years and in this time has veneficiado various people, so in this committee they can easily access a loan. The members have a harmonious relationship among themselves and a constant solidarity, which has allowed the committee to endure with time. .

The loans that each one is requesting will be directed towards the purchase of various items, the majority of them raw materials or merchandise for the committee members’ enterprises. Some of these items are: meat, sugar, rice, vegetables, milk products, cheese, etc. These products are for those women who have grocery stores, kiosks, etc. while the other people who work selling sweets, making cleaning products and in clothing sales used their loan to buy articles to sell such as sugar, chemicals products for raw materials or introducing new products for sale such as fashionable clothing, new cleaning products etc. For example, Mirtha Elizabeth Sanchez, who works selling clothing has invested her loan completely in the purchase of that merchandise taking advantage of the good prices in a store. Such as situation will allow her to buy less expensively and increase the variety and quantity of the products that she offers while also increasing her profit margin.

The detail of the activities that each on carries out is noted in the following: 1. Elsa Esther A. de R. Ð purchase and sale of foods. 2. Panfila C. de Gimenez Ð clothing sales. 3. Ramona C. Ð Charcoal sales. 4. Demetria C. Ð Production and sale of detergents. 5. Petrona C. Ð Seamstress. 6. Rosa Asuncion M. Ð Snacks. 7. Ceferina M. Ð Sale of candies and cakes. 8. Librada C. Ð Grocery store 9. Antonia Noemi L. Ð Vegetable sales. 10. Zunilda Ramona H. Ð Production and sale of detergents. 11. - Daniela F. Ð Vegetable sales 12. Basilia M. Irala Ð Clothing sales 13. Elida B. Ð Dressmaker 14. Gloria M. Guanes Ð Sale of fruits and vegetables. 15. Liz Marina R. Ð Cosmetic sales. 16. - Ester A. Ð Seamstress. 17. Gloria Fatima C. Ð Grocery store 18. Mirtha Elizabeth Z. Ð Clothing sales. 19. Ana Maria H. Ð Ice cream sales. 20. Clotilde R. Cabello Ð Sale of games and lottery tickets. El detalle de las actividades que realiza cada una se cita a continuación: 1. Elsa Esther A. de R. Ð compra y venta de comidas.

2. Panfila C. de Gimenez Ð venta de ropas.

3. Ramona C. Ð Venta de carbón.

4. Demetria C. Ð Fabricacion y venta de detergentes.

5. Petrona C. Ð Costurera.

6. Rosa Asuncion M. Ð Copetín.

7. Ceferina M. Ð Venta de dulces y tortas.

8. Librada C. Ð Despensa.

9. Antonia Noemi L. Ð Venta de verduras.

10. Zunilda Ramona H. Ð Fabricacion y venta de detergentes.

11. - Daniela F. Ð Venta de verduras.

12. Basilia M. Irala Ð Venta de ropas.

13. Elida B. Ð Modista.

14. Gloria M. Guanes Ð Venta de frutas y verduras.

15. Liz Marina R. Ð Venta de cosmeticos.

16. - Ester A. Ð Costurera.

17. Gloria Fatima C. Ð Dspensa.

18. Mirtha Elizabeth Z. Ð Venta de ropas.

19. Ana Maria H. Ð Venta de helados.

20. Clotilde R. Cabello Ð venta de juegos de azar y loterias


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise like clothig, charcoal, fruit, vegetables canned goods, rice, sugar, fabric and thread.

loans.name: Cordellia

texts.en:
Cordellia is 35 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells drinks and table water. She learned the business from her uncle and started her own shop in 2006.

Cordellia says that her business is good but it takes a lot of work. She is open six days a week from 6 am to 6 pm. She does this so that she can afford her family's basic living expenses. Cordellia is asking for a loan of $425 to enable her to buy more drinks and table water to sell to her thirsty customers.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells foodstuffs such as rice, oil, spices and other cooking staples, a business she started with the help and support of her husband after having watched her mother run her own business for a number of years. Over the past nine years, Florence has become self-reliant through help from LAPO Microfinance, and now she and her husband can contribute equally to the family upkeep.

Florence has been able to manage her business with the loans she has previously been granted from LAPO. Now she hopes that Kiva lenders will help her grow her business as well. She is asking for a loan of $425 to buy more foodstuffs for sale and hopes to be a "big business woman" in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Ifeanyi

texts.en:
Ifeanyi, 57 years old and married with 6 children, lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she is a yam wholesaler. Travelling to the north of Nigeria to buy yams (this can be a 4 or 5 day journey), she loads them onto a shared lorry and meets them back in Benin City where she distributes them to other retailers. She has been doing well in her business, but now needs capital to finance her trips north.

The purchase of yams and transportation is costly, and during one of her recent trips north, she had an accident. Her goods were damaged and she was hospitalized for several months. During her recovery she ran low on money, which affected her ability to make her yam-buying trips profitable, thereby making it difficult to sustain her business. She is therefore in need of capital and hopes that Kiva lenders can help her. She is requesting a loan of $675 to enable her to restart her yam business and better contribute to her family's expenses. "I will be very grateful to you, Kiva, if you can help me come out of my predicament," Ifeanyi says.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious, 36 and married with five children, is a yam seller at the New Benin Market, one of Benin City's largest markets. Precious has been buying yams from wholesalers and selling to people who visit her market stall since 2005. She likes the business because she enjoys building relationships with her customers, and considers good service a key element to business success.

Precious now needs a loan of $425 to purchase more yams to keep her stock up. While she is getting by, she hopes that the extra profit will enable her to take better care of her family and support the growth of her business. She is thankful for assistance from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El Comitè “San Miguel” se encuentra en la ciudad de Guarambare, todas sus integrantes son vecinas del barrio San Miguel de dihca ciudad. 
Las integrantes del comité se unieron y decidieron formar un comité de mujeres porque necesitaban creditos para capitalizar sus emprendimientos, pero no podian acceder a ninguno de los creditos ofrecidos normalmente en el mercador financiero. Formando un comité pudieron acceder a un credito rápido y facil que les reporta toda la utilidad para el tipo de trabajos que realizan. En principio el comité encontró muchas dificultades en su organización, y si bien todas las integrantes son vecinas, hubieron personas que no pudieron adaptarse al trabajo en equipo y tuvieron que apartarse de la organización.
