Antonia es una mujer casad, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 12 años. Inició el negocio para tener ingresos y pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Comenzó hace dos años vendiendo ropa en su domicilio a sus conocidos y poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Antonia is a married woman. Her husband works as a farmer and together they have 3 children aged 8, 15 and 12 years old. She started her business to have an income to pay for her children's schooling. She started two years ago selling clothes from her home, selling to her acquaintances. Slowly but surely she started a good client base.

She require a loan in the amount of $250, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months. She will used the funds to purchase merchandise. With your support she will continue to move forward.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma Delia inició el negocio porque anteriormente se dedicaba al hogar y se decidió a poner un negocio para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos; y ella deseaba obtener ingresos para pagara los gastos escolares de sus 4 hijos. Comenzó hace 4 años puso una papelería como un negocio que le diera ingresos para los gastos de la casa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo ella podrá seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Alma Delia started her business because she used to only stay at home but then she decided to start a business to give her children a better quality of life. She wanted to obtain an income to cover the schooling expeditures for her 4 children. About 4 years agos she set up an school supply store as a small business to provide her some money to cover the household expenses.

She requires a loan in the amount of $475 US, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months. The funds will be used to purchase merchandise. With your support she will continue moving forward.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio inició el negocio por que es el oficio que aprendió desde joven para obtener ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia. Comenzó hace once años cuando estableció en el mercado una peluquería propia ya que tengo 46 años en el oficio de peluquero y esto le ha dado prestigio ya que mucha gente acude con el porque les gusta el servicio que les brinda.

El necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar herramientas de trabajo y renovar el mobiliario para los clientes.
texts.en:
Julio began his business because it is the one that he learned since he was a child. He did this in order to get an income and to improve the lives of the members of his family. He began 11 years ago when he established a barbershop of his own in the market. He has 46 years in the business of cutting hair, and this has given him prestige so that many people go to him because they like the service that he provides. He needs a loan of US $750 that he will repay in 6 months in order to buy tools for his work and to renovate the furnishings of the shop for his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and renovate his shop

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita inició el negocio cuando su esposo se quedo sin trabajo, y ante L. falta D. ingresos económicos que le permitiera tener el sustento básico para sus hijos decidió vender productos por catalogo. Comenzó en el año 2000, cuando una comadre le presto sus catálogos y le empezó a ayudar a vender, después elL. fue creando sus clientes y decidió independizarse y hacer L. ventas directamente, obteniendo así mejores ingresos.

ElL. necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagar en 6 meses para comprar el nuevo catalogo D. temporada primavera verano, y mercancía que tiene pendiente D. surtir.
texts.en:
Margarita began her business when her husband was without work, and under the lack of income that would permit her to proviD. a basic living for her children, she decided to sell products by catalogue. She began in the year 2000, when a godmother of her children lent her her catalogues and she began to help selling. Afterwards, she was growing her client base and she decided to become independent and to do sales directly, thus obtaining a better income. She needs a loan of US $375 that she would repay in 6 months in order to buy a new catalogue for the spring and summer seasons, and so she can front the cost for the merchandise that she has already taken orders for on credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a new seasonal catalogue

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Roció es medico y a base de mucho esfuerzo logro poner un consultorio en lo que le asignaban su plaza en salubridad, además de desear obtener ingresos y poner en practica su carrera profesional. Comenzó hace diez años primero hacia solo consultas médicas en su domicilio, hasta que logro establecerse.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $925 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar medicamentos.
texts.en:
Roció is a doctor who through much effort was able to open her own office while awaiting to be assigned a position with the national health system, in order to earn income and begin her professional career. She started 10 years ago, first doing single medical consultations in her home, until she could establish herself. She needs a loan of $925, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy medications.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medications

loans.name: Carmen Magdalena

texts.es:
La microempresaria Carmen M. W. tiene 60 años de edad, es de la etnia creole, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hija mayor de edad y desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica a vender fritos y comida tradicional de la costa caribe nicaragüense tal como lo es el rondón (comida hecha a base de coco, carne, yuca entre otros), además de hacer sopa de mariscos.

Esta microempresaria tiene como clientes ciudadanos de distintos barrios de esta ciudad principalmente los de la etnia creole y otras etnias que gustan de la comida típica costeña. Sus clientes llegan con panas o platos a comprar los productos que oferta y se los llevan a sus casas a comérselos.

La señora M. brinda este servicio todos los días, teniendo cada día un platillo diferente, sin faltar la sopa de mariscos o el rondón. Esta solicitando se le financie para comprar: 10 sacos de carbón a US$ 10 dólares cada saco,  1 quintal de arroz americano a US$ 47 dólares cada quintal, 1 quintal de azúcar a US$ 25 dólares cada quintal, 50 libras de pollo a US$ 1.80 dólares cada libra, 1 bidón de aceite a US$ 33 dólares cada bidón, 100 unidades de plátanos a US$ 0.40 dólares cada plátano, 50 unidades de cocos a US$ 1 dólar cada unidad,  50 libras de carne de res a US$ 1.90 dólares cada libra, 50 libras de yuca a US$ 0.30 dólares cada libra y  50 libras de quequisque a US$ 0.40 dólares cada libra.
texts.en:
Carmen M. W. is a micro-entrepreneur. She is 60 years old and from a creole background. She is a single mother, with one grown daughter. Mrs. M. has been selling fried food and traditional food from the Nicaraguan Caribbean coast for more than 10 years. She sells rondón (a dish made out of coconut, meat, and yucca, among other things) as well as shrimp soup. This micro-entrepreneur has clients in several neighborhoods in the city, who are primarily of creole background or enjoy traditional food from the coast. Her clients arrive with plates and containers to buy her products and then take them home to eat. Mrs. M. provides this service every day, making a different dish each day in addition to the shrimp soup or rondón. She would like a loan to buy: 10 bags of charcoal at US$10 per bag, 48 kgs of American rice for US$47, 48kgs of sugar for US$25, 50 pounds of chicken at US$1.80 per pound, 1 barrel of oil for US$33, 100 plantains for US$0.40 each, 50 coconuts for US$1 each, 50 pounds of ground beef for US$1.90 per pound, 50 pounds of yucca for US$0.30 per pound, and 50 pounds of quequisque (a root vegetable) for US$0.40 per pound.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 bags of charcoal, 48 kgs of American rice, 48kgs of sugar, 50 pounds of chicken, 1 barrel of oil, 100 plantains, 50 coconuts, 50 pounds of ground beef, 50 pounds of yucca, and 50 pounds of quequisque (a root vegetable).

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe inició el negocio por que anteriormente trabajaba en este mismo giro atendiendo una papelería de una señora y como le gustaba poco a poco fue reuniendo el capital suficiente para independizarse y poner su propio negocio. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 2 años primero manejaba solo mercería pero poco a poco fue agregando lo que es papelería primero lo mas común que pedían para las tareas de las escuelas como son mapas, estampas hojas de maquina libretas lápiz plumas etc. Y logro ampliarse y tener una gran variedad de productos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una copiadora y surtir algo de mercancía ya que como vive cerca de una escuela le piden seguido y en la colonia no hay por lo que es una buena oportunidad para ofrecer otro servicio.
texts.en:
Guadalupe started her own business because she previously worked in this branch, running a stationery store for a woman. Because she liked her job, she started saving money little by little so that she could become independent and set up her own business. She started approximately 2 years ago, selling only sewing notions. Little by little, she started adding school supplies such as maps, rubber stamps, printer paper, notebooks, pens, pencils, etc. She managed to expand and now offers a great variety of products.

She needs a loan of $375.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, so that she can purchase a copy machine and some merchandise. Since she lives near a school, customers ask for copy services. However, copy services are not offered in the residential area, which is why she sees it as a good opportunity to start offering these services.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase copy machine

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo inició el negocio para ayudarse económicamente y a su esposa le gustan las ventas y conoce mucha gente. El quería tener su propio negocio aunque fuera pequeño aparte que se enfermo y eso le acarreo muchas deudas y se veía un poco presionado, entonces su esposa lo animo a que pusieran el negocio para sacar algunos ingresos extras. Comenzó aproximadamente hace 5 años vendiendo comidas pero hace apenas un año empezó a vender abarrotes y al parecer ha tenido buenos resultados por lo que piensa seguir invirtiendo cada vez mas para tener un buen surtido y así tener un negocio mas grande.

El necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Eduardo began his business to help himself economically and his wife enjoys sales and meeting people. He wanted to have his own business even though it would be small and when he became sick and accumulated many debts, he was under a bit of pressure, so his wife inspired him and they opened the business to generate some extra income. 5 years ago he began selling food but around one year ago he began to sell groceries and it appears he is having good results so he is thinking about continuing to invest in having a good stock of items and in this way expanding his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for store

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian inició el negocio para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa. Trabajaba hace 3 años en una planta de obrero y como lo despidieron se vio en la disyuntiva de irse a USA a trabajar o quedarse en México como ayudante de albañil, decidiéndose por lo segundo y viendo que esto le daba resultado continuo, poniendo su propio negocio y ha logrado salir adelante.

El necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materiales de trabajo a mas bajo precio.
texts.en:
Adrian started his business to help his parents with the household expenses. Up to 3 years ago he used to work in a factory as a laborer but he was layed off. He found himself at a cross roads, to go the the US to work or to stay in Mexico as a laborer. He made his decision taking his chances in Mexico because he felt it was working for him. He set up his own business and he has been able to make ends meet.

He requires a loan in the amount of $475, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months. The funds will be used to purchase construction materials when they are at a lower price.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction material.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 50 años de edad, trabaja en la venta de comida, también cuenta con el alquiler de habitaciones (6) en su casa, actividad que  viene realizando hace 5 años y medio, y le va muy bien. Dora es una mujer con visión de negocio, quiere seguir ampliando sus habitaciones, así como también mandar a refaccionar algunas estructuras que están en mal estado de sus habitaciones, ya que su trabajo de vender comida, debido a su edad, ya no es seguro. Ella es madre de 4 hijos, todos independientes ya. Dora piensa y actúa tratando de asegurar su vejez, ya que es soltera.Espera invertir la cantidad que necesita en sus habitaciones.
texts.en:
Dora, who is 50 years old, sells food and also rents out rooms in her home. This is something she has been doing for the past 5 years and it is going well for her. Dora is a woman with a business vision. She wants to continue extending her rooms as well as repair some of the structures which are in poor condition because selling food, due to her age, is no longer secure work. She is the mother of 4 children who are all adults. Since she is single, Dora thinks and acts toward trying to assure her old age. She hopes to be able to invest what she needs to in her rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital in order to make improvements to the rooms she rents.

loans.name: Mexita

texts.es: Mexita tiene 28 años, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de golosinas, y aparte de eso trabaja en una casa como empleada doméstica, hace todo esto por sus hijos, quienes son su inspiración de seguir adelante. Es por ello que Mexita quiere incrementar más su venta de golosinas y construir posteriormente una bodega, tiene muchas ideas de negocio, así como también desea remodelar las condiciones de su vivienda, y para eso necesariamente estima de un capital que levantará sus ganas de progreso y ver crecer su venta.
texts.en:
Mexita, 28, is a single mother with 3 children. She has supported herself for a long time selling sweets, and she works in a house as a domestic employee as well. She does all this for her children, who are her inspiration to get ahead. This is the reason that Mexita wants to increase her sales of candies and later build a shop. She has many business ideas, and she also wants to remodel her home, so she has estimated the capital needed to raise earnings and see her sales grow.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of sweets she sells, so she can have a shop in the future.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: Cinthya, mujer decidida y trabajadora se dedica a la venta pescado, se asoció con su padre, que es pescador, su esposo Eduardo es ingeniero industrial y trabaja para una empresa muy importante en la región, ambos decidieron salir adelante y desde luego mediante sus ganancias sacar adelante a su hijo.Cinthya  es muy trabajadora, a parte de dedicarse a la venta de pescado, vende ropa y la lleva a vender por diferentes lugares, dejándola a un precio muy cómodo o al crédito. Ella quiere seguir adelante en su negocio de la venta de pescado, y ahora encaminarse a la venta del mismo pero “seco salado”, ya que tiene más tiempo de conservación.En el futuro quiere llegar a ser una exportadora de este producto alimenticio a nivel nacional. Para realizar los primeros pasos hacia su sueño necesita de una cantidad de dinero que solicita en  calidad de préstamo.
texts.en:
Cinthya, a hardworking and decisive woman, sells fish. She works with her father, who is a fisherman. Her husband Eduardo is an industrial engineer and he works for an important business in the region. They both are dedicated to being successful and through their earnings support their son to be successful. Cinthya is hard working. In addition to selling fish, she sells clothing and she takes clothing to different areas to sell it, offering it at a good price or on credit. She wants to continue growing her fish selling business, and now she is starting to sell fish that is dried and salted, as this food product is broadly used. But to make these first steps toward her dream she needs a quantity of money so she is seeking a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment to expand her fish business

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol  de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la confección de ropa de todo tipo, es costurera desde ya hace muchísimo tiempo, elabora sus prendas y las lleva a vender por diferentes lugares, dejándolas al crédito o al contado. Marisol cuenta con el apoyo total de su esposo  Roger que trabaja como electricista.Ahora tiene un propósito, que es poner su taller textil y desde luego comprar máquinas (remalladora y recubridora), para poder suplir las necesidades y pedidos de sus clientes.Por ello solicita este préstamo para la implementación de su taller.
texts.en:
Marisol, 39, creates clothing of all types. She has been a seamstress for a long time, making her items and taking them to different places to be sold, leaving them for credit or cash. Marisol has the full support of her husband Roger, who works as an electrician. Now she proposes to start a textile workshop and to purchase machines (a mender and coverstitch), to be able to take care of the needs and orders of her clients. She is requesting this loan to set up her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start a textile workshop and to purchase machines (a mender and coverstitch)

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
Victoria es la coordinadora del Grupo “Las Reynas”, ella inició el negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa y de sus hijos, también porque ya no pudo seguir trabajando ya que no tenía quien le cuidara a su hijo. Empezó vendiendo frituras y dulces, poco a poco fue implementando los productos para poder ofrecer mas y mejores cosas a sus clientes es por eso que empezó la venta de tacos y comidas, que es lo que mejor le ha redituado y a lo que se dedica actualmente.

Ramona inició el negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a los gastos de la casa y para sacar a sus hijos adelante y tener mejor calidad de vida. Empezó vendiendo ropa a sus hermanas y tías después se ponía en un mercado rodante y ahora ya van y le compran a su casa y ya tiene aproximadamente 5 años con el negocio.

Griselda inició el negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante y ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa. Empezó vendiendo ropa en su casa y poco a poco se fue metiendo a los mercados rodantes y es así como a podido mantener a su familia.

Bertha inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos y también para tener algo en que entretenerse ya que ya no trabajaba y necesitaba distraerse y al mismo tiempo obtener algún ingreso adicional al de su esposo. Comenzó hace tres años vendía paletas de hielo y frituras en la plaza, pero gracias a que le ha ido bien ya tiene su puesto en su casa.

Ellas necesitan un préstamo por US $1100 que pagaran en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu apoyo ellas seguirán progresando.
texts.en:
Victoria is the coordinator of the group "Las Reynas" (The Queens). She started her business to help her husband with the expenses of the household and children, and also because she could not continue employment since she had nobody to care for her son. She started selling fried foods and sweets, and gradually added products in order to offer more and better items to her clients, starting to sell tacos and meals. These provided better profits and are what she is now selling. Ramona started her business to help with the household expenses and to help her children get ahead and have a better quality of life. She started selling clothing to her sisters and aunts, and later set herself up in a street market. Now they come and buy from her in her home, and she has been in business for about 5 years. Griselda started her business in order to get ahead and to help her husband with the household expenses. She started selling clothing from her house, and gradually moved into the street markets and in this way has been able to support her family. Bertha started her business in order to help her husband with the expenses and also in order to have something to fill her time since she was not working and needed something to do and to earn some income in addition to that of her husband. Three years ago she started selling frozen treats and fried foods in the plaza, which has been going well for her since she still has her stand in her house. They need a loan of $1100, which they will repay in 6 months, in order to buy merchandise and be able to continue their businesses. With your help they will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Doremi

texts.es: Doremi es propietaria de un motocarro, al mismo tiempo se dedica  a la venta de ropa, la cual distribuye por diferentes lugares, dejándola al crédito y al contado, ella tiene una pequeña de casi un año, y su esposo Christian, quien es policía, la apoya en lo que puede, y está de acuerdo con los propósitos de negocio de su cónyuge.En  el futuro desea que su hija sea profesional, es por eso que trabaja para  brindar todo lo necesario a su hija.Doremi requiere de una suma de dinero, el cual invertirá en el mantenimiento y arreglo de su motocarro y para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que vende, además de alquilar un local para la venta de estas.
texts.en:
Doremi is the owner of a motorcar and she also sells clothing which she distributes to different places, leaving it on credit and cash. She has a daughter who is almost one year old, her husband is named Christain and he is a policeman. He helps her with what he can and is in agreement with his wife’s business plans. In the future she wishes that her daughter become a professional, and this is why Doremi works to provide everything necessary for her daughter. Doremi needs a sum of money which will be invested in the maintenance and repair of her motorcar and to increase the quantity of clothing items in addition to rent a locale to sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her motorcar and increase the quantity of clothing items to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe inició el negocio por la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia ya que el desea darle a sus hijos estudio para que se superen y en un futuro tenga un buen trabajo y una mejor calidad de vida. Empezó vendiendo huevo, leche y tortillas y poco a poco ha ido incrementando los productos de la tiendita.

El necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 4 meses para la inversión de mas productos para que sus clientes le sigan comprando los productos que el ofrece.
texts.en:
Guadalupe started his business because of the need to help his family get ahead. He wishes to provide his children with an education so that they can better themselves, get a good job, and have a better quality of life. Guadalupe started out selling eggs, milk, and tortillas, but little by little, he has been filling his little shop with more products.

He needs a loan of $325.00 USD, which will be repaid in 4 months, in order to invest it in purchasing more products so that her customers can keep buying the goods that he offers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 49 años, trabaja en un aserradero, se siente muy contento con su trabajo, puesto que con esto solventa los gastos de estudios de sus 4 hijos, que espera en el futuro sean hombre de bien, su esposa Lizbeth lo apoya mucho en lo que se propone, y juntos llevan adelante a su familia.Jesús se asoció con un grupo de amigos, he hicieron un aserradero propio, en el cual, distintos madereros requieren de sus servicios para hacer trabajar la madera que traen, por ello, tiene la necesidad de comprar herramientas para implementar su aserradero.Adicionalmente a esto, quiere dedicarse a la venta de combustible, por  la razón de  que sus clientes (madereros) requieren de dicho elemento. Para cumplir con su objetivo es que Jesús solicita el presente este préstamo.
texts.en:
Jesús is 49 years old and works in a sawmill. He feels very pleased with his work, since with this he settles the expenses of the studies of their 4 sons, who he hopes in the future to be successful men. His wife, Lizbeth, supports him a lot in what he does, and together they move their family forward. Jesús is associated with a group of friends who have built their own sawmill where certain timber merchants require their services to work the wood that they bring. Because of this, he has the need to buy tools for fitting their sawmill. In addition to this, he wants to sell fuel, because their lumber clients require said element. To comply with his objective, Jesús now requests this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools to fit his sawmill.

loans.name: Alma Gloria

texts.es:
Alma inició el negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante y ayudar a su mamá ya que tiene una enfermedad que no la deja moverse y es por eso que ella vende ropa. Comenzó vendiendo ropa en su casa y poco a poco se fue metiendo a los mercados rodantes y es así como a podido mantener a su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $925 que pagara en 6 meses resurtir mercancía de temporada.
texts.en:
Alma started her business out of necessity and to help her mother afflicted with an illness that doesn't permit her to freely move. This is why she started selling clothing. She started selling clothes from her home and slowly but surely she started selling in the markets around the area and this is how she managed to support her family.

She requires a loan in the amount of $925, which will be repaid in 6 months. With these funds she wants to restock her merchandise with seasonal clothing.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María de Jesús inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y así mismo tener la forma de obtener un ingreso adicional al de su marido, para que el ya no se viera tan presionado con los gastos. Empezó vendiendo zapatos x catalogo a sus hermanas y amigas y ya tiene con esta actividad aproximadamente 3 años.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir un nuevo pedido de zapatos de temporada y así mismo poder surtir más mercancía para tener que ofrecerle a los clientes.
texts.en:
María de Jesús started her business to help her husband with household expenses and to have another income in addition to her husband's, so that he would not be so burdened with the expenses. She started selling shoes from a catalog to her sisters and friends and has now done this activity for about 3 years. She needs a loan of $550, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to acquire a new order of seasonal shoes, to stock additional merchandise to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José Ángel inició el negocio por la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia y así mismo para obtener ingresos ya que por el momento no cuenta con otro empleo. Empezó dando el servicio a sus amistades y poco a poco se fue metiendo mas a este negocio y es así como hoy forma parte de una base de taxis de la ciudad y con esta actividad ya tiene mas de tres años.

El necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para la reparación de la maquina de su carro.
texts.en:
José Ángel started in the business due to the need to help his family get ahead and, concurrently, to obtain income given that he did not have any other employment. He started providing the service to his acquaintances, and he slowly became more involved in this business. This is how he came to now making up part of a fleet of taxis in the city. He has been involved in this activity for more than three years.

He needs a loan of $375 USD, to be repaid in six months, to fix the engine of his car.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fixing the engine on his taxi.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa inició el negocio por que se vio en la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar además de que vio oportunidad de comenzar a vender con las compañeras de trabajo. Comenzó hace dos años como también a trabajar vio que tenía muchas compañeras de trabajo y vio la oportunidad de comenzar a vender cosmeticos con ellas y entonces se decidió a emprender una actividad adicional a su empleo que le permitiera ganar más dinero.

Ella necesita un préstamo pro US $250 que pagara en 3 meses en mucho ya que podrá surtir más mercancías que tiene de pedidos para tener contentos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Teresa started her business because of the need to help her husband with the household expenses, and she also saw the opportunity to start selling to her workmates. She started working about two years ago and she saw the opportunity to start selling cosmetics to them, so she decided to undertake another activity in addition to her employment that would allow her to earn more money. She needs a loan of $250 that she will repay in 3 months so she will be able to stock more merchandise, to fill orders and keep her clients happy.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta inició el negocio durante unos meses hace aproximadamente cuatro años su esposo estuvo desempleado y se vio en la necesidad de comenzar a apoyarlo con el gasto del hogar por lo cual comenzó a vender invitada por otra amiga que hacia la misma actividad.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y así surtir pedidos que tiene pendientes de zapatos.
texts.en:
Vicenta began her business over a period of several months four years ago. Her husband was unemployed and she knew it was necessary for her to start helping him with household expenses. She was invited to sell with a friend who was in the same kind of business.

She needs a loan of $250 which she will repay in 3 months and which she will use to buy merchandise and to fill outstanding orders for shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Rosa Nelly inició el negocio para incrementar los ingresos familiares como apoyo también para su esposo. Comenzó hace dos años, vendiéndole zapatos a una amiga pero poco a poco tuvo su propia clientela y decidió invertir su propio dinero para ella ganar mas y tener su propio negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir mas mercancías que tiene de pedidos para tener contentos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Nelly began her business in order to increase her family’s income and to help her husband. She began 2 years ago, selling shoes for a friend but little by little she built up a clientele of her own and decided to invest her own money so that she could earn more and have her own business.

She needs a loan of $250 which she will repay in 3 months and which she will use to buy more merchandise to keep her customers happy.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Paz Irasema

texts.es:
Irsaema inició el negocio por necesidad ya que se salió de trabajar para cuidar a su hija lo cual disminuyo el ingreso de su hogar y encontró la forma de ganar dinero sin descuidar a su hija vendiendo por catalogo a buen precio bolsas para dama, comenzó hace 4 años por recomendación de una amiga.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir pedidos que tiene pendientes y también buscar nuevos clientes, tener mercancías para ofrecer en directo.
texts.en:
Irsaema started her own business out of necessity after she left work to care for her daughter, thus losing household income. She found a way to earn money and still care for her daughter by selling women’s bags at good prices. Following the recommendation of a friend, she started her business in catalog sales 4 years ago.

She needs a loan of $250 which she will repay in 3 months and which she will use to fill outstanding orders, find new customers, and buy merchandise to offer in direct sales.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Chhorn Chhoeurn's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhorn C.'s Village Bank consists of seventeen members living in Peareach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Each member will use their loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Chhorn C. is the president of the bank and leader of this loan group. She is 24 years old and the mother of two children who both attend the local school. Mrs. Chhorn C. owns a small plot land where she can cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. CH. Vy, has a small kiln in which he can produce coal to sell. In this business, he now faces a small obstacle because he cannot transport wood in order to make coal. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Chhorn C., decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow cart to help with transport. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow cart to transport wood

loans.name: Mrs. Phum Pheng's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phum P.'s Village Bank has 14 members and each will use their loan for different purposes. The members live in Peareach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Phun P., president of the village bank and leader of this loan group, owns a small grocery store in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Oak Sam Art, is a farmer who now faces a small problem because his plantation field has infertile soil which has reduced crop yields. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Phun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for the field. Mrs. Phun P. is 28 years old and does not have children.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her husband's farm land

loans.name: Mrs. Poen Eth's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Poen E.'s Village Bank and its members are located in Peareach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.Mrs. Peon E., president of the village bank, is a 40-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are enrolled in the local school. She owns a small plot of land on which she can cultivate rice for a living. In her plantation, she now faces an obstacle because the soil is infertile and has led to declining crop yields. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Peon E. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to better support the field.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in order to increase crop yields

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Mr. Sot D. is a villager in Tropang Pring Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is 33 years old and the father of four children, two of whom attend the local school while the others are too young to work or study, being five and two years old. He sells firewood for a living and his wife helps him with this business. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it so he has decided to request a loan to buy a cart in order to transport his firewood to sell from door-to-door. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy a cart in order to transport his firewood to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok P. was born in 1970 and lives in Bleuk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 38 years old and the mother of seven children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory, four are attending the local school, and one is just three years old and too young to study. Her husband, Mr. Khat Buntaing, is a veterinarian who cures animals for profit.

Mrs. P. owns a three-hector rice field in which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this, she is also a breeder who raises four cows, four buffaloes, and four pigs. Because the business breeding pigs is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more six pigs. She would use the rest of the money to purchase pig food to feed her pigs.

loans.use: To buy six more pigs to breed as well as pig food.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim S. T. is a villager in Thmor Reap Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She rears pigs and currently has eight of them. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy five more piglets for breeding. She will buy more pig feed with the rest of the loan. Her husband, Mr. Him Chanthar, is a soldier who earns  a modest income to support the household. Mrs. Kim S. T. is 41 years old and the mother of three children who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy five more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn S. was born in 1968 and lives in Thmor Reap Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 40-year-old widow with a child enrolled in the local school. She is a traditional healer in the local village. Since her business is going well, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more traditional medicine in order to cure her patients. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more traditional medicine in order to cure her patients.

loans.name: Moung

texts.en: Mrs. Moung S. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 36 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school.She raises cows and pigs and currently has five cows and four pigs. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to request a loan to buy ten more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sun Seb, is a farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice as well as a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.use: To buy ten more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Mul

texts.en:
Mrs. Mul H. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  She has a plot of land to grow vegetables. 

On this plantation, Mrs. Mul H. faces a small problem because her field is covered by grass on which she cannot cultivate vegetables.  In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Mul H. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to chop the grass so that she will be able to cultivate the land. 

Her husband, Mr. Kheiv Bich, is a breeder who raises two cows and two pigs.  Mrs. Mul H. is 54 years old and the mother of two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To hire laborers to chop the grass so that she will be able to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala Kamarić was born in 1958 and comes from Gračanica. She is married and lives with her husband. Sala has been working in shoe manufacture in Gračanica for a long time. She is very good at her job but, like everywhere in the shoe industry, she doesn`t earn much.

Sala also works at home to increase her home budget. She repairs shoes manually and she thinks that now is the right moment to buy a machine and make her job easier. She is requesting her second loan through WWI in the amount of 600 KM to buy machine for shoe repair.

loans.use: To buy a shoe repair machine

loans.name: Bisera

texts.en:
Bisera Kajtaranović lives in Gračanica, one very entrepreneurial town. She was born in 1957 and has been employed her whole life. She has also always had her little business at home. Bisera is married and lives together with her husband and two grown-up sons. Her sons are not employed, so Bisera and her husband are compelled to provide for them.

Bisera makes cakes at home. She has constant clients and receives more orders during the holidays. She wants to be prepared for increased orders by buying reserve materials and some new dishes. She is requesting her first loan from Women for Women International for 500 KM. She hopes to make a much better presentation of her products and increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy materials and dishes for to make cakes.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen I. is 34 years old and married with one child. She sells soft drinks, a business she has been operating  for a long time. In order to increase her stock and number of customers, she is in need of the loan amount of $425 to buy more drinks to sell. In the future she hopes to be a major distributor of drinks. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O., 32 years old and married with one child, is a hair stylist living in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She also sells hair extensions, cosmetics and women’s wear, products that have helped to increase her profit and number of customers. In order to meet growing customer demand, she is requesting a loan of $425 to buy more of these goods. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions, cosmetics and women's wear to sell

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy O., who is 40 years old and married with 2 children, has a photocopying and laminating business in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is currently in need of a $1200 loan to buy another photocopier in order to meet the demands of her customers and increase the speed with which she delivers service.  In the future she hopes to own a bigger business center. Christy says thank you.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mr. Bun I. is a villager in Trapaing Thom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is 46 years old and the father of four children. One is a laborer making a dollar a day, another two attend the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study because he is just one year old. Mr Bun I. buys cow and then re-sells them at a better price. His wife, Mrs. Su Lorn, is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of farmland on which she cultivates rice.

Although Mr. Bun I. and his wife have two businesses between them, they still do not make enough to support their family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Bun Leng is requesting a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: Mr. Toem S. was born in 1977 and lives in Tumnop Thmey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a coal seller and his wife, Mrs. Chay Kimsal, is a rice farmer. In her plantation, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy two oxen to plow the rice field. To solve this problem, her husband, Mr. Toem S., is requesting a loan to buy 2 oxen. The couple has three children, two of whom attend the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study, being just three years old. His wife is pictured on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to help with plowing

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mr. Chen C. is a villager in Krouy Wat Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is 29 years old and his only child is just three years old.Mr Chen C. is a poultry breeder and rice farmer. He earns a small revenue from rice farming as his current plot of farmland is small. In order to expand his rice revenue, he is requesting a loan to buy 0.5 additional hectares on which to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Chim Ra, is a Khmer cake seller also earning a small income to help support their household.

loans.use: To buy 0.5-hectares of additional farmland on which to cultivate rice

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mr. Chea P. is a villager in Veal Srae Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a farmer with a plot of land on which he can cultivate rice. In this plantation, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough animals to plow the rice field. Thus, he has decided to request a loan to buy another cow to help plow the field. His wife, Mrs. Kouk Samorn, owns a small grocery store in the local market. Mr. Chea P. is 51 years old and the father of four children, three of whom are employed in different businesses while the youngest attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy another cow to help plow the field.

loans.name: Pe

texts.en:
Mrs. Pe S. was born in 1956 and now lives in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  She and her husband, Mr. Ny Chhet, have a plot of land where they cultivates rice.  They have seven children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining four are attending the local school. 

Although Mrs. Pe S.'s family members have different businesses, they still cannot support their family well.  In order to improve Mrs. Pe S.'s living conditions, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi business. She hopes to increase her income with this new loan.

loans.use: To add to her saving to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi business.

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere O., who is 28 years old and married with one child, operates a laundry business in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Opening her business very early everyday to attend to customers, Chinyere does the majority of her washing manually. Because this is time-consuming, she sometimes loses customers to other laundry services. She is therefore  requesting a loan of $850 to buy a laundry machine. This will help Chinyere to retain her customers and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy a laundry machine

loans.name: Khorng

texts.en: Mr. Khorng T. is a villager in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a firewood seller and cow breeder. Since his cow breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it and so is requesting a loan to buy another cow for his cattle business. His wife, Mrs. Ouk Sos, is a farmer who owns a hectare on which she cultivates rice to supplement their family income. Mr. Khorng T. is 30 years old and the father of two children who are both too young to work or study, being one and five years old respectively. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy one more cow for his business.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong S. was born in 1963 and lives in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells beer, drinks and food to support her household. Her husband, Mr. Dy Nheurn, is a farmer who has a hectare of rice-land to cultivate. Aside from farming,he also raises cattle. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it, so his wife is requesting a loan to buy another cow for her husband's cattle business. The couple has three children, two of whom are employed in different businesses while the youngest is a student at the local school.

loans.use: To buy another cow for her husband's cattle business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine E., 50 years old and married with five children, owns a groceries and beef shop selling both provisions and drinks. With an increase in her volume of customers, she wants to increase her stock and is therefore requesting a loan of $600 to buy more beef to sell. Selling more products will help Catherine increase her profit level, the proceeds of which will help in supporting her children's education. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more beef for sale

loans.name: Enesa

texts.en: Enesa Fehratović is divorced and lives with her parents. She is 50 years old and comes from Lohinja, a big village near Gračanica. She is a cook and works in a restaurant. Her parents are very old and have a very low income so Enesa has to help and support them. Beside her regular job, she has her little business organizing weddings and special lunches. Enesa wants to improve her business and she needs special dishes for that. That is the reason that she wants to take a loan from WWI in amount of  600 KM. She hopes that she will be able to offer the best meals to her clients.

loans.use: To buy professional dishes

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong N. is a villager in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 23 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or attend school because they are aged two and four. She is a vegetable seller and would like to expand her business as it is doing well. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell to her customers. Her husband, Mr. Chhin Boren, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a modest income to help support their family. Her husband is pictured on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice Madungwo owns a boutique for selling second-hand clothes. She buys the second-hand clothes form Lagos and Onitsha. Her stock is  small in quantity. She believes with the infusion of a Kiva loan she will be able to increase her stock, which means more customers and more profits. She is in need of $600 to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.  She is 48 years old and married with 6 children. 'I want to see my children get the best education.'  She says she will use part of her profit to pay their school fees. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Erminka

texts.en: Erminka P. ić is a mother of two children and lives in Lohinja near Gračanica. She has a husband who is constantly employed. However, Erminka is a modern young woman who doesn't want to just sit at home, and so she has a second hand shop. She is constantly busy finding and selling second hand clothes, and her business runs well. She would like to take out a loan to buy more clothes and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes for reselling

loans.name: Glorious Pat

texts.en: Glorious Pat O. is 29 years old and she is married with a child. She sells provisions like tomato paste, butter, sugar, etc. She also sells foodstuffs and drinks. She opens her shop by 8am and closes by 7pm. She is a hardworking woman. She desires to retain her customers by stocking her shop with all that her customers need. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and Provisions for sale

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
Ifeoma Ugwuani sells clothes and is also a fashion designer. She makes lovely Nigerian designs. She has been in this business for the past four years.

Ifeoma is 40 years old and married with two children. She lives in Ilogbo-Ajamgbadi and has been a LAPO client for the past three years. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more clothes and a sewing machine. She says, "Thank you."

loans.use: To buy more clothes and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen I. is 39 years old and married with four children. She has a shop located along Ojo Igbede Road in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and has been in this business for the past two years.

Queen is a LAPO client and is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more drinks to sell. She says that this will increase her sales and profit. She hopes to be a major distributor of drinks in future. She remains grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Debora D. lives in Llogbo, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells frozen food and she also grinds pepper, tomatoes and beans. She sells frozen foods like fish, beef, chicken and turkey. The demand for her frozen foods is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Debora has been in this business for the past 4 years. She is a LAPO client. Debora is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She needs a loan of $425 to enable her buy more frozen food to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria U. is 34 years old and married with one child. Gloria lives in Afro Media, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. Gloria sells frozen foods like turkey, beef, and chicken. The demand for her frozen foods is high and she hopes to meet that demand. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. Gloria needs a loan to buy more frozen foods to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Afusatu

texts.en: Afusatu A. sells drinks and produces nylon in her home. She has been selling drinks for a long time but learned to produce Nylon within the past 2 years. Afusatu is 51 years old and is married with 5 children. Afusatu lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria and is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan of of $850 to buy more drinks and materials for the production of Nylon. She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and materials for the production of nylon to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet A. is 39 years old and married with 4 children. Juliet lives in Sabo Oniba, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells electronics at Alaba International market, which is regarded as the biggest market in West Africa. Juliet is a LAPO client. Juliet has been in this business for the past 3 years. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy more electronics to sell. She expresses her profound gratitude to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more electronics to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty O. is 41 years old and divorced with one child. She sells clothes in her shop located in Ojo-Igbede in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells clothes and has been in this business for the past three years. As a divorced woman, life has not been easy for Betty because she has to take care of herself and her child.

Betty is a LAPO client and needs a loan for $850 to buy more clothes to sell. She remains grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet O. is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives in Ajambadi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells hair extensions called weavons and is also a hair stylist. She has been in this business since 1998.

Juliet has been the leader of a LAPO Microfinance lending group for the past three years. She needs a loan for $1200 to buy more weavons and other hair extensions to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more weavons and hair extension to sell.

loans.name: Odupesun

texts.en: Odupesun B. lives in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs at her house. This, she says, reduces the cost of renting a shop.  B. is 35 years old and divorced with 2 children. As a divorced woman, she is faced with the sole responsibility of taking care of herself and her children. She is able to do this with some part of her profit.  B. has been in this business for a long time. She is a LAPO client. B. needs a loan of $700 to buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana T. sells garri and corn in Ebute market, located along Ojo Lgbede road, Lagos state, Nigeria. She operates her shop from 7am to 7pm, Monday through Sunday. She is 48 years old and she is a widow with 6 children.  She works hard to pay her children's school fees and provide shelter and clothing for them.  Christiana has the zeal to lift her family above poverty. Christiana has been in this business a long time ago. She is a LAPO client. Christiana needs a loan of $850 to buy more corn and garri to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more corn and garri to sell

loans.name: Vali

texts.en:
A. Vali is 50 years old. He is married and has 5 children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food, such as sweets, soft drinks, juices, and other items in his grocery store, which is located near his house. Vali is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales. Currently, Vali has about $1000 in inventory. His gross income is about $900 and his monthly net profit is about $300.

Vali is requesting a loan of $800 to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. His perseverance and clear vision are key factors for success in his small business.

loans.use: Purchasing a greater variety of food to sell

loans.name: Abbosjon

texts.en:
H. Abbosjon is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. For the last 2 years, Abbosjon has provided taxi services using his car. Abbosjon always tries to provide high-quality services, but at the same time, keep prices attractive for his customers. Abbosjon is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable. Abbosjon lives with his parents, and he is the main breadwinner in his large family.

He is ready to work from early morning until late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. Because the price of petrol is rising day by day, he is planning to replace the fuel system with one that uses liquefied petroleum gas as fuel, because it is cheaper than petrol. For this reason he requests $650. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing a Kapron liquefied petroleum gas-cylinder for the fuel supply system in taxi

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells baby care products like baby cream,  clothes, oil, and powder. She also sells bags and shoes.  Tina has been in this business for the past two years. She is a LAPO client.  Tina is 44 years old and married with 4 children.  Tina needs a loan of $1200 to buy more baby care products, bags and shoes to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more baby care products, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Taiye

texts.en:
Taiye O. is 32 years old and married with three children. She lives in Issashi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been selling baby wears and creams in her own shop since 1998. Her customers are mostly pregnant and breastfeeding women.

Taiye is a LAPO Microfinance client. She needs a loan for $1200 to buy more baby wears and baby cream to sell. She expresses her appreciation to LAPO and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more baby wears and creams to sell.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
N. Sabohat is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married with 3 children. She works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity has created in her feelings of satisfaction because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and so now she guides them into the field each day for feeding.

She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her three children, who also help out in caring for the animals during their free time. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of 12 months to buy small cattle and fodder for her animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle and fodder

loans.name: Naimkhoja

texts.en:
Naimkhoja N. is 29 years old. He is married with two adorable kids. For almost 2 years Naimkhoja has been working in the local market of the city, selling wheat, green gram, buckwheat and peas. These legumes are very popular in Tajikistan, as they can be cooked in soups or made into cereals, and both are very nourishing, healthy and tasty. This business is very stable and generates the only income for his large family, as Naimkhoja lives with his parents.

Today, he is requesting a loan to increase stock, by purchasing more grains for selling. Naimkhoja thanks all for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more grains to increase stock

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
T. Nafisa is 19 years old. She started her own business 2 years ago in order to support her parents with family expenses. She is a wholesaler from the Spitamen district. Together with her father, she purchases candies and sweets from Khujand town and sells them to the local market at wholesale. Nafisa, being very polite and talkative by nature, has a lot of customers, which allows her to sell her goods immediately. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection.

Nafisa is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 12 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her plans for the future is to open a vending facility in order to expand her business. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Nafisa reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: Enlarging the range of goods

loans.name: Hamdam

texts.en:
S. Hamdam is 46 years old. He is married with 2 children – an 18-year-old daughter and a 15-year-old son. He and his family live in the town of Khujand. Hamdam rents a bus and offers transportation services.  Hamdam’s usual itinerary is the Khujand-Gafurov-Khujand route. He usually has many passengers as there are no other bus drivers who take this route. Hamdam has been in this business for 6 years, and it is the only source of income for the family.

Currently, Hamdam earns a profit of about $20 a day. Hamdam’s bus needs maintenance. At the moment, its running gear has to be fixed. That is why Hamdam is requesting a loan of $800 to fix the problem. One of his long-term plans is to buy the bus and continue to be self-employed. Hamdam promises to repay this loan in 12 months without any delay.

loans.use: Purchase parts to repair his bus

loans.name: Samaddin

texts.en: Samaddin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Bahmanli village. He was born in 1980. This man is married and has 2 children. Five years ago he started the cattle breeding business. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 2 calves for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en: Novruz was born in 1973. He is married, has 2 children. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fizuli region, Alkhanli village.  He has been in cattle breeding business for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of $750 to buy a calf for improving his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Ndèye Gnagna

texts.fr: Ndèye Gnagna D., 32 ans, mariée avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de TP Tackou Ligueye depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité de restauration (vente de boisson et de sandwich) au niveau de sa buvette. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Ndèye Gnagna D., 32 years old, and married with three children in her care, has been a member of the TP Tackou Ligueye village bank for four and a half years. She wants to transform her catering business (the sale of sandwiches and beverages) into a food stand. The income would permit her to improve their standard of living. The loan that she is requesting would be repaid in a lump sum in six months time.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of sandwiches and beverages

loans.name: Amira

texts.en: Amira Avdić comes from Babići, a small village near Gračanica. She is a mother of  two sons who are students. Her husband works out of Bosnia and she is spending her time taking care of her children. Her occupation is tailoring. She works at her home on one old machine. That machine does not have many functions and Amira is forced just to repair clothes. She wants to take a loan from WWI in the amount of 1500 KM to buy a new machine. She hopes to expand her business and earn more.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Hanka

texts.en:
Hanka Avdić was born in 1946 and lives in a village called Babići near Gračanica. She is married but she is mostly alone at home because her husband has been working outside Bosnia for 40 years. Hanka is awaiting the moment when her husband will retire so that they will be together.

In the meantime, Hanka does handwork: she makes table-sets and similar things. When she was young, it was just her hobby, but in the meantime it has become a good income source for her.

Hanka wants to buy needed materials and devices for her work, so she is requesting a loan through WWI in the amount of 1500 KM.

loans.use: To buy materials and implements for embroidery

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo Y. is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions and ogogoro (local gin) in her shop along Igbelerin in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Iyabo is a LAPO Microfinance client. She is requesting a loan for $700 to buy more provisions to sell. She thanks all the Kiva lenders and LAPO for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Biliki

texts.en: Biliki A. sells cooked foods and drinks in her shop.  She learned how to cook from her mother. Biliki is 27 years old and married with a child.  Biliki has a restaurant where she cooks foods like beans, rice, plantain, etc. She also sells drinks. Biliki is a LAPO client.  Biliki needs a loan of $1200 to buy more drinks to sell and also to buy a generator. She needs a generator because of the lack of electricity supply. She appreciates the generosity of Kiva lenders in helping to alleviate poverty. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy a generator and drinks to sell

loans.name: Dayat

texts.en:
Dayat I. is 30 years old and married with three children. Dayat sells weavons, hair extensions, and hair cream and she is also a hair stylist. She learned how to style hair as an apprentice for two years.

Dayat needs a loan for $1200 to buy a generator so that she can satisfy the growing demand of her numerous customers. She also wants to buy a deep freezer so that she can start selling cold drinks at her shop. She thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy a generator and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Fe En Marcha Group

texts.en: "Fe en Marcha" is a group of 20 very excited people. All 20 members of this group are ready to start their own businesses, and begin the process of bettering their lives. "Elena" is the group representative, and hopes to start her own cosmetics business. She is a hard worK. mother of one, and feels that this loan could be the start of a new life for her and her son. Her dream is to one day have her own thriving salon, and be able to provide a comfortable life for her family. This whole group is ready for this loan, and eager to start bettering their lives! On behalf of Elena, the group, and Esperanza International---we thank you for your support!!

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo A. is 24 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Issashi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs, like rice, beans, and plantain, in her shop.

Titilayo is a LAPO Microfinance client. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She is very grateful to all Kiva lenders and LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin A. is happily married with 2 children. She is 30 years old.  She sells clothes and kitchen utensils in her shop located in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria.  She opens her shop from 7am to 6pm from Monday to Saturday. She is a LAPO client. Toyin hopes to expand her business. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more kitchen utensils and clothes to sell. Toyin has been in this business for a long time. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible

loans.use: To buy more clothes and kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam A. is 39 years old and married with four children. She lives in Issashi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks from the front of her house. She has been in this business for a long time.

Miriam is a LAPO Microfinance client. She needs a loan for $700 to buy more provisions to sell. She says this Kiva loan will change her business and family life. She thanks all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Shomolu

texts.en:
Shomolu K. is 32 years old and married with three children. She lives in Issashi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells weavons, hair extensions, and hair cream. She is also a hair stylist, which she learned how to do over three years. She opened her own salon in 1990. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers.

Shomolu is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan for $1200 to buy more weavons and hair extensions to sell. She said that with the help of the Kiva loan, she would be able to increase her business and make more profit. She thanks all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more weavons and hair extension to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris F. sells provisions, drinks, and kitchen utensils in her shop, and she has been in this business for a long time. Doris is 41 years old and married with 3 children who are all attending school.

Doris does not have a kiosk, so she sells her provisions, drinks, and kitchen utensils in an open area. She needs a loan to build a kiosk where she can stock her goods and sell to her customers. Building a kiosk will allow her to store her goods securely overnight so that she doesn't have to pack her goods each night and take them home. Doris lives at Issashi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To build a kiosk where she will sell her goods

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia A. sells baby items like baby creams, clothes, powder, etc. Cicilia is 35 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Issashi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs a loan to buy more baby items to sell. She expresses her profound gratitude to LAPO MICROFINANCE and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more baby items like baby cream and powder to sell

loans.name: Wahab

texts.en:
Wahab M. is 41 years old and married with seven children. She sells provisions and frozen foods. In order for her to cut costs and increase profit, Wahab travels to the Republic of Benin to buy frozen foods, a journey of about and hour and a half by car.

Wahab is a LAPO client and has been running her business for the past six years. She needs a loan for $700 to buy more frozen foods to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en: Bisi A. sells bags of rice in her shop located at Iyana-Iba market, Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. Bisi is 45 years old and married with 3 children. Her youngest child is 10 years old and the eldest is 20 years old. With the profit she makes from her business, Bisi supports her husband in taking care of their children. Bisi is enthusiastic and optimistic about the prosperity of her business and that of her family. She needs a loan to buy more bags of rice to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice for sale

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: Happiness O. sells clothes in her shop. She lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. Happiness travels to Ogun state (a journey of 2 hours by car) twice a month to purchase clothes to sell in Lagos state. She is 38 years old and married with two children. Happiness is a LAPO client, and needs a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. She remains grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy O. is 40 years old and happily married with four children. She lives in Badagry in Lagos State, Nigeria. Joy owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods, like beans, rice, and yams. She also sells drinks. She learned to cook for commercial purposes from her late mother.

Joy has been a LAPO client for the past two years. She needs a loan for $525 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you all for making this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food stuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde I. lives in Badagry in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old and married with two children. Kehinde sells building materials in her shop. She has been in this business for the past four years.

Kehinde is a LAPO client. She needs a loan for $850 to buy more building materials to sell. She thanks all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora A. lives in Afromedia in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 42 years old and married with eight children. She sells provisions and drinks.

Dora is a LAPO client. She needs a loan for $700 to buy more drinks and provisions to sell. Dora desires to pull her family out of poverty. She thanks everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat K. is 45 years old and married with five children. She lives in Okoko in Lagos State, Nigeria. Sarat owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, yams, and plantain. Her customers love her food, so the demands for her cooking is high. She hopes to retain her customers by meeting their demands.

Sarat is a LAPO Microfinance client and the leader of a lending group. She needs a loan for $850 to buy more bread and foodstuff to cook and sell to her customers. She thanks all the Kiva lenders and LAPO for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more bread and foodstuff to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi E. is 39 years old and married with two children. She makes a living selling cooked foods like yams, beans and rice as well as drinks.

Ngozi lives in Afromedia, Lagos State, Nigeria and is a LAPO client. She has applied for a loan of $850 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She wants to express her appreciation to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for the financial support

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food to cook and sell

loans.name: Bossa

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1974 à Bassar au Nord ouest du Togo, madame S. Bossa est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale, la vente charbon de bois et d’ignames dans l’un des marchés locaux de Lomé. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005 et dispose des clients ont qui elle livre sa marchandise après son retour du lieu d’approvisionnement. Avec le reste de son stock elle procède à la vente par exposition au marché. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite de faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat de 400 tubercules et 6 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1974 in Bassar in northwest Togo, Bossa S. is married and the mother of three children. Her main field of endeavor is the sale of charcoal and yams in Lome’s local markets. She started this business in 2005 and has a clientele to whom she delivers merchandise upon returning from buying trips. She puts any remaining inventory up for sale, displaying it at the marketplace. Bossa has already received and successfully repaid her first loan, and now requests a second loan to increase her inventory by purchasing 400 yams and six bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer
