loans.use: Purchase of yams and charcoal

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: Felicitas M. A. sells flowers in the local market in Ayacucho, Peru; she has been selling flowers for 28 years. She has her own spot at the local market among other entrepreneurs selling fruits, vegetables, meats and grains. Felicitas will use the loan to keep her flower business running, including the purchase of various flowers. With the income from her flower business she will be able to fulfill her dreams, which include keeping her children in school and building a second level on to her house.

loans.use: To purchase various flowers

loans.name: Enma Rita

texts.en:
Emma in Ayacucho, Perú with her two children aged seven and 12. She has been selling groceries for 10 years. It is very important to her that her children receive a good education and learn to save money just like she is doing with the help of FINCA Perú.

With this loan of 2,550 soles (US$875) she will invest in more products for her store such as sugar, refreshments and candies. She hopes, with the income from her grocery store, to ensure her children continue their education.

loans.use: To invest in more products for her store such as sugar, refreshments and candies.

loans.name: Viv Ansanm Group

texts.en: The group "Viv ansanm" is a group of 10 people from Haiti. Haiti is one of the poorest countries in the world, and a place where the majority of its people are unemployed. This hardworking group is trying to find a way out of their extreme poverty, and start to better their lives. Lutherking is the representative of this group and an important part its overall success. She is a very hardworking mother of two young children, and is looking to start a small business of selling fish. She feels like this is her way to improve life for her and her family. Her dream is to have a thriving business and to help her family live comfortably. On behalf of the group, and Esperanza International----we thank you for your support!!

loans.use: Fish Vendor

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame O. B. Mariam est née le 31 décembre 1966 à Sokodé dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle s’est mariée à un pauvre mécanicien et est mère de 6 enfants. Presque la totalité de la charge de la famille repose sur elle seule d’autant plus que son mari a un revenu irrégulier. Elle a pour activité principale la restauration du riz dans son quartier. Elle a commencée cette activité depuis l’année 2002 et tire un revenu acceptable. Elle accueille beaucoup de consommateurs et leur rend un bon service.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de riz et 6 bidons d’huile végétale.
texts.en:
Mariam O. B. was born December 31, 1966 in Sokodé in central Togo. She is married to a struggling mechanic and is the mother of six children. Mariam is nearly the sole support of her family since her husband cannot count on a regular paycheck. Her primary field of endeavor is the supply of rice to her neighborhood. She began this business in 2002 and earns an adequate income providing good service to her many customers. This, the first loan she has requested, would permit her to buy ten sacks of rice and six drums of vegetable oil.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice and vegetable oil

loans.name: Teofila Eusebia

texts.en: Teofila Eusebia V. D. H. lives in Ayacucho with her five children. To the delight of her friends and neighbors she not only runs a grocery store where she sells the essentials, she also makes bread and washes clothes. Her loan will be invested in her business by purchasing laundry detergent, paying the water bill, and buying ingredients for her bread. With the income she receives from her businesses she hopes to ensure that her kids are educated.

loans.use: To purchase laundry detergent, pay the water bill, and buy ingredients for her bread.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora E. T. works in Huanta, Huamanga in Perú. For the past ten years she has been selling sandals and shoes and just one year ago she started a second business of renting cars to drive passengers from Huanta, a village well known for its large avocados, to other villages. She would like to invest this loan in her business, by purchasing more sandals and shoes.  With the income she receives from her businesses she hopes to build a second floor on her house and buy her own store where she can sell shoes.

loans.use: To purchase more sandals and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Julia Ramirez

texts.en:
Julia Ramierez G. D. M. is 36 years old and lives in Ayacucho, Perú with her husband and six children. As a result of an accident that her husband had several years ago which rendered him unable to work, Julia started her own grocery business. Julia follows the festivals in the area and sells fruits and vegetables. She has been selling groceries for 15 years. Julia takes care of her six children when she is not working.

The loan of 2,200 soles (US$750) will be invested into her business to purchase various fruits and vegetables including bananas, peaches, mandarins, onions, carrots, and eggplant. With the income she receives from her grocery business she hopes to buy a car so it is easier for her to transport her goods.

loans.use: To purchase various fruits and vegetables including bananas, peaches, mandarins, onions, carrots, and eggplant.

loans.name: Maloafan

texts.fr:
Madame N. Maloafan est née en 1957 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente de céréales et des ignames dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé. Il a une grande expérience dans ce commerce puisqu’elle a commencée depuis 1992.
Elle a une fois bénéficiée du crédit auprès de WAGES et s’est bien comporté dans le remboursement du crédit.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de d’acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs du haricot et 50 tubercules d’ignames. Ainsi avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Maloafan N. was born in 1957 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of four. Her business involves selling grain and yams in the Agoè Assiyéyé marketplace. She has a great deal of experience in commerce, since she started in 1992. She once was a recipient of a WAGES loan and performed well in repaying it. This second loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 10 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of beans, and 50 yam tubers . Thus, with the income from this business, she will be able to assist her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in grain and yams

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina R. B. is 38 years old and lives in Ayacucho, Perú with her three children. She sells groceries and clothes, including pants, traditional skirts, slips and sweaters at both local festivals and festivals in the rainforest in the northern part of Perú. She has been selling clothes for 6 months and groceries for one year. This loan will provide her with the resources to keep her business running; she will be able to buy more material to make her clothing, including needles, thread, and trim for her skirts and blouses. With the success of her business she hopes to be able to own her own clothing store and start other businesses.

loans.use: To buy more material to make her clothing, such as needles, thread, and trim for her skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.fr:
Née en 1973 à Ahépé, localité située à 47 km de la ville de Lomé, dame N. Caroline est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Son mari lui a aidé à s’installer pour vendre les céréales, les tubercules et les fruits depuis l’année 2000. Pour étendre son activité, elle a obtenu un premier crédit et a bien remboursé.
Elle aimerait refaire son stock de marchandise et sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter 7 sacs de maïs, 200 tubercules d’igname, 10 paniers de manioc et 5 paniers d’oranges.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Ahépé, which is located 47 kilometers from the town of Lomé, Caroline N. is married and the mother of one child. Her husband helped her to start selling grain, yams and fruit in the year 2000. To expand her business, she obtained her first loan and repaid it completely. She would like to restock her merchandise and is requesting a second loan to purchase 7 sacks of corn, 200 yams, 10 baskets of cassava and 5 baskets of oranges.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grain, fruit and yams

loans.name: Afi Akpénè

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1980 à Badou dans la région des plateaux, dame D. Afi Akpénè est une femme vaillante qui vend de l’eau minérale dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle est divorcée et assure la charge de son enfant. Pour pouvoir satisfaire ses besoins et celui de son enfant, elle doit beaucoup se battre. Elle le fais mais  n’arrive toujours pas à joindre les deux bouts.
Pour promouvoir son activité, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 250 sachets et 100 bouteilles  d’eau minérale. Cette augmentation vient à point nommé car elle voulait aussi vendre en gros pour vite écouler son stock.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1980 in Badou in the plateau region, Mrs. Afi Akpénè D. is a hard-working woman who sells mineral water in the Agoè area in Lomé. She is divorced and is raising her child by herself. To support herself and her child, she has to really struggle. She tries hard but doesn't always manage to make ends meet.

To bolster her business, she is requesting this first loan to purchase 250 bags and 100 bottles of mineral water. This increase in her stock comes just at the right time because she would also like to sell wholesale so as to move her inventory more quickly.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bags and bottles of mineral water for re-sale

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Monsieur D. Koffi est un homme passionné de football. Il est né le 17 février 1967 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de quatre enfants. Depuis 2005, il a crée un espace foot où il transmet en direct les jeux de football et autres films souvent intéressés par les jeunes. Il vend également des appareils électroniques et des antennes paraboliques.
Il dépend uniquement que de cette activité, et supporte seul les charges de sa famille. 
A l’approche de cette rentrée scolaire, il a des difficultés pour acheter des fournitures scolaires à ses enfants et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter deux décodeurs et satisfaire la commande qu’elle vient de recevoir. Ainsi avec le revenu de commerce il pourra acheter quelques fournitures pour ses enfants afin qu’ils puissent commencer les cours.
texts.en:
Koffi D. is an avid soccer fan. He was born on February 17, 1967 in Lomé, and is married and the father of four children. In 2005, he opened a soccer venue where live broadcasts of soccer games and other films that frequently interest young people can be viewed. He likewise sells electronics and satellite dishes. His family depends on this business for their sole support. With the approach of the school year, Koffi is having difficulty buying school supplies for his children and is requesting his first loan in order to buy two decoders to fill an order he has just received. With the profit from this venture he will be able to purchase some supplies for his children so they can begin classes.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of decoders

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso Group

texts.en:
Nuevo Progreso is a community bank found in the Andean Mountains in the community of Viracochan, which is located 2,600m above sea level. This area is principally known for the breeding of animals such as cows and small animals like guinea pigs. In addition, corn, onion and wheat are grown in this area.

Julia A. D. C. is a member of the the Nuevo Progreso community bank in Ayacucho, Perú. She lives with her husband and her three children aged 15, 12 and nine. She runs a grocery store in the area, sells meat, and runs a small restaurant that is patronized by many professionals and teachers visiting the area. When Julia first opened her store she did not have many patrons because she was still unknown, but since then the customers have increased. Since joining FINCA Perú she has been participating in trainings that help her improve her business. With the loan of 600 soles she will invest into her business by purchasing more products for her store and for her restaurant. She is saving for her dream of owning a car and helping her children continue their studies and become professionals.

Aida Rivas R. also is a member of the community bank, Nuevo Progreso, she lives in Ayacucho with her husband and two children aged 10 and seven. She runs her own grocery store where there is a kiosk available to buy refreshments. When Aida opened her store, there was political unrest which caused some problems, but since then the area has calmed down. FINCA Perú, which Aida recently joined, has helped her improve her business. With the 200 nuevos soles loan, she will invest in buying more products for her store. FINCA Perú emphasizes saving and with her savings Aida dreams of her children continuing their education and being independent financially.

loans.use: The 19 members need loans between 100 and 600 soles, for their various businesses.

loans.name: Villa Mayo Group

texts.en:
At approximately 3,600 meters in the Peruvian Andes you can find FINCA Perú's community bank, Villa Mayo, in Huancavelica. This area is known for its new types of potatoes and a chilly climate. The community bank is maD. up of 11 members.

Martha S. Q. lives in Huancavelica with her husband and two children, aged 10 & 5. She has a small grocery store with a phone service. The grocery store started small yet she is improving little by little. The area has its problems, she says, as her business is sometimes too small to cover her necessities. The loan will be invested immediately in the store by purchasing more goods that her clients are interested in.

After joining FINCA Perú she has been able to improve her business, and is very grateful that she has been able to save more and invest more in her business. Right now, Martha is saving the income she receives from her business to fulfill her dreams of making sure her children are educated to become professionals, and she would also like to move and start her business in another area, Huancayo. 

Ana Q. R., another member of the group, also lives in Huancavelica with her husband and 3 year old son. Her business, which she has had for two and a half years, includes the buying and selling of animals such as pigs and cows. Though her business is doing well now, she has had some trouble in the past, as do all start-up businesses. Since Ana joined FINCA Perú her business has improved and she can only hope it will continue to do so. The loan she has requested will be invested in her business for the purchase of more animals and to increase her capital. She is currently saving to buy a house in Huancayo and start her business there. In addition, she hopes that with the success of her business she will be able to put her son in a good school.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Yoli

texts.es: Yoli tiene 46 años, es madre de 2 hijos, es una mujer muy activa, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, y en sus ratos libres brinda el servicio de corte de cabello en su domicilio.Ella es madre soltera, trabaja duro papa brindar a sus hijos la educación necesaria, esperando que los mismos, en el futuro sean unos profesionalesYoli quiere crecer en su negocio, y con el tiempo llegar a ser mayoritaria de abarrotes y desde luego construir un pequeño local para poner su salón de belleza, para esto requiere de un capital que la incentivará a lograr su meta en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Yoli is 46 years old, is the mother of 2 children, and is a very active woman. She sells groceries and in her spare time gives haircuts in her home. She is a single mother and works hard to provide her children with necessary education, hoping that in the future they will become professionals. Yoli wants to build her business, first primarily in grocery sales, and later she would like to build a small place to have a beauty salon. For this she needs capital which would encourage her to reach her goal in a short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased investment capital for her grocery store and future beauty salon

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo, a sus 62 años es madre de 6 hijos, los mismos que ya son profesionales e independientes, hijos que la hacen sentir muy orgullosa.Quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio, para ello necesita arreglarlo, así como también mejorar los ambientes. El propósito de Viviana es ampliar su negocio y llegar a tener un Minimarket, para ello requiere del capital que la ayudará a concretar su objetivo. Con tu ayuda Viviana verá crecer su negocio en un corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Viviana has been selling groceries for a long time. At 62 years of age, she is the mother of 6 children who are now professionals and independent—children who make her feel very proud. She wants to continue building her business, and to do this she needs to make some repairs and improve the atmosphere of her place. Vivian’s intention is to expand her business and eventually have a Minimarket. For this she needs capital to help her achieve her goal. With your help, Viviana will see her business grow quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business and increase her merchandise

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina se dedica a la venta de madera trabajada (cortada en diferentes medidas) desde ya hace varios años atrás, ingresó en este negocio gracias a su esposo Manuel, que es maderero. En la actualidad la madera la lleva a muchas mueblerías, quienes son sus principales clientes, ella se siente a gusto con su trabajo, ya que por medio del mismo apoya a su pareja para con los gastos del hogar.Marcelina quiere alquilar un local para el almacenamiento de sus maderas y de esa manera proveer a sus clientes de una forma más rápida, es para ello que solicita este préstamo, para lograr  su objetivo.
texts.en:
Marcelina sells finished lumber (cut to different measurements). She got into this business thanks to her husband Manuel who is a logger. Currently the lumber goes to many furniture shops which are their principal clients. Marcelina likes her work as it is a way to help her husband with household expenses. Marcelina wants to rent a space for lumber storage in order to provide faster service to customers. She is requesting a loan so that she can reach this objective.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent space to store and sell lumber

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Su dedicación para dar una buena atención, es la actividad diaria D. Hermelinda, quien tiene una pequeña bodega, además también se dedica al alquiler D. habitaciones y al arte textil, estas actividades ayudan a sostener los gastos D. su familia. Es madre D. 4 hijos, los mismos que están estudiando carreras profesionales. En la actualidad, ella tiene el apoyo incondicional D. su esposo Manuel quien según sus posibilidades y tiempo la ayuda en su negocio. Hermelinda tiene el deseo D. mejorar los ambientes D. su negocio, ampliarlo e implementarlo y posteriormente mandar a refaccionar algunos pormenores D. las habitaciones que da en alquiler para brindar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Es por eso que ella necesariamente requiere D. un capital para cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Her dedication to good service is a part of the daily routine of Hermelinda, who runs a small general store, rents rooms, and does textile arts. These business activities help her cover the family expenses. She has 4 children, who are all pursuing degrees. She currently has the unconditional support of her husband, Manuel, who helps out with the business as much as possible. Hermelinda has the desire to improve her shop’s atmosphere, expand and strengthen the shop, and later have some things in her rented rooms repaired so that they can be more welcoming to her customers. Hence, she needs some capital to reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General store expansion

loans.name: Esmeralda De Ancco Group

texts.en:
At approximately 2,100 meters in the department of Huancavelica, in the province of Churcampa in the community of Anco you can find the community bank of Esmeralda D. Anco. The community of Anco is the thoroughfare between Ayacucho and Huancayo. There is also a large market for fruits in this area. 

Francisca R. R. lives in Anco and is part of the community bank Esmeralda D. Anco. She lives there with her husband and two children who are in school, ages 10 and 5. Francisca runs her own small grocery store where she began her business with a few things but since then it has developed and grown. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for one year and since then she has been able to build savings from the business at her grocery store. With the money she receives from the loans she invests into her business for continued growth. She has a goal of leaving Anco and finding a different place to make a bigger business. She is saving to buy land in Huancayo. 

Martha Y. F. also lives in Anco, she lives with her husband and her 4 children who are in school, and are 15, 12, 10, 8 years old. Martha runs her own hostel and her husband has a store where he sells items such as windows and mirrors. With her past loans her husband was able to open his window shop. She will use this loan to invest in her hostel. She dreams that with the income she and her husband receive from their jobs she will be able to keep her children in school so they can eventually have professional jobs. She is saving her money to have spending money now and just in case she needs it in the future for a surprise incident.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 51 años de edad, su negocio principal es la venta de productos para le hogar como cubre camas, frazadas, cafeteras y estufas pequeñas.  Este negocio lo ha tenido por 8 años juntamente con su esposo.  Los dos venden sus productos a domicilio en diferentes municipios del departamento de Chimatenango.
Gracias a este negocio han sacado a sus hijos adelante, dándoles educación   También en su casa tiene una venta carne de pollo, y este ingreso le ayuda a cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar.   Actualmente solo tiene a su cargo un hijo el mas pequeño, y su deseo es darle una mejor educación para que él pueda salir adelante en la vida.  Ella necesita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos y aprovechar la época que vendrá de finales de año.
texts.en:
Olga is 51 years old, and her business is making home products such as bedspreads, blankets, small coffee pots and stoves. She has had this business for 8 years along with her husband. Both of them sell products door to door in different municipalities of Chimatenango region. Thanks to this business they have been able help their children get ahead by providing them an education. Also in her home she sells chicken and this income has helped her meet their household expenses. Today she only has her youngest child to care for, and her wish is to give hi a better education so that he may be successful in his life. She needs a loan to invest in buying products and taking advantage of the upcoming end of year events.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business such as bedspreads, blankets and small appliances

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 46 años, se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones, así como también a la venta de juanes especiales (plato a base de arroz, típico de la región), es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes. Gracias al alquiler de habitaciones y a la venta de juanes solventó los gastos escolares de sus hijos. En la actualidad, necesita mejorar las condiciones de sus habitaciones y remodelar las estructuras y ambientes, para brindar una mejor comodidad a sus clientes. Para ello necesita del préstamo que solicita.
texts.en:
Lucia is 46 years old. She works renting rooms, and also sells juanes especiales (a meal based on rice, traditional to the region). She is a single mother and she has 5 children, all of whom are living independently. Thanks to renting out the rooms and the sale of juanes, she has met the educational expenses of her children. At the moment, she needs to improve the conditions of her rooms and remodel the structures and surroundings, in order to provide better comfort to her clients. For this she needs the loan that she is asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel and improve the rooms Lucia rents

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith es consultora de belleza de una línea cosmética muy conocida a nivel nacional, ella vende estos productos por los diferentes alrededores de la ciudad de Pucallpa, así como también es la encargada de buscar personas que quieran trabajar con ella en la venta de estos productos, la señora Judith deja sus productos a todo aquel que lo requiera a crédito o al contado. Ella tiene dos hijos a quienes les brinda lo necesario para que sigan estudiando y más adelante sean profesionales, su esposo Nofre es trabajador independiente, siempre la apoya en todo lo que se propone.A razón de que es un negocio rentable Judith quiere comprar más de estos productos cosméticos, así como también comprar una vitrina para su exhibición, es por eso que requiere de un préstamo para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Judith is a beauty consultant for a line of cosmetics well known at a national level. She sells these products throughout the different areas of the city of Pucallpa. This is how she does her other task of finding people who want to work with her selling these products. Señora Judith provides products to everyone who needs credit or those who can pay cash. She has two children to whom she provides what they need to continue studying and, down the road, to become professionals. Her husband Nofre is an independent worker, and always helps her in what she suggests. Because this is an income producing business, Judith wants to buy more of the cosmetic products, and also buy a display case to show them off. It is for this that she needs a loan in order to achieve her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of beauty products that Judith sells, and also to buy a display cabinet.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es: Llerme tiene 50 años, es madre de 4 hijos, siendo uno de ellos independiente ya, y los otros tres últimos son solteros y trabajan.Hace 2 años viene alquilando habitaciones en su propio domicilio y le va muy bien. Ella es una mujer con visión de negocio, pues quiere seguir ampliando sus habitaciones, así como también volver a vender comida por las noches, actividad que antes realizaba.Para mandar a construir más habitaciones y cumplir con lo que se ha propuesto, estima de una cantidad de dinero que solicita.
texts.en:
Llerme is a 50-year-old mother of four. The eldest child has a family, and the other three are single and working. Two years ago Llerme started renting out rooms in her home, and it has gone very well. She is a woman with a vision for her business, so she wants to enlarge her rooms and also sell meals at night, which she used to do and would like to start doing again. In order to build more rooms and fulfill all that she has proposed, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase and improve the rooms she rents in her home

loans.name: Fidela

texts.es: Fidela tiene 42 años, es madre de un hijo, que es su razón de salir adelante y a quien le demuestra sus ganas de superación. Es propietaria de 2 motocarros que los hace trabajar en transporte de pasajeros.Adicionalmente, trabaja como secretaria en una empresa de su localidad, sin embargo, su deseo es comprar repuestos y mandar a refaccionar sus motocarros para que trabajen mejor y produzcan mejores ingresos, posteriormente le gustaría tener un taller de motos y lubricentro, por lo que requiere de la cantidad de dinero que solicita, promete ser puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Fidela is 42 years old, mother of one son who is her reason to be successful and to whom she demonstrates her desire to succeed. She is the owner of 2 motorcars that work to transport passengers. In addition, she works as a secretary in a neighborhood business, nevertheless, her wish is to buy parts and send her motorcars for repair so that they work better and produce greater income. Later she would like to have a repair shop and lube center, so she requires the loan she seeks and promises to be punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts to repair her motorcars

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina tiene 31 años, es madre 3 hijos que están estudiando, ella trabaja arduamente para dar a sus hijos lo que necesitan, a pesar de ser madre soltera lucha mucho por ver a sus hijos felices y tranquilos.Se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (gaseosas, néctar y cerveza), es una mujer prometedora, cuando dice algo lo cumple y eso es superarse en su negocio. Gina, por las noches, también vende comida al paso.  Ahora quiere implementar su negocio con más productos de otras marcas, así como también ampliar y mejorar los ambientes de su tienda, para lograr este propósito requiere de dinero, por lo que solicita este préstamo, con el fin de cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Gina is 31 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard in order to provide her children with everything they need. Despite the hardships of being a single mother, she works hard to ensure that her children are happy and calm. She sells cold drinks (soda, juice and beer); she is a very promising woman who has pledged to get ahead with her business, and she always keeps her word. She also sells food at night. Now, she wants to stock her business with a wider variety of products of different brands and expand and improve the space of her store. In order to achieve this goal, she needs more money, which is why she has requested this loan from PRISMA.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand store, buy a wider variety of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José Antonio tiene 32 años, es soltero, trabaja brindando servicios de cabinas públicas de Internet.Empezó en este negocio con solo 4 computadoras, ahora cuenta con más de 10 máquinas y se siente orgulloso del crecimiento de su negocio. Mediante este servicio brinda muchas facilidades a las personas de su entorno, sin embargo, no sólo quiere quedarse en eso, él tiene visiones para otros negocios. Por ahora, quiere mandar a ampliar y mejorar las condiciones de su local y para esto estima de un capital en lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 32 years sold, single, and his work involves providing internet stations for public use. He started his business with only four computers, and he now has more than ten. He is very proud of the growth he’s seen in his business. Through this enterprise, he provides a great service to the people of his area. Despite this, however, he doesn’t want to just provide internet access services but would also like to expand into other businesses. For now, he would like to expand and improve his location and for this he needs capital as soon as possible.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion and improvement of the location where he has his internet access computer stations.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, a sus 30 años es madre de 2 hijos que están estudiando y necesitan mucho apoyo, su esposo Omar trabaja en una empresa de su localidad y cuando puede la apoya en su peluquería. En su casa, brinda servicios de corte de cabello, peinados y otros, ya que estudio cosmetología. Mercedes es una mujer muy trabajadora pues cuando no tiene trabajo en la peluquería se dedica a la venta de productos  de belleza. Ahora quiere implementar y alquilar un local para poner su salón de belleza, así como también mejorar las infraestructuras de su vivienda, por lo que presenta esta solicitud de préstamo.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 30-year-old mother of two children who are in school and need a lot of support. Her husband, Omar, works at a local business and when he can helps Mercedes with her beauty shop. At her home, she provides hair-cutting, combing and other services she learned at beauty school. She is a very hard-working women who made a living selling cosmetics before she started working at the salon. Now she wants to expand her business and rent a storefront to setup her beauty shop, as well as make improvements to her home. For this, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a storefront to set up her salon

loans.name: Alcidia

texts.es: Alcidia tiene 51 años, es madre D. 6 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes, se quedaron en casa ella y su esposo Waldir quien trabaja como albañil y siempre la apoya en todo. DesD. muy temprana edad aprendió a coser, a razón D. que una D. sus tías ejercía este oficio, aprendió este arte empíricamente, sin embargo, la experiencia y la practica hacen D. esta madre una máquina D. trabajo, ya que es muy solicitada por su buena labor. Alcidia quiere seguir surgiendo en este negocio del arte textil, para ello quiere implementarse con más materiales y posteriormente mandar a ampliar el lugar donD. tiene su pequeño taller, para  realizar su meta estima D. un préstamo. Apoyemos a esta madre que con talento y esfuerzo lucha duro por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alcidia, 51, is the mother of 6 children, all of whom are now independent. She lives with her husband, Waldir, a construction worker, who always supports her unconditionally. She learned to sew at a very young age by closely watching an aunt who sewed. Experience and practice have paid off for this mother of six because her skills are widely solicited. Alcidia wants to continue building this business of textile arts and to do so she wants to buy more materials and expand her small workshop. To reach her goal, she needs a loan. Let's support this woman who, with talent and hard work, is fighting to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand workshop and buy materials for sewing business.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela se dedica a la venta de madera trabajada (cortada en diferentes medidas) ingresó en este negocio gracias a la ayuda de unos amigos que laboran en ello. La madera la vende seleccionada de acuerdo a la calidad, y gracias a la buena administración de su negocio, puso a lado del mismo una pequeña ferretería, donde concurren muchos mototaxistas, quienes son sus principales clientes, ella se siente a gusto con su trabajo ya que por medio del mismo solventa las necesidades de su hijo, que es la razón de su vida. Ella es madre soltera, sin embargo, no eso, no truncó su camino por seguir adelante, ya que se considera una microempresaria.Mariela quiere alquilar otro local para el almacenamiento de sus maderas trabajadas y de esa manera proveer a sus consumidores de una forma rápida, sin embargo, para esto estima de un capital para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Mariela makes a living selling lumber of different sizes, an activity she entered thanks to the help of friends who also work in the field. The wood she sells is selected according to quality, and thanks to her good business skills, she set up shop on the side of a small hardware store that is popular among taxi drivers, her principle customers. She feels pleased with her work since it has help provide for her son, her reason for living. Mariela is a single mother, but she did not let that stand in her way when she considered starting her small business. She wants to rent another storefront to warehouse her merchandise and in this way can fulfill her customers' orders more quickly. Of course, she needs capital to achieve this objective, which is why she's requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a storefront to store her lumber products

loans.name: Tito

texts.es: Tito, de 29 años de edad, dedicado a la venta de comida, es padre de 2 hijos que están estudiando, y desde luego son su mayor inspiración de seguir adelante en su negocio. Él inicia en esta actividad para generar el sustento de su familia, su esposa Anne lo apoya en todas sus decisiones y desde luego, también en su negocio. Tito quiere ampliar su kiosco, para brindar así, una mejor acogida a sus clientes, ya que cuenta con buena cantidad de  fieles comensales que degustan de su buena sazón, para ello estima de un préstamo para llegar a cumplir con su meta. Con tu ayuda has posible el objetivo de este padre trabajador.
texts.en:
Tito is 29 years old and makes a living selling food. He's a father of two children who are in school and are his main inspiration to make headway with his business. He started out in this field to provide for his family. His wife, Anne, supports him in all his decisions, and, since he started, the business as well. Tito wants to enlarge his kiosk to make his business more welcoming to customers, and he already has a good number of faith clients who enjoy the great taste of his dishes. To fulfill his goal, he's requesting a loan, and with your help this hard-working father will achieve it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlarging food kiosk

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Se inicia en el negocio de la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, a razón de su hijo, por darle todo lo necesario. Luz es una mujer que lucha duro por salir adelante, gracias a su buena atención y sobre todo administración, está saliendo adelante, junto a su esposo Jorge, quien es mecánico, tienen la ilusión de crecer y progresar juntos, es por eso que Luz decidió implementar y ampliar su negocio, sin embargo, necesita de un capital para lograr su objetivo. Con tu ayuda esta madre saldrá adelante en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Luz started her business selling groceries and basic goods in order to help her son and provide for his necessities. Luz is a very hard-working woman; thanks to her care and management of her business, she is progressing together with her husband Jorge, a mechanic. They have the dream of growing and succeeding together which is why Luz decided to expand her business. However, she needs greater capital in order to achieve her goal. With your help, this mother will be able to reach her goals in the short-term.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of grocery store

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 34 años, es madre D. 4 hijos que son su razón D. ser y D. salir adelante en su negocio, peluquería, se dedica a  esta actividad desD. hace mucho tiempo, a razón D. haber estudiado en un centro ocupacional, este oficio.Liliana apoya mucho a su esposo, quien se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes por los diferentes caseríos del río Ucayali. Ella pertenece a un banco comunal, y gracias al apoyo que le dan invierte en su peluquería y lo demás en abarrotes, ya que es lo que más produce. Ahora necesita D. una cantidad D. dinero para alquilar un local e instalar su peluquería y desD. luego quiere incrementar el negocio D. abarrotes y brindar lo necesario a los clientes D. su esposo y así, juntos, salir adelante.
texts.en:
Liliana is 34 years old and a mother of four children that are her reason for being and to move forward in her business, a hair salon. Her career has been in hairstyling for a long time because she studied it as her primary occupation. Liliana greatly supports her husband, who has a career in selling groceries to the different farm houses around the Ucayali River. She belongs to the community bank, and thanks to the investment they have given her hair salon and subsequently, her husband’s grocery business, she has already been able to produce more income. Now she needs this loan to rent a local store to open the hair salon and also from which she could increase her grocery business. This will allow her to proviD. what is necessary to her husband’s customers, and in this way, together, they can move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a local store to open a hair salon and also from which to increase the grocery sales of her husband.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, D. 61 años D. edad es madre D. 5 hijos, todos profesionales gracias a la buena orientación que les impartieron ella y su esposo Ulderico.Ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas heladas, venD. gaseosas, cervezas, y postres como queques y galletas en su domicilio, en la actualidad, no cuenta con un ambiente apropiado para este negocio por lo que quiere mandar a construir un local para ello.Dora tiene el deseo D. implementar y ver crecer su negocio, por ello necesita D. la cantidad que solicita, para poder lograr lo que desea.
texts.en:
Dora, 61 years old, is the mother of 5 children, who are all professionals thanks to the good upbringing that she and her husband, Ulderico, gave them. She sells cold drinks, soft drinks, beer and desserts such as cakes and cookes from her home. She does not currently have a proper place for this business and would like to build a space for this purpose. Dora wants to set up and see her business grow. For this she needs the loan she has applied for, so that she can achieve what she wants.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a space for her business and increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Arminita

texts.es: Arminita vende ropa para niños y adultos de segunda mano, así como también zapatos y otras variedades, prendas que las deja a sus clientes al crédito o al contado. Ella trabaja muy duro con la sola intención de sacar adelante a sus hijos y desde luego crecer con su negocio para adquirir más adelante su propia tienda. Arminita tiene 52 años, es madre soltera, y el cargar esta responsabilidad tan grande no es razón de quedarse atrás, sino es un momento de reflexión y superación, nos menciona. Ella quiere salir adelante en su negocio de venta de ropa, incluso quiere mandar a construir un local en su propio domicilio. Pero requiere de un préstamo para lograr su meta. Apoyemos a esta madre que muestra sus ganas de superación.
texts.en:
Arminita sells second-hand clothes for children and adults, along with shoes and other clothing items, that her customs buy with cash or credit. She works very hard with the single goal of improving the lives of her children. She wants to grow her business by acquiring her own store someday. Arminita, 52, is a single mother, a great responsibility that hasn't held her back, she tells us, but overcome. She wants to grow her clothing business and even build a shop at her house for it, but she needs a loan to meet her goals. Let's support this woman who has demonstrated a strong drive to beat the odds.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a shop for clothing business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 49 años, es madre de 8 hijos, de los cuales 4 ya son independientes y los otros 4 están a su cargo y son estudiantes, por lo que la inspiran a seguir adelante, junto a esposo Gabriel, quien la apoya en todo y sobre todo en su negocio, son los encargados de brindar todo lo necesario a sus hijos, es por eso que trabajan con muchas ganas.Su negocio que es la venta de carbón, realiza esta actividad desde hace varios años atrás y  le va muy bien, ya que este producto lo vende a distintos restaurantes.Para hacer el carbón trabajan muy duro, su esposo arma el volcán de aserrín, llevando dentro la madera que se convertirá, en un lapso de 5 días, en carbón, para después llevarlo a vender a quienes lo requieren. Margarita quiere surgir y salir adelante, con el tiempo espera llegar a ser exportadora. Para lograr este propósito requiere de un capital para aumentar su producción, esto le ayudará a cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Margarita is 49 years old and a mother a 8 children, four of who are independent, the other four are students and still under her care. Her children inspire her to move forward, together with her husband, Gabriel, who supports her in everything and above all, in her business. They are completely responsible to provide for the needs of their children, which is why they work very hard. Margarita’s business is the sale of carbon coals, which she has been doing for many years and has gone very well. Now she sells this product to different restaurants. To make the carbon coals requires a lot of effort. Her husband makes a volcano of dust, puts it inside a piece of wood and converts the dust to coals over a period of 5 days. Then they bring the coals to sell to anyone that needs it. Margarita wants to grow and move forward, with the hope that she will become an exporter someday. In order to achieve this proposal requires capital to increase production, and this will help her accomplish her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a large quantity of wood in order to increase production of carbon coals.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 36 años de edad, por muchos años ella se dedico a tejer ropa típica para mujer (güipiles), pero esta actividad no le dejaba muchas ganancias, y tomaba mucho tiempo recuperar su inversión.  Desde hace cuatro años, su negocio es la fabricación y venta de ropa o trajes de lana para niños, este negocio si le deja mejores ganancias y gracias a Dios ha ayudado a salir adelante.  Ella lamentablemente no pudo estudiar, pero esta conciente de la importancia de que sus hijos puedan estudiar y superarse en el futuro, en la actualidad tiene 6 hijos.   Su sueño es mejorar su situación económica, mejora la condición de su vivienda, y ayudar económicamente a su esposo quien se dedica a la actividad de agricultura.
texts.en:
Patricia is 36 years old. For many years she was dedicated to sewing typical women clothing ("güipiles"), but this activity did not leave her with many earnings and it took her a long time to recover her investment. Since four years ago her business has been making and selling wool clothes and pants for children. This business gives her better earnings and, thanks to God, has helped her improve her life. She unfortunately could not study but she is aware of how important it is for her kids to be able to study and succeed in the future. Presently, she has six children. Her dream is to improve their economic situation, improve their living conditions, and economically assist her husband, who works in agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make wool clothing

loans.name: Marlita

texts.es: Marlita tiene 55 años, vive con su hermana, es madre de 6 hijos que están fuera del hogar, ya son independientes gracias a la educación y buenas costumbres que ella  las impartió como madre, se separó de su pareja y a pesar de esto, trabajo duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos de quienes se siente muy orgullosa. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas para contribuir con los gastos del hogar, debido al carisma con el que cuenta y la concurrencia de sus clientes se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar e implementar su negocio, es por eso que requiere de un capital para lograr su meta trazada. Con tu apoyo la señora Marlita logrará lo que quiere en el tiempo menos pensado.
texts.en:
Marlita is 55 years old, lives with her sister, and is the mother of 6 children that all live outside of the household. They are independent of her thanks to the education and good habits that Marlita has given them. She separated from her husband and in spite of this, she works hard to move forward along with her children, who she feels proud of. She makes a living by selling candies in order to contribute to the bills of the household. Due to her competitor and his charisma, she finds the need to grow and increase her business. This goal requires capital and with your support, Marlita will achieve what she would like with less difficulty.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up her business of selling candies

loans.name: Robin

texts.es: Robin tiene 27 años, es soltero, y tiene muchas metas, y por el cumplimiento de ellas, trabaja muy duro.Se dedica a la venta de ropa, la vende por diferentes lugares, dejando incluso sus prendas de vestir a sus clientes al crédito, en sus ratos libres cuidado un terreno donde piensa vivir solo e independiente, actualmente vive con sus dos hermanos y su papá quien es agricultor. Robin  trabaja duro para aportar con los gastos familiares y sus gastos personales.Quiere seguir en este negocio, ya que le es rentable, y posteriormente, alquilar un local para poner una tienda de ropa, es por ello que necesita del capital que hará posible cumplir su anhelo.
texts.en:
Robin is 27 years old, single, and has many goals in which he works very hard to accomplish. He makes a living by selling clothes in different places, and even sells the clothing to his customers on credit. In his free time, he takes care of the land where he would like to live alone and independently. Right now, he lives with his two brothers and his father who is a farmer. Robin works hard to contribute to the family and personal bills. He wants to continue in this business, which is already profitable, and also to rent a local store to set up his clothing shop. He needs capital in order to do these things and to make possible the fulfillment of his greatest wish.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of clothes he sells, to be able to rent a local store for his business

loans.name: Vencedoras Group

texts.en:
Vencedoras Community Bank is located in Huancavelica, in the community of Locrojo. Locrojo is located at 3,300m to the northeast of the capital of Churcampa. Dedicated to the production of corn, potatoes and peas, this community is also known for raising cows, pigs and smaller animals. 

Ana M. B. is part of the Vencedoras Community bank and lives in Huancavelica with her four children aged 17, 14, 8 and 5. Her business includes selling children's clothes, which she sells to members of her community. Unfortunately, last year there was a robbery at her stO., but with the help of FINCA Perú she has been able to continue her business. She would like to invest the loan she receives into improving her stO.. FINCA Perú has taught her the importance of saving and since she started with FINCA she's been saving to be able to take care of any emergencies that might happen to her or her family. Ana's goal is to make sure her children are in school and continue to be educated, and to earn mO. at her stO.. 

Carmen Rosa E. Q. is also part of the Vencedoras Community bank. She lives in Huancavelica with her four children aged 10, 8, 6 and 4. She has been selling and buying animals for the past five years. Carmen understands that all businesses have their highs and lows and with her savings, which is encouraged at FINCA Perú, she has been able to continue to proviD. for her family. She will invest her loan into improving her business.  She dreams of one day being able to buy her own land and build a new house, and with the help from loans and savings she will be able to do this.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Lira

texts.es: Lira tiene 36 años, es madre de 3 hijos que estudian y son su aspiración de seguir  luchando en su negocio. Su esposo Carlos, quien siempre la apoya en lo posible, está de acuerdo con sus propósitos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, es una  madre que desde muy temprana edad ingresó en este negocio, es por eso que en la actualidad cuenta con una gran clientela, gracias a su buena atención.A parte de querer seguir surgiendo en su negocio, quiere mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, sin embargo, no cuenta con lo suficiente para lograr lo que desea, es por eso que estima de un capital para poder cumplir con su objetivo. Ayuda a la señora Lira madre que demuestra su interés de seguir  adelante.
texts.en:
Lira is 36 years old and a mother of 3 children that are students and her inspiration for continuing to fight for her business. Her husband, Carlos, always supports her in what is possible and agrees with her objectives. She makes a living by selling natural products and has run her business since an early age. This has resulted in a large list of customers, thanks to her attentiveness. Besides wanting to continue developing her business, she would like to improve the infrastructure of her home. However, she does not say she has enough to attain what she desires, which is why she estimates that the capital will be able to fulfill her goal. Help Lira, a mother who shows her interest to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of natural products she sells and also fix some structures in her house.

loans.name: Francis

texts.es: Francis, de 29 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, quienes son el significado de vivir y seguir luchando para salir adelante, ella y su esposo Eduardo tienen el deseo de progresar en su negocio y mediante el mismo, sacar adelante a sus hijos. Francis se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, esta tienda es el sustento económico de ella y su  familia. Ahora tiene el propósito de ampliar su negocio, comprar productos comestibles y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, por lo que necesariamente estima de un capital que la llevará a cumplir con su objetivo. Gracias a tu ayuda la señora Francis logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Francis is 29 years old and has two children. They are her motivation to live and to continue fighting to get ahead. Francis and her husband Eduardo would like to grow their business and use it as a means of getting their children ahead. Francis sells groceries and basic goods, and her store supports her and her family. Now she would like to expand her business, buy food products, and above all, improve the structure of her home. She therefore needs the capital to reach her goal. Thanks to your help, Mrs. Francis will achieve her goal in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of basic goods that she sells in her store.

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es: Sonia tiene 24 años de edad,  inicio su negocio hace 3 años vendiendo golosinas, maíz, aguas gaseosas y fríjol.  Su pequeña tienda de productos de consumo ha crecido  paso el tiempo, y ha surtido mas.  Hoy en día ella también tiene un depósito de aguas gaseosas, y las que reparte a otros negocios mas pequeños cercanos al área donde vive, también vende y pan a domicilio. Con el tiempo ella ha ayudado a su esposo con el negocio que el tiene que es la elaboración de camisas de vestir. Ella desea el crédito ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes, y quiere hacer más grande su tienda, para aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.  Su sueño es ahorrar y cuando sus hijos pequeños estudien poder cubrir y ayudar a esos gastos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 24 years old and started her business 3 years ago selling candies, corn, sodas, and beans. Her small store of products has grown over time and has developed significantly. Today she also has a warehouse of sodas that she distributes to other smaller businesses close to the area where she lives. She also sells and delivers bread. During this time, she has helped her husband with his business that manufactures shirts. She desires this loan because she has a large demand of customers and would like to grow her store to take advantage of the end of the year parties. Her dream is to save and be able to cover the bills when her small children become students.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in groceries for the growth of her business.

loans.name: Milca

texts.es: Milca  se dedica  a la venta de pescado, pero por la temporada y la escasez del mismo no está ejerciendo esta actividad, sin embargo trabaja en una casa como empleada domestica, sus ganas de seguir adelante son motivadas por sus hijos, que estudian y tienen mucho entusiasmo de continuar con sus estudios. Milca y su esposo Bernardo se apoyan mutuamente para lograr que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional.También desea mejorar su vivienda y para ello necesita comprar materiales de construcción, es por eso que requiere de un capital para llegar a concretar con su propósito.
texts.en:
Milca makes a living selling fish, but due to the season and product shortage, she's currently not partaking in this activity. Instead, she's working as a housemaid. Her goal is to make headway for her children, who are in school and are very enthusiastic about continuing their studies. Milca and her husband, Bernardo, support each other so their children can work toward a professional degree. She also wants to make improvements to their home, and for this she needs to purchase building materials. She's requesting a loan so she can carry out her intentions.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to make repairs on her home

loans.name: Anta Group

texts.en:
You can find the community bank, Anta, at approximately 3,400 meters in the in the province of Acobamba in Huancavelica in the Andes mountains of Perú. The principal economic activity in this area is agriculture including potatoes, and in the urban zone is more related to commercial businesses and services.

Delmira Araha M. lives in Anta with her husband and five children, aged 28, 25, 22, 18 and 16. The loan she has requested is for 300 nuevos soles (approximately $100). She runs a grocery store that also provides phone services. Delmira opened her store five years ago with very few things and has been able to invest in her store with loans received from FINCA Perú. Since all of her children have finished school they help her with her store. With the income she receives she hopes to improve her business and cover necessities with the help of her husband. She has also been saving money to improve her business and also to have a savings just in case something happens to her and/or her family in the future.

Luzmila Q. E. lives in Anta with her husband and three children, aged 16, 13 & 10. Her loan request is for 600 nuevos soles (approx. $200). She has had her own small restaurant for the past two years. She had problems when she first opened her restaurant because she didn't have a reputation yet in the neighborhood, but she now has many clients. She has been able to invest in her restaurant by purchasing more chairs and tables, with the loans she receives from FINCA. She dreams that her restaurant and the savings she accumulates will keep her children in school so they can eventually become professionals.

loans.use: The 10 members need different amounts of loans, ranging from 300, 400 and 1000 soles, totaling 5050 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to lend to the village bank.

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka, junto a su esposo Marcial, quieren dar a sus 4 hijos los estudios necesarios, esperando un día que los mismos sean profesionales. Ellos se dedican a la agricultura; siembran, cosechan y venden sus productos (plátano, yuca, maíz y otros)Marcial es el encargado de sembrar y cuidar los cultivos, cuando ya están listos los entrega a su esposa para que ella los lleve a diferentes lugares y los venda.Ahora, Milka desea arreglar algunas estructuras de su casa, además de comprar semillas para la siembra, para hacer esto posible necesita de una cantidad de dinero, que solicita en calidad de préstamo. Apoyemos a la señora Milka, mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Milka, with her husband Marcial, wants to give her four children an education so they become professionals one day. Currently they all work in agriculture; they sow, harvest and sell products like plaintains, yuca, and corn. Marcial is responsible for the harvest, and when they are ready for delivery his wife takes them to different places for sale. Milka wants to fix some of the structures in her house and buy seeds for the harvest. In order to do this she needs a loan. Lets support Milka, a woman with a lot of dreams to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to reconstruct parts of her house. Purchase of seeds for harvesting.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 39 años de edad, empezó su negocio solo haciendo costuras de delantales y venta de blusitas hace 15 años, y los vendía de manera ambulante. Con el paso del tiempo ella empezó a vender cortes, y güipiles, y con el tiempo sus clientes la buscaron en su casa. Al  ver ya el crecimiento de su negocio y la demanda de ropa, hace 2 años compró su local en el mercado de San Pedro Sacatepequez. Ella Actualmente vende güipiles cortes, fajas blusas rebozos todo típico y algunos productos cosméticos y de cuidado personal en su negocio. Ella solicita en capital porque ya viene la fiesta navideña y desea invertir capital para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año.  Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan completar sus estudios y superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Alicia is 39 years old, she began her business making aprons and blouses 15 years ago and she would sell them on the street. With time she began to sell traditional mayan skirts and ponchos, and with time her customers sought her out in her home. Upon seeing the growth of her business and the demand for her clothing, 2 years ago she bought a locale in the San Pedro Sacatepequez market. Today she sells traditional textile ponchos, skits, sashes, blouses, and shawls along with some cosmetic and personal care products in her business. She is asking for a loan because of the upcoming Christmas holiday and she wishes to take advantage of the end of year sales. Her dream is that her children complete school and become successful in life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing wholesale to sell at retail in her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena  es propietaria de dos motocarros, al mismo tiempo, se dedica  a la venta de pescado, tiene cuatro hijos menores que estudian. Su esposo Ulises es chofer de uno de los motocarros y realiza transporte de pasajeros, y se encarga de cuidado de estas.En el futuro, desean que sus hijos sean profesionales, es por eso que Elena vende pescado en un puesto del mercado para incrementar los ingresos económicos.Solicita este dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento y arreglo de sus motos, además de mejorar la venta de su pescado. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación  sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.
texts.en:
Elena is the owner of two motorcars and she also sells fish. She has 4 children, all of whom study. Her husband Ulises is a driver of one of the motorcars and he transports passengers and is in charge of maintaining the motorcars. In the future they hope that their children become professionals, and this is why Elena sells fish from a stand in the market, to increase their income. She is asking for this money to invest in the maintenance and care of their motorcars as well as improve selling fish. We support this mother who with effort and dedication continues working hard in order to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motorcars and invest in fish selling business

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Natividad tiene 36 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional, su dedicación a esta actividad es debido a sus tres hijos, quienes estudian, su esposo Eduardo siempre está de acuerdo con el negocio de su Nati, como él la llama. Ambos decidieron trabajar duro para dar  a sus hijos lo necesario. Natividad quiere seguir prosperando en su negocio y también desea comprar una vitrina para poder mostrar sus productos, adicionalmente, vende pescado en un puesto del mercado de su localidad.El dinero que solicita será invertido en la mejora e implementación de su negocio. Ayudemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación lucha por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Natividad is 36 years old, and she works selling cosmetics of a well known trademark. Her work ethic is inspired by her children, all of whom are currently studying. Eduardo is always supportive of Nati's business, as he likes to call her. They have both worked very hard to give their children everything they need. Natividad wants her business to grow, and for this purpose she wants to buy a display window for all her products. The loan will be invested in the improvement of her business. `

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of pcosmetics she sells and purchase a display window for exhibiting her products.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Su ardua dedicación a la venta de videos musicales, hicieron de Ana una mujer de negocio, ya que cuenta en la actualidad con dos puestos de venta de CDs. Es madre soltera y su ardua labor como padre y madre hacen que salga adelante. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace muchos años atrás, y gracias a esto solventa las necesidades de sus 3 hijos estudiantes, se siente orgullosa de tener unos hijos lindos y buenos.  Ahora Ana tiene la necesidad de ampliar y mejorar sus puestos. Para seguir creciendo en su negocio, es que solicita esta cantidad de dinero, y con e tiempo tener un local propio y amplio para vender sus CDs. Ayudemos a la señora Ana a cumplir con su propósito.
texts.en:
Her strong commitment to selling music videos has made Ana a woman of business and she now has two CD sales stands. She's a single mother and the difficult responsibility of being both father and mother has pushed her to get ahead. She has worked at her business for many years and thanks to it she's been able to provide for her 3 school-aged children. She's proud of having such good and beautiful children. Ana now needs to expand and improve her stands. She's applying for this loan so that she can continue to grow her business and, in time, have her own large shop for selling her CDs. Let's help Ana meet her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and improve stand for CD sales business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es: Teresita es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo, colaboradora, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, la misma que  deja  a crédito y al contado a sus clientes.Tiene 28 años, y es muy dedicada al trabajo, es madre de una hija preciosa de nombre Treysi, quien es su inspiración de seguir adelante y su esposo Edwin, quien trabaja como guardia de seguridad de una empresa está de acuerdo con los propósitos de su esposa, es por ello que ambos hacen de todo por seguir adelante.Ella invertirá el dinero que solicita en el alquiler de un local para la venta de sus prendas de vestir. Con el apoyo de todos podrá salir adelante.
texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking and, above all, collaborative woman. She dedicates herself to selling secondhand clothing, which she sells to her customers on credit and for cash. She is twenty-eight years old and very dedicated to her work. She is the mother of a beautiful girl named Treysi, who is her inspiration to keep going forward. Her husband Edwin, who works as a company security guard, agrees with his wife’s intentions. That is why they both do everything they can to go forward. She will invest the money that she receives in a rental space to sell her clothes. With the support of everyone she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a space to sell clothes.

loans.name: Yorlenis

texts.es: Yorlenis, de 27 años de edad, tiene una hija de 3 añitos, de nombre Karina, la misma que es la razón de su vida.Ella es propietaria de un motocarro usado para el transporte de pasajeros, manejado por su esposo Edy, quien siempre la apoya en todo, ambos quieren brindar a su niña lo necesario, y velar por el momento con respecto a su alimentación y salud, ahorrando para los futuros gastos de educación.Para mejorar su herramienta de trabajo (moto) requiere comprar repuestos para mandarla a repara, ya que es el único sustento que tienen, ella se ha trazado una meta, ahorrar dinero para más adelante, mediante un préstamo, completar para la compra de un carro sanguchero y dedicarse a la venta de salchipapas y así tener un ingreso mas en su casa.Con tu ayuda la señora Yorlenis logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Yorlenis is 27 years old, and she has a three-year-old daughter named Karina who is her life’s purpose. She owns a three-wheeler van used for transporting passengers. Her husband Edy, who always supports her in everything, drives the three-wheeler. They both want to give their daughter everything she needs. For the time being, they watch over her nutrition and health, saving for her future education expenses. To improve her work equipment (the three-wheeler), Yorlenis needs to buy spare parts in order to repair it, since it is the family’s only source of income. She has set herself a goal: to save money for the future and, with the help of a loan, end up buying a motorized vending cart and dedicating herself to the sale of salchipapas (sausage and french fries). This would provide her household with an additional source of income. With your help Yorlenis will reach her goal quickly.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts to repair her three-wheeler van.

loans.name: Leisy

texts.es: Se dedica a la venta de muebles, lo hace por sus 3 pequeños hijos quienes estudian el nivel primario, Leisy de 33 años de edad, es una madre muy proactiva, anteriormente se dedicó a varias actividades, pero ahora vio factible quedarse con la venta de muebles, tiene el apoyo de su esposo Rolando quien es el encargado de fabricar dichos muebles para que ella los venda, también brindan servicios de carpintería.Ahora quiere implementar, y sobre todo ampliar y mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, para ello requiere de un capital para cumplir con su objetivo. Con tu ayuda la señora Leisy logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leisy sells furniture to provide for her three young children, who are in elementary school. She is 33 years old and a very proactive mother. She has had different jobs in the past, but now she thinks that continuing selling furniture is feasible for her. She has the support of her husband Rolando, who is in charge of making the furniture that she sells. They also offers carpentry services to their clients. Now she wants to set up, and above all improve and expand her business’ facilities. Her goal requires capital. With your help, Mrs. Leisy will achieve her goal in very little time.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her business, and improving her business' facilities.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara  es propietaria de un motocarro, pero al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene tres hijos menores, que estudian, su esposo Pedro es el chofer del motocarro y es quien se dedica al cuidado de su herramienta de trabajo, en el futuro desean que sus hijos sean profesionales, es por eso que trabajan arduamente.Sara requiere de una suma de dinero, que invertirá en el mantenimiento y arreglo de su motocarro y para alquilar un local la para su venta de ropa. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.
texts.en:
Sara is the owner of a three-wheeler van; she sells clothing and takes care of her three young children, who are studying. Her husband Pedro both drives and takes care of the three-wheeler. They both work hard to give their children the chance to have successful professional lives when they grow up. Sara needs money to invest in the maintenance and repair of her van. She will also use the money to a rent space for selling her clothing. Let’s support this mother and worker who, with effort and dedication, works hard to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing her three-wheeler van, and renting a space to sell her clothing.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 43 años de edad, tiene 8 hijos, 6 de ellos ya son independientes, quedando dos que estudian, es por eso que trabaja duro para brindarles el apoyo necesario.Ella se dedica a la venta de chupetes, hielos y gelatinas, que lleva a vender por las distintas zonas de la ciudad de Pucallpa, también vende verduras en un puesto del mercado, las que le generan ingresos suficientes para seguir adelante y mantener a su familia. Maritza es madre soltera y su afán de seguir creciendo con su negocio es motivado por sus hijos, quienes son su razón de vivir. Quiere superarse en este negocio complementándose con otros productos, para que logre todo esto, necesita de un capital. Apoya a esta madre luchadora, que trabaja duro por prosperar y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 43 years old and has 8 children, 6 of them who are already independent. The other two are still finishing their studies, and this is why Maritza is working hard to give them the necessary support. She works in the sale of candy, ice cream, and jelly, products she sells in different parts of the city Pucallpa. She also sells the most profitable vegetables; the money of all these sales is destined to improve her business and provide better opportunities for her children. Maritza is a single mom, and her intention of investing in her business further is motivated by the desire to keep helping her children. She wants to diversify her business by selling other products, and in order to do this, she needs an initial capital.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Diversify her sales by purchasing a wider variety of products

loans.name: Tedy

texts.es: Tedy de 54 años de edad, es padre soltero, a pesar de cargar con la responsabilidad que tiene con sus 2 hijos lo hace con alegría, trabaja duro por darles lo necesario, los cuales son su razón de seguir adelante.Él es un hombre muy activo pues, aparte de tener su negocio de venta de productos naturales, lleva a vender “Juanes” (potaje típico de la selva, a base de arroz) por diferentes lugares de su zona, y cuando termina, continua con sus productos naturales, pues se considera un hombre activo y trabajador.Tedy quiere crecer en su negocio y con el tiempo llegar a tener una  tienda de sus productos naturales, para esto requiere de un capital que lo incentivará a lograr sus metas en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Tedy is 54 years old and he is a single father. He works hard to provide for his two sons, who are his motivation to keep moving forward. He is a very active man: not only does he sell a variety of natural products; he also sells "Juanes," a typical vetegable stew made out of rice. When he finishes selling this product to people near his area, he keeps working hard and continues selling his other natural products. Tedy wants his business to grow, and he wants to have a store where he can actually sell his products. A short term loan will help him achieve his goals in a short time span.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of natural products that he sells

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheng D., 28, and her husband, Mr. Khim Khon, 28, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1996 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of their children study in local schools.

Mrs. Sokheng has been a silk weaver since 1995, a skill she learned from a relative. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Khim is also a weaver and does construction work, farms, and raises animals as well.

Mrs. Sokheng is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy a construction crane for her husband's construction business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and to buy a construction crane for her husband

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
Mr. Lem L. (picture with his wife and vegetables), 41, and his wife, Mrs. Sarun Hul, 43, live along National Road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1986 and have three children: one daughter and two sons. One son is married and lives outside the family home, and the other son is a mason. Their daughter is a garment factory worker.

Mr. Lem and his wife have been farming since 1986. They grow vegetables to sell to the middle man in the village. Besides the farming business, Lem is also a fisherman. He has been fishing since 1984 and selling fish in the village. Currently, the couple wants to expand their farm but lacks the money. 

Therefore, Lem is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase seed, fertilizer to plant vegetables, and bamboo and net to sheathe plants from the sun.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and bamboo and net to sheathe plants from the sun

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina M., 45, and her husband, Mr. Prek Teng, 48, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of their children study in local schools. One daughter is a silk weaver.

Mrs. Sina has been a silk weaver for eleven years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle M. in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for three years.

Mrs. Sina is requesting a loan of $850 to purchase silk materials to continue her and her daughter's weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Mr. Tit U., 59, and his wife, Mrs. Sophy Khan, 61, live in a small village across the Mekong River about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, and the other three children have full-time employment. One daughter also studies in a local school.

Mr. Tit has been a wooden house builder for ten years. He does farming as well. His wife grows cucumbers and melons in the farm near the house. Tit is requesting a loan of $500 to build one restroom for use by his family.

loans.use: To build one restroom for use by the family

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
