Mr. Hor L., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Kan, 36, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have one daughter who studies in a local school.

Mr. Hor has been in the business of running a motorbike repair service in front of his house since 2006. He learned to repair motorbikes in 1987. This is his second loan from Kiva. With his first loan, Hor was able to save some money to buy a sugar cane juice machine for his wife, who sells sugar cane juice. Currently, Sophoin sells sugar cane juice in front of the house and also wants to expand her business by selling gasoline to travelers. The picture shows Sophoin and Hor with gasoline bottles and the sugar cane juice machine.

Therefore, Hor is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more motorbike and bicycle spare parts for his stock and to expand his wife's business of selling gasoline and sugar cane juice.

loans.use: To buy more motorbike and bicycle spare parts for his stock and to expand his wife's business of selling gasoline and sugar cane juice

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S., 37, is a widow with one son, who studies in a local school. Phalla lives in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh with her old mother, her son, and her sister who has full-time employment in Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Phalla has been a silk weaver for twenty one years, a skill she learned from her neighbor in 1987. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She hopes that her business will be able to support her son's studies to as high a level as possible.

Phalla is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business and to set up one new loom for her aunt to weave silk as well.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Khoeun N., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Sony Choub, 37, live along National Road Number Six about seventeen Kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1995 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in the local school.

Mr. Khoeun has been growing vegetables for seven years. He grows many types of vegetables on the farm near his house. Mrs. Sony does farming with her husband and raises pigs at home. Currently, she is creating a new business selling coffee in front of her house but lacks the money to build a shelter to serve her customers. Therefore, Khoeun is requesting a loan of $1000 to build a shelter for his wife to sell coffee and to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy piglets and to build a shelter for selling coffee

loans.name: Sles

texts.en:
Mr. Sles L. (pictured with his fishing nets), 51, and his wife, Mrs. Saros San, 47, live along National Road Number Six about twenty Kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1975 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the famiL. home. Two children study in the local school, and the other two children assist in the fishing business.

Mr. Sles and his wife have been fishing since they were young. They fish from the Mekong River and the lake near their village to sell to the middle man who sells the fish in Phnom Penh City. They also sell some fish in their village.
 
Sles is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase new fishing nets to replace broken nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mr. Leang L., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Nao Soeun, 41, live in a small village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of whom study in the local school.

Mr. Leang has been a TV and radio repairman for sixteen years. He buys old and broken TVs and radios to repair for resell at his shop in front of his house. His wife has been a garment factory worker for eight years. Leang is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cows for raising and to buy more spare parts for his TV and radio repair stock.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for repairing TVs and radios and to purchase cows to raise

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan N., 51, is a widow with two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives outside the family home, and the youngest daughter is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a small village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chan has been selling clothes for eight years. She buys them from the market in Phnom Penh for resale in her village and nearby villages. Chan is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more clothes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap P., 42, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter. All of her children study in the local school. Her eldest daughter weaves silk when she is free after school. Pheap and her children live with her old mother who is a silk weaver as well. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Pheap has been a silk weaver since 1988, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Subhan

texts.en: Subhan is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli, an Armenian-occupied territory in Azerbaijan. Currently, Subhan is settled in the Kayidish village which was built for IDPs. He has been involved in the taxi business for the past 10 years and now needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for a car

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children. She was born in 1977. She has been in the cattle breeding business for 5 years. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, and settled in the Fuzuli region in Bala Bahmanli village. Now this family needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 calves.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Fattah

texts.en: Fattah is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli, an Armenian-occupied territory in Azerbaijan. At present, Fattah is settled in the Bala Bahmanli village. For the past 8 years, he has been earning income as a painter. Currently, he needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy the necessary materials for improving his art business.

loans.use: Purchase of necessary materials for improving an art business

loans.name: Gazanfar

texts.en: Gazanfar is 37 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Baku. For the past 10 years he has been running his own farming business. At present, Gazanfar needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy fertilizers and seeds for improving his business.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila (whose husband is pictured in the photograph) is 54 years old and has 4 children. She lives in the Mashtaga settlement of Baku. For the past 20 years, Rahila has been running her own farming business. At present, her family needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy seeds and fertilizers for improving the business.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ikhtiyar

texts.en: Ikhtiyar is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli, the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Currently, Ikhtiyar is settled in Baku. For the past 3 years, he has been running a grocery sales business. At present, Ikhtiyar needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy various food items for sale in his store.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Ziyadkhan

texts.en: Ziyadkhan is married and has 4 children. He lives in a town called Khachmaz and earns income running a farming business which he started 10 years ago. At present, Ziyadkhan needs a loan of US$500 to buy seeds for his farm.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds for a farming business

loans.name: Simara

texts.en: Simara is married and has 2 children, one of whom is pictured in the photograph. She lives in a town called Khachmaz and is involved in the farming business which she started 8 years ago. At present, Simara needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy seeds for her farm.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds for a farming business

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en: Nargiz is married and has 3 children, one of whom is pictured in the photograph. Her family lives in a town called Khachmaz, where her son owns a taxi business which he started 4 years ago. At present, the family needs a loan of US$875 to buy spare parts to be able to improve the taxi business.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for a car

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: He is 27 years old, is married and has one child. Rashad started his taxi business five years ago. He currently lives in Baku City. Rashad would like a loan of $1200 to help buy more spare parts in order to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Khalilulla

texts.en: Khalilulla lives in Khachmaz town with his wife and three children. He started his farming business seven years ago. He would like a loan of $750 to buy seedlings to help improve the output of his business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings

loans.name: Zulviyya

texts.en: Zulfiyya, is 32 years old, is a widow, and has one child. She lives in Khachmaz town.  Zulfiyya buys agricultural produce for pickies and then sells them. She would like a loan of  $750 to buy agricultural produce for pickies to increase her output.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif Q. is 41 years old, married with two sons. Arif started his business because he needed extra income to pay for household and personal expenses and to afford his home. He has been selling men's and women's clothes and women's shoes for eight years and enjoys his work.

Arif would like to add new seasonal stock to his inventory. For this purpose he requests a loan of $1200. With your help, he can earn more and meet his two sons' school expenses. Arif would like to express his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase new seasonal stock for his inventory.

loans.name: Javanshir

texts.en:
Javanshir B. is 57 years old. He is married and has six children. Due to the lack of employment options in his country, it was difficult for Javanshir to find work and support his family. Therefore, six years ago, he decided to start his own business selling men's shoes. Step by step he has been able to expand his inventory and, thanks to the good service he offers, his business is now growing rapidly.

Currently Javanshir needs a loan of $1200 which he will use to buy additional merchandise to meet the demand of his clients and to continue expanding his sales business. Let's support him!

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to meet the demand of his clients.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal Q. is 25 years old. He is married with one child. 
Vusal raises and sells cattle. He purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds and cares for them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. Vusal has been in this business for four years. 
He is an expert in choosing and caring for the animals. He gets up every morning at five o’clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful, generating a considerable, stable income for his large family. 
Vusal is planning to enlarge his stock by purchasing more small cattle. For this purpose he requests $1,200 USD. You could become an important part of Vusal's family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar Q. is 45-year-old married man with two children. Vugar is a hard-working man who was taught farming form by his father. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business twelve years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and he is proud to say that the business has been running well, but he now needs additional capital to expand his business.

Therefore, Vusal is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to purchase four cattle for estimated cost 300 USD each. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran K. is 37 years old. He is married with two children. His wife is a housekeeper and Imran is a market vendor selling shoes for men in the local market. After 13 years of working at the market, Imran already has enough experience to do his work successfully. He has clients who always buy from him and now he is trying to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels. He works very hard to give his children a good education and to cover their basic needs.

Imran is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase new winter shoes for selling. For this purpose, he has applied for $1200. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all for supporting him.

loans.use: to purchase new winter shoes for selling

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin was born in 1979. He is married and has two children. He lives in Baku city. 

He has been in this clothing sales business for two years. Now he needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim A. is a happy father of two sons. Since 1995 he has been selling goods like shampoo, perfume and toothpaste from his store which he built near his house.

Rasim wishes to increase his business, offering various types of goods to his customers who pass through the streets. He works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for his beloved children.

Rasim has applied for $US1200 in order to increase the range of goods he sells. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Rasim.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Adalat

texts.en: Adalat is 28 years old, is married, and has one child. He lives in Baku City. He has been in business of selling office supplies for five years. He would like a loan of $625 to buy increased office supplies to help improve the output of his business.

loans.use: to buy the office supplies

loans.name: St. Joseph Vocational Group

texts.en:
These people are the staff of the St. Joseph Vocational Institute, Magburaka, Tonkolili District, Northern Sierra Leone. The institute was founded in 1985 by the Catholics of St Joseph of Cluny, and is the only formal institution in Magburaka that is geared towards the development of girls and young women. Their goal is to educate them and develop skills that will enable them to become self reliant. Thus they offer courses like computer science, typing, agriculture, tailoring, dyeing, hair dressing, catering and weaving. They serve mainly girls who can not make it in the formal schooling sector.

This will be the second loan St. Joseph Vocational Institute is requesting from Kiva through SMT. Their previous loan was a great help to these teachers. Some of them invested theirs in business, others used theirs to settle their children's school affairs and others use theirs to buy pieces of furniture. 

Florence K. Y. is the head mistress of the school. Mrs. Y. (back right in pink) was born in Magburaka. She is 39 years old, married to a teacher and the mother of four children. Three of her children are in secondary schools and the fourth is in primary school. Mrs. Y. invested her previous loan in the education of her children. This time she would like to use part of it to buy herself a plot of land and the balance she will use in her children's schooling.

loans.use: Buy a plot of land and invest in the children's education

loans.name: Rahib

texts.en:
Rahib was born in 1974. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, known as Fuzuli town, and settled in the Fuzuli region in Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. 

He has been in this business for six years. He is married and has one child. Now he needs a loan of $1,200 to buy shoes and clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Nail

texts.en: Nail is 41 years old, is married, and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region Kayidish village. He started a general goods business five years ago. Nail would like a loan of $1200 to buy more goods to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Afsar

texts.en: Afsar is 39 years old, is married, has three children. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Kurdmahmudlu. Five years ago he started a general store business . He would like a loan $1200 to buy more goods to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en: Rafig (her mother is pictured) is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Kayidish.  He is 30 years old,  is married, and has one child. He has run a sheep breeding business for five years. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy 15 more sheep to assist in improving his business.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Djavid

texts.en: Djavid was born in 1983. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, and settled in the Fuzuli region in Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. He has been in the auto repair business for 5 years. He is married and has 2 children. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts

loans.name: Gulachar

texts.en: Gulachar is 25 years old, is married, and has one child. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli , settled in Fuzuli region Kurmahmudlu village. She has been in the dairy business for five years. She would like a loan of $1200 to buy two cows to help the output of her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Inshallah

texts.en: Inshallah was born in 1948. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, and settled in the Fuzuli region in Kurdmahmudlu village. He is married and has 4 children. Five years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of $500 to buy a calf.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es empleada domestica y por las tardes asiste a un club de madres donde elaboran toda prenda de lana. Es madre de dos hijos (uno ya es bachiller y el otro esta en secundaria) y esta casada (su esposo se encuentra trabajando en Arika Chile). 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para realizar tramites de su certificado de nacimiento de su hijo ya que no puede estudiar por falta de documentos.
Este crédito será de gran ayuda ya queso hijo tendrá la oportunidad de poder estudiar y superarse para tener perspectivas laborales mejorando su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como un cliente confiable.
texts.en:
Cristina works as a domestic employee and in the afternoons she attends a mother’s club where they make all kinds of clothing items out of wool. She is the mother of two children (one in college and the other in high school) and she is married (her husband is working in Arika, Chile). Their home is located in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz city. The loan will be used to process her child’s birth certificates as he cannot study because of his lack of documents. This loan will be a great help because the oldest son will have the opportunity to study and be successful in order to have better work prospects to improve his quality of life. This is the second loan from Impro, her loan history qualifies her as a trustworthy client.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to process documentation

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen U. D. P. tiene casa propia y esta casda con Teofilo P.. La pareja tiene dos hijos y vive en la zona D. Agua D. la Vida (La Paz).
Carmen es ama D. casa y su esposo es rentista D. la administración pública.
La vivienda presenta deterioro producto D. su antigüedad. El crédito solicitado ira a la refacción D. dos habitaciones en revoque interior y pintura.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Carmen U. D. P. has her own home and is married to Teofilo P.. The couple has two children and lives in the Agua D. la Vida neighborhood of La Paz city. Carmen is a housewife and her husband is a public housing manager. Their current home is deteriorating due to its age. The loan will be used to remodel two rooms, plastering and painting. This is the first time asking for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies her favorably.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel her home

loans.name: Ancelma

texts.es:
Ancelma Ramírez C. tiene casa propia en la zona de Las Lomas, vive con sus dos hijos pues su esposo trabaja en otra ciudad por lo que solo se encuentra con la familia una vez al mes.  Ancelma es empleada de limpieza en domicilios particulares.
La vivienda es bastante antigua y fue construida un metro delante de la línea vial municipal, por lo que los vecinos le están exigiendo la respectiva nivelación con el fin de recibir apoyo municipal para el mejoramiento vial de la zona.
El crédito será usado para demoler el muro frontal de la casa para ingresar a línea municipal.
texts.en:
Ancelma Ramírez C. has her own home in the Las Lomas neighborhood. She lives with her two children as her husband works in another city and he only visits his family once per month. Ancelma is employed as a cleaning woman in private homes. Her home is rather old and was constructed one meter over the municipal road boundary line, so her neighbors are demanding that her property come into compliance so that they will all be able to receive municipal support to improve the neighborhood’s road. The loan will be used to demolish the front facade wall of her home to bring her home into compliance on the boundary lines.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home refurbishment

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio Q. Huañapaco tiene vivienda propia en la zona de Pasankeri, área suburbana de esta ciudad, vive con su hija.
Ignacio trabaja como profesor de primaria en una unidad educativa de la ciudad de El Alto, también obtiene ingresos extra como chofer de transporte publico (esta actividad es más rentable que la anterior, es lamentable).
Con sus ahorros pudo comprarse un lote de terreno, con anteriores créditos realizo la construcción (estructura) para una vivienda pequeña.
Ahora solicita préstamo para construir una habitación nueva.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Ignacio Q. Huañapaco has his own home in the zone of Pasankeri, the suburban area of this city. He lives with his daughter. Ignacio works as a grade school teacher in an educational unit of the city of El Alto. He also obtains extra income as a driver of public transportation (Lamentably, this activity is more profitable than the previous one). With his savings he was able to buy a plot of land. With previous loans he completed the construction (framing) for a small dwelling. Now he requests a loan to build a new room. This is the second time that he has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out qualifies him favorably.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room onto his house

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda C. tiene domicilio propio, esta casada con Alejandro Quispe, la pareja tiene tres hijos. La casa esta ubicada en la zona de Llojeta ,área suburbana de la ciudad de La Paz.
Yolanda es tejedora de chompas, las cuale vende a una microempresa que lleva ese producto al exterior, su esposo es chofer de transporte publico.
La vivienda  tiene dos habitaciones de adobe que se encuentran a media construcción, el crédito solicitado será para la conclusión de las dos habitaciones, de esa manera, sus hijos tendrán mayor comodidad.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Yolanda C. has her own house, is married to Alejandro Quispe, and has three sons. She lives in Llojeta, an area in the outskirts of La Paz. Yolanda knits jackets and sweaters, which she sells to a company that takes this product to foreign markets. Her husband works as a driver of public transportation. Her house has two adobe rooms that are not fully built. She asks for a loan to finish this construction that way her children can be happier. Yolanda has not been able to receive a loan even though she has applied for one several times in the past. Her case and circumstances have already been analyzed and the conclusion of this analysis is favorable towards her receiving a loan.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONSTRUCCION

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Don Mario S. , tiene 53 años de edad, es casado le tiene tres hijos el mayor tiene 10 años cursa el quinto grado de primaria, su segundo hijo hijo es una niña y tiene tres años de edad cursa el primer grado y su ultimo hijo un varoncito de 10 meses de nacido, su esposa es comerciante de de ropa, quien le apoya tambien con los gastos del hogar, Don Mario, es propietario de un pequeño taller de carpinteria ubicado en el sector de la terminal de buses en leon donde elabora juegos de sillas, camas, roperos, teniendo 17 años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual da incio como una herencia de su padre ya que este tambien se dedico a este negocio, su proposito ha sido poder mantener activo dicho negocio familiar y con este poder ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y quizas el dia de mañana estos deseen continuar con la tradicion de la carpinteria, su sueño es poder ir ampliando su pequeño taller, para ello requiere de los creditos asi mismo mantener un inventario adecuado al gusto de sus clientes
texts.en:
Mr. Mario S. is 53 years old and he is married. He has three children, the oldest of whom is 10 years old and studies fifth grade in primary school. His second oldest is his 3 year old daughter, a pre-school student. His third and youngest son is a 10 month old baby. His wife is a clothes saleswoman who helps pay the household expenses. Mr. Mario is the owner of a small carpentry business located near the bus terminal in León. In this workshop he produces chairs, beds, and cabinets. He has worked in the business for 17 years, inheriting the work from his father, who worked in this business for many years. Mr. Mario has worked to keep the family business going and hopes it will allow him to support  his children in their studies. He hopes that one day, maybe, they will join him in the family business. His dream is to expand operations; a loan would help him increase his inventory to meet the needs of more clients.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carpentry workshop expansion

loans.name: Azucena De Jesus

texts.es: Azucena R. P. es una señora de 40 años de edad, es casada, tien cuatro hijos con edades comprendidas de 17 años es un hijo que nacio con capacidades diferentes, otra hija de 15 años cursa el segundo año de secundaria, su otro hijo tiene 13 años estudia el quinto grado de primaria y su ultimo hijo tiene 7 años de edad y cursa el primer grado de primaria; su esposo es agricultor, sus aspiraciones en la vida es poder ayudar a sus hijos a ser profesionales del mañana, en medio de sus limitantes economicas, la actividad economica de la señora es una pulperia en su casa de habitacion la cual esta ubicada en el Kilometro 85 carretra leon managua, donde sus condiciones de vida son bastantes pobres pero tiene la fe en poder ir mejorando su casa poco a poco con las ganancias que le genere su pulperia ademas del credito, ademas de este pequeño negocio, tambine comercializa con frutas y verduras en el mercado la terminal de  buses en leon, como producto de lo que cosecha su esposo, actividad que realiza por la mañana quedando su esposo al frente de la pulperia, con el credito pretende ir creciendo en inventario de esta manera satisafcer su demanda por consiguiente diversificar sus productos.
texts.en:
Azucena R. P. is a 40 year old woman, married, with four children: a 17 year old son with special needs, a 15 year old daughter in her second year of secondary school, a 13 year old son studying 5th grade of primary school, and a 7 year old son in first grade of primary school. Her husband is a farmer. Her aspirations in life are to be able to help her children become professionals in the future. In light of their limited economic means, Azucena opened a small convenience store in their home which is located at kilometer 85 on the Leon-Managua highway, where the living conditions are rather poor but she has faith in being able to improve their home little by little with the earnings their store is generating. In addition to the loan, and this small business, she also sells fruits and vegetables in the Leon bus terminal market, as these are products her husband grows. She does this in the morning leaving her husband in the store. With the loan she will increase her inventory and in this way meet the demand to diversify her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to sell in their store

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es: L aeñora A. C. tiene 46 años de edad,es soltera, tiene cuatro hijos dos de ellos ya son casados, sus otros dos hijos, tienen 18 años este estudia El bachillerato con computacion y el otro tiene 13 añosa de edady cursa el primer año de secundaria, su conyugue es de oficio mecanico y vende repuestos de bicicletas, aportando de esta menera al nucleo familiar, la actividad eocnomica de la señoara es una pequeña puleria ubicada en el kilometron 104 carretera leon chinandega mejor conocido como telica, actividad que tiene de llevar cabo cuatro años , teniendo la vision de obtener otros ingresos ya que ella es profesora y el slario del maestro no es muy bueno, y su esposo como mecanico que tambien es muy pequeño los ingresos de ahi la necesidad de poner una pulperia y ayudar en la fromacion de los hijos, su amyor sueño es poder inyectarel mas capital a su peuqeña puleria hasta convertirla en una miscelanea y ofertar gran variedad de producots para el consumo del hogar y ser una de las mas grandes del sector, con el credito pretende ir fortaleciendo su actividad e inventario comprando arroz, azucar aceite, gaseosa, detergente cosmeticos, pollo, huevo, leche y otros productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. C. is 46 years old and single. She has four children, two of whom are married. Her two younger children, both boys, are 18 and 13 years old. Her older son is finishing high school, where he studies Computer Science, and her younger son is a freshman in high school. Her partner, who she lives with, is a mechanic and sells bicycle parts to help support the family. For the past four years, Mrs. A. C. has owned a small local store located at Kilometer 104 of the Leon Chinandega highway, which is better known as Telica. This is her second source of income: she is a schoolteacher, but does not earn very much since her teacher's salary is so low. Since her partner doesn't earn very much as a mechanic, either, she decided to open the store to better support her children. Her greatest dream is to inject more capital into her small store to offer a wider variety of merchandise for household consumption and to grow the store into one of the biggest in the area. With this loan, she plans to expand and strengthen her inventory by buying rice, sugar, oil, soda, detergent, cosmetics, chicken, eggs, milk and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, etc. for local store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa R., tiene 54años de edad, es casad tiene tres hijos, todos mayores edad,su esposo se dedica a la pesca, tiene lancha propia y trabaj en conjunto con sus hijos, la actividad economica de la señora es una pulperia con venta de Eskimo,  las aspieraciones de doña Teresa, es poder ampliar su negocio e invertir mas en inventario de esta manera fortalecer su inventario ya que en la actualidad no tiene un buen inventario capaz de cubrir la demanda del sector, sin embargo a traves del credito pretende ir mejorandolo, su negocio est aubicado en Salinas Grandes, donde habita, doña Teresa tiene 15 años de tener este negocio el cual da incio como ina vision de negocio ya que en donde habita se estaba aperturando un nuevo reparto y no habian negocios asi surge la idea de poner la puleria hasta llegar a ser lo que es la actualidad, donde ademas de ofrecer productos del hogar como arroz, azucar,aceite, leche y otros productos, tambien vende eskimos y pescado ya que su esposo es pescador. El credito le vendia a mejorar si inventario y satisfacer su demanda del sector.
texts.en:
Teresa is 54 years old and is married with three children, all adults. He husband makes a living fishing. He has his own motorboat and works with their children. Teresa runs a convenience store selling ice cream sandwiches and other items. Her aspirations are to grow her business and invest in more products, and in this way she can strengthen her inventory since she currently doesn't have enough selection to satisfy demand. Of course, through the loan she expects to keep making improvements. Her business is located in Salinas Grandes, where she lives, and she's been doing it for 15 years. The idea came to her after they opened up a new storefront where she lived and there were no businesses, so she thought of setting up the convenience store until she made it a reality. Along with offering household products like rice, sugar, oil, milk and other items, she also sells ice cream sandwiches and fish brought in by her husband. The loan will be used to improve her inventory to satisfy her customers demands.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in more inventory

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: El señor Wilson N., tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, le tiene dos hijos con edades comprendidas entre los tres y un año de edad, no estudian todavia, su esposa no trabaj de manera directa en su lugar le ayuda a ver los negocio a  su esposo, teniendo dos actividades, una pulperia que es la principal fuente de ingresos y un ciber siendo su segunda fuente de ingresos del hogar. Este señor tiene como proposito poder adquirir mas computadoras  e instalar un ciber con todos los equipos a fin de cubrir la demanda del sector ya que es uno de los barrios mas nuevos que estan surgiendo donde tiene ubcado su negocio, este señor tiene dos años de deicarse a esta actividad, el anteriormente vivia en Matagalpa pero se caso aca en leon y aqui a formado su familia, Con el financiamiento pretende invertirlo en la pulperia y poco a poco ir mejorando las condiciones de los negocios, de esta manera darles condiciones economicas a su familia y salir adelante con el apoyo de nuestra institucion y de aquellas manos amigas que buscan apoyar las ideas de negocios.
texts.en:
Wilson is 40 years, married and has two children ages 3 and 1. His wife does not have a job but she helps oversee his businesses. He has two of them: a convenience store is his main source of income and an internet cafe is another source. Wilson intends to acquire more computers and set up the internet cafe with all the amenities so he can meet demand since it's in one of the newest and fastest growing neighborhoods. He's been involved in the business for two years. Previously he was living in Matagalpa, but he got married in Leon and started his family there. With the loan he expects to invest in the convenience store and little by little improve the business' conditions, and this way he can improve his family's economic situation as well and make headway with the support of Kiva and the friendly hands looking to support his business ideas.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to the convenience store

loans.name: Osman Guillermo

texts.es: Don Osaman M., tiene 34 años de edad, es casado, le tiene tres hijos con edades comprendidas entre los 15 años. 12 años y 8 años, cursando la mayor el tercer año de bachillerato. su otro hijo cursa el segundo año de secundaria y su tercer hijo el segundo grado de primaria, su esposa se desempeña como profesora. Don Osman tiene dos años de haber dando inicio a este pequeño proyecto siendo este una pequeña pulperia como producto del desempleo y una manera de aportar a los gastos del hogar. Su mayor sueño es poder llegar a tener una misecelana donde ofertar todos lo productos del hogar asi como cosmeticos, Con los creditos pretende ir creceindo poco a poco y con las ganancias poder ir mejorando sus condicones de vida y economicas de igual manera ir ampliando su negocio hasta logara su sueño, su deseo en la vida es poder dejarle a sus hijos una carrera como profesionales y un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Osman is 34 years old and married with three kids, ages 15, 12 and 8. The oldest is in his third year of high school, the middle is in his second year of middle school, and the youngest is in second grade. His wife makes a living as a teacher. Osman is two years removed from having started his small convenience store when he was unemployed and needed a way to pay the bills. His biggest dream is to have a general store where he can sell household products as well as cosmetics. With the loan he expects to keep growing little by little and with the earnings he'll keep improving his quality of life and economic situation along with his business until he achieves his goal. His wish in life is to see his children as professionals with prosperous businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase supplies

loans.name: Mayra De La Trinidad

texts.es: Doña Mayra M. V., tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera tiene dos hijos con edades comprendidas de 21 y 19 años respectivamente estudian en la universidad, no tiene otros ingresos mas que el que le genera su pequeño salon de belleza, el cual tiene 15 años de ejercer, su proposito es poder generar empleo, su mayor sueño es ampliar su local y ser una de las mejores estilistas a nivel de leon y en un futuro a navel nacional, otro de sus sueños poder tener u local propio donde atender a su clientela ya que en la actualidad alquila local, otro de sus propositos es poder ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante yfromalos como profesioanles, Doña Mayra da incio en esta actividad como una opcion de trabajo ya que desde muy joven le gustaba pero por no tener los recursos necesarios no pudo estudiar y profesionalizarse en este rubro sin embargo poco a poco a venido adquiriendo conocimientos. El credito que utiliza es para poder tener material necesario en su actividad.
texts.en:
Mayra is 44 years old and is single with two children, ages 21 and 19, who are studying at a university. She doesn't have any other income other than that she makes at a small beauty salon, which she has been doing for 15 years. Her intention is to create employment. Her biggest dream is to enlarge her salon and be one of the best stylists in Leon and later in the country. Another one of her dreams to have her own place where she can tend to her customers since she currently is renting. Among her intentions is to be able to help her children make headway and become professionals. Mayra started this activity because ever since she was very young she like doing it but she didn't have the means necessary to go to school and become a professional stylist, but little by little she came to learn the trade. The loan will be used to purchase necessary supplies for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase necessary supplies

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: El señor M. es taxista acompañado con un hijo menor de edad el cual esta en primaria su compañera trrabaja en el mercado la estacion vendiendo ropa ambos se ayudan para salir adelante con su pequeño hijo, el tiene 14 años de trabajar como transportista  lleva trace credito con fundacion leon 2000 los cuales manifiesta le han servido para sacar adelante a su familia y poderles dar a sus hijos mayores una carrera  universitaria y  heredarles su casa a cada uno  uno de sus grandes sueños es poder formar al ultimo de sus hijos y estblecerse con un buen negocio para poder pasar su vejez
texts.en:
M. is a taxi driver and he is accompanied with his young son who is currently going to primary school. His partner works in the market selling clothing and they help each other to raise their son. He has been working as a taxi driver for 14 years and he has been given loans by Fundacion Leon 2000. These loans have given him the opportunity to care of his family and to provide their now adult children with a university career. And he will be able give them their house as an inheritance. One of his great dreams is to send the last of his children to school. He also wishes to have a well established business as he moves into his golden years.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es: Doña Salvadora L., tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad que le ayudan en lo poco que pueden, Doña Salvadora se deica a la venta de Gaseosas y Frescos naturales teniendo un pequeño tramo en el mercadito del Barrio de sutiava, donde tiene 24 años de ejercer dicha actividad, su proposito es poder seguir siendo cliente de nuestra institucion y poder permanecer en el mercado ofertando sus refrescos, su mayor sueño es poder llegar a tener una refresqueria mas grande y poder obtener mejores ingresos, asi mismo poder mejorar las condicones de su negocio y atraer mas clientes, Doña salvadora da inicio en esta actividad como una manera de subsistir y sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que no tenia el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, con el credito pretende mantener un inventario lo suficientemente capaz de mantenerse en le mercado ya que los costos de la materia prima como azucar, frutas estan dia dia muy caros.
texts.en:
Salvadora L. is 58 years old, she is single and she has two adult children that help her out as much as they can. Salvadora runs a business selling soft drinks and fresh squeezed juices from her small stand in the market of Barrio de Sutiava. She has been running her business for 24 years and her goal is to be able to keep running her stand and to expand it to be able to obtain better earnings, and in turn improve her stand and attrack more clients. Salvadora started her business as a way of supporting her children because she did not have any support from her children's father. With this loan she plans to maintain an inventory that will be enough remain in the market, especially given that the cost of ingredients such as sugar and fruit is now so expensive.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce N. is 33 years old, divorced and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She has made a living selling rubber and bathroom slippers in her community for the last two years. Rubber slippers are very common and worn by majority of Ghanaians because they are comfortable, easy to wear and cheap to buy. Joyce says she wants to buy a wider variety of slippers so that her customers have more of a choice. Joyce hopes to increase her savings and rent a storefront as she currently hawks her wares in the scorching sun. She would also like to save for her children's education. She is a member of the loan group called Nyame Mma, or 'God's Children'.  Members agree to guarantee for each other when repaying their loan.

loans.use: To buy more rubber and bathroom slippers to sell

loans.name: Melba Josefa

texts.es: La señora P.  tiene 60 años de edad es madre soltera con un hijo el cual es bachiller , la actividad economica es la venta de gaseosas, refrescos naturales la venta de cuajada y otros teniendo treinta y tres años de ejercer esta actividad la cual le ha permitido sacar adalante a su hijo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida uno de sus sueños es poder ampliar su negocio y que fundacion siempre este dispuesto a seguirla apoyando para poder lograr su porososito , el cual es seguir con la actividad ya que es su unica fuente de ingreso , otro sueño de ella es que un dia su hijo le de la alegria de ser abuela .
texts.en:
Penalba is 60 years old and she is a single mother to one son, a high school graduate. She sells soft drinks and fresh squeezed juices and other drinks and she has been doing so for 33 years. Her work has permitted her to support her son and to improve their living conditions. One of her dreams is to expand her business and she wishes that «Fundacion» continue to support her to make her dream a reality. She wishes to continue running her business which is her only source of income. Another one of her dream is that one day her son provide her the joy of becoming a grandmother.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora M. tiene 35 años es casada madre de tres hijos uno de 15,16,18 los cuales cursan la secundaria,  la señora M. es una persona emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superacion ya que su negocio es familiar porque cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en forma directa y con la ayuda de sus tres hijos en el tiiempo libres su actividad economica es la venta de C,D  y ropa interior de dama y de caballero la cual la oferta de forma ambulante uno de sus grandes sueños es poder establecerse y poder sacar adelante a sus tres hijos a que logren coronar una carrera universitaria y para ello espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Fundacion Leon 2000
texts.en:
Ms. M. is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children, ages 15, 16 and 18. They are in secondary school. Ms. M. is an entrepreneur with many dreams of making her life better. Her business is a family business as she counts on the direct help of her husband and, in their spare time, the help of her three children. Her economic activity is the sale of CDs and underwear for men and women, which she sells by going from place to place. One of her greatest dreams is to be able to establish herself and to help her three children be able to attend university. For this, she hopes to continue counting on the help of the Leon Foundation 2000.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital for CD and clothing sales

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwo A. is a trader in used clothes. She is married and blessed with two kids who are currently in school. 
Adwo helps support her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past eight years, but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and buy more viable used clothes. 
She wants to purchase bales of bulk used clothes to increase her inventory with the loan to be able to save more and provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to the group called "Nyame Mma" meaning God's children.
The group provides assistance and support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience S. is 31 years old, and has worked as a food vendor for the last 10 ten years. She prepares and sells kenkey and fish (a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of local soups, sauce and pepper). It is a delicacy most Ghanaian eat everyday either as breakfast, lunch or dinner. Patience's business is doing well and she wants to expand to serve more customers. She has applied for a loan to buy more maize, vegetables, firewood and fish.

Patience is widowed with one child who is in the first year of junior high school. She hopes this loan will help her earn enough money to pay her child's fees. Patience is a member of the group called Nyame Mma, or God's Children. Members agree to guarantee each other's loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, vegetables, assorted fishes, and firewood etc.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara M. is 60 years old. She is divorced and a mother with 12 children. 

She sells food stuffs like maize, plantain, cassava and oil in the community market. Her business is on a very small scale because of inadequate working capital. She believes the loan will help her to inject more capital into the business. 

She wants to use the loan to buy stock of bulk maize, plantain, cassava and rice to increase her inventory. Price hikes are another challenge to her business emanating from the current food crisis. She hopes to cut down on costs through bulk purchases. 

She trusts bulk savings would enable her to save enough to support at least two of her kids in school. She is a member of the trust group called "Nyame Mma" meaning God's children Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another and assist each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy stock of maize, plantain, cassava and rice

loans.name: Juana Jeanethe

texts.es: La señora U. tiene 34 años  es casada madre de tres hijos de 8,14,16 años uno en primaria y los otros dos en secundaria, su esposo trabaja en Costa Rica su actividad economica es la venta de granos basicos poteria, gaseosas y todo lo que es producto del hogar  tambien tiene como actividad el cultivo de pipian , flor de jamaica y frijol de vara el cual ella lo comercializa en los mercados de leon, para llevar a cabo esta actividad ella cuenta con el apoyo de sus tres hijos en su tiempo libre y cada tres meses su esposo regresa a nicaragua y  la apoya economicamente y en las labores del campo, el credito lo utiliza para capital de trabajo y las ganacias las reinvierte en el cultivo de las hortalizas, de esta manera doña juana es una de las tantas   empresarias emprendedoras que desean seguir contando con el apoyo de Fundacion Leon 2000 y el proyecto KIVA
texts.en:
U. is a married, 34-year-old with 3 children aged 8, 14 and 16 -- 1 in primary and the other 2 in secondary. Her husband works in Costa Rica. She sells basic grains, soda and anything that is a household product. She also cultivates squash and vara bean which she sells in the markets of Leon. She counts on the help of her children when she takes time off and every 3 months her husband returns to Nicaragua and supports her financially and in the fields with the crops. The loan will be used for business capital and the gained income will be reinvested in the cultivation of her crops. This is why Juana is one of the many business entrepreneurs that wants to continue counting on the support of "Fundacion Leon 2000" and the Kiva project.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase business capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret G. is 50 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are still in school. For the last three years, she has made a living selling products like rice, fresh tomatoes, canned tomatoes, cocoa, skimmed milk, body pomade and biscuits in the market at  Nankese a suburb of Koforidua, Ghana. Her experience in trading has made her one of the most successful people in this market. She considers the loan as a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers, such as cartons of milk, bags of sugar, boxes of vegetables, assorted containers of biscuits and palm oil. Margaret G. belongs to a loan group called Nyame Mma (or God's Children). In this group, members help each other repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, vegetables, biscuits and palm oil to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Juana G. es una clienteque tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad que no dependen de ella, su esposo no trabaja pero le ayuda en el desarrollo del negocio, Doña Juana tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la Elaboracion y venta de tortillas, refrescos naturales, frijoles cosidos y gasesa, Esta microempresaria sufrio los embates del Uracan MICHT, donde se dio el deslabe el cerro casita de donde proviene, pero con el deseo de querer salir adelante y obtener una fuente de ingresos dio inicio en este negocio con el cual a la fecha es su unica fuente de ingresos ya que su experiencia estaba en la gricultura y al perderlo todo dio un giro a su vida ahora en la ciudad.
Con el apoyo de los creditos ha salido adelante y en la actualidad trabaja con creditos con el objetivo de poder adquirir materia prima relacionada con su actividad siendo esta la venta de frijoles cosidos tal y como se menciono anteriormente, su deseo es poder mas adelante poner una pulperia por consiguiente ampliar su negocio, teniendo la fe que saldra adelante y espera contar con el apoyo de manos amigas que le ayuden en sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana G. is a 51-year-old client who is married and has 4 grown up children who no longer depend on her. Her husband does not work, but he helps her with the development of the business. Ms. G. has been making and selling tortillas, fresh beverages, baked beans, and soft drinks for 10 years. This small business suffered the battering of Hurricane Mitch, during which time there was a mudslide on the hill where her house is located. Nevertheless, with the desire to press forward and to obtain a source of income, she started this business, which is currently her only source of income. She used to be involved in agriculture, but upon losing everything, her life turned around completely. With the support from the loans, she has been able to get ahead. She is currently requesting this loan with the aim of being able to purchase the ingredients needed to make baked beans. Her wish is to be able to set up a general store and expand her business in the future. She has faith that she will move forward, and she hopes to count on the support of friendly hands that will help her with her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort S. is married and the mother of six children. Two of her children are currently in school, while the rest have completed high school. 

She has been selling yams, cassava and plantains for the past nine years to support her children in school. She treks to the surrounding villages of Koforidua to purchase goods such as tubers of yam, cassava, and plantains and resell them to her customers in the city market, Accra. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more tubers of yam, cassava, and bunches of plantains from the farmers instead of buying from the market dealers. This she believes will increase her sales and income to support her two children who are in school. 

Comfort is a member of the group called "Nyame Mma" (God children). Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of fresh yams, cassava, and plantains

loans.name: Asong

texts.en:
Asong K. is 48 years old. He is married with three kids who are currently in school. K. is a dealer in bicycle parts. 

He also provides repairs and servicing for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. Nankese, where he lives and trades, is a farming community. 

He says the sale of bicycles and parts is a very lucrative business since most of the farmers ride on bicycles to their farms. He requests a loan to enable him to procure increased stock of bicycle parts to serve his customers. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings to expand his shop and support his kids in school. 

He belongs to the community group called "Nyame Mma" Trust Group. In this group, Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of bicycle parts.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Doña Martha D., es una cliente con 28 años de edad, tiene dos hijosde 8 y 2 años rspectivamente cursan la primaria en colegio publico, su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañileria en el vecino pais de Costa Rica, desde donde le envia remesas, doña Martha se dedica al comercio de cosmeticos actividad que tiene mas de cinco años de ejercer como producto de la necesidad de empleo, esta joven microempresaria fue una de las sobrevivientes del Uran Micht, en la actualidad ademas de vender cosmeticos como perfumes tambien se dedica al comercio de ropa nueva actividad que desempeña por encargo, su proposito en la vida es poder sacar adelante a su familia y con los creditos poder mejorar sus condiciones economicas y ampliar su negocio a fin de logar mas adelante quizas poner una pequeña tienda de ropa en su casa o en el mercado.
texts.en:
Martha D. is 28 years old and she has two children aged 8 and 2 and they are currently attending a public primary school. Her husband works as a laborer's assistant, working in the neighboring country of Costa Rica. He sends her support from there. Martha has been selling cosmetics for the last 5 years. She started this business because she needed a job. This young businesswoman is a survivor of Hurrican Mitch. In addition to selling cosmetics she also sells perfumes and new clothing, a business she runs by taking orders. The life's purpose is to provide for her family and with the loan to improve their financial situation. She wishes to expand her business and perhaps one day set up a small clothing store from her home or in the market.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary D. is 32 years old, divorced and the mother of four children, all of whom are currently in school.  Mary is a food vendor and makes a living preparing waakye (a dish made with cooked brown rice and beans, eaten with vegetable sauce) for school children and workers in her neighborhood. She has been selling rice and stew for seven years and needs to buy more bags of rice and vegetables to avoid price hikes for these commodities. She hopes to used the increased income made possible by this loan to save for her children's future. She is a member of the group called Nyame Mma, or God's Chindren. Members agree to guarantee each other's commitment to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, frozen fish and vegetables

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace K. is 54 years old, married and the mother of three children. Through hard work, Grace has earned enough money to allow two of her children to complete senior high school. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey, a local dish made of maize which is cooked and then consumed with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers, because many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and/or supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise her income high enough to allow her first child to enter university. She belongs to the community group called Nyame Mma, or God"s Children. Members provide each other assistance in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq M. is 30 years old and married with three children. He is a market vendor and for eight years he has worked selling men's clothing in the local market. His wife keeps house, thus his business is the only source of income for his family. For this reason, he works hard to bring sustenance back to his home. Sadiq wants his children to get a good education to have a better chance to succeed in the future. This is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile.

In order to expand his business, Sadiq is requesting a loan of $1200. He will use the loan to purchase merchandise in order to offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. The wellbeing of Sadiq's family and his business are in your hands. Sadiq and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise in order to offer a wider selection to his customers.

loans.name: Muqabil

texts.en:
Muqabil K. is 36 years old, married with three sons. Muqabil's wife is a homemaker. He is working hard because he is the only breadwinner in the family. For eight years, he has been selling men clothes. He buys the goods in the capital of the country every week and then supplies his customers with the goods in the local market. He tries to choose various goods of fine quality and attractive prices, which allows him to keep his clientèle. The business provides a stable income and allows Muqabil to improve his family's living conditions.

Today, he applied for $1200 to purchase winter season clothes. He would like to thank everybody for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time. The progress of Muqabils's business is in your hands; your support will really help him.

loans.use: To purchase winter season clothing.

loans.name: Davud

texts.en:
Davud A. is 35 years old, married, and has two children. He is a hard-working man struggling to feed his children and parents (who live with him) by selling clothes for teenagers and children. 

Davud has a trading place in the central local market in the city of Imishli. All of the goods are bought from the capital of the country which is three hours away from his region. Davud is trying to have a wide range of goods to better meet the requirements and different levels of income of his customers. 

Today, Davud feels that with more working capital his business could generate more income, so he is asking for a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase winter clothes and raise his family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible father give his children a brighter future.

loans.use: to  purchase winter clothes for sale

loans.name: Alisafa

texts.en:
Alisafa K. is 40 years old, married with four adorable children. His wife is a homemaker.

Alisafa has had his own business for 13 years. He started as the seller of clothing and gradually he has been becoming more involved in this business and dreaming to open his own trading place. Now he sells men's suits, coats, trousers and shirts in the central local market. Alisafa is a friendly and polite man. He is trying to diversify the range of goods to satisfy the needs of the clients with the various levels of income.

The business is stable, allowing Alisafa to make a considerable contribution to the family budget. His children are growing up and their expenses are increasing. Thus he wants to develop his business. For this purpose, he has applied for $US1200 for purchasing new modern suits and shirts. Alisafa thanks all for supporting him and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To  purchase new modern suits and shirts for selling.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib M. is 36 years old. He and his wife, who keeps house, are raising two children. Sahib's children are small now, but he is already working hard to ensure the best possible future for them. He makes a living selling foodstuffs like pastries, sugar, salt, tea, soft drinks and other items in a wholesale store which he rents. Sahib has been in this business for 12 years. He is very polite and his store is very popular with local residents, whose patronage allows him to earn a good income for his family.

Sahib has applied for a loan of $US1,200 and will use the loan to buy more items to sell. This will allow him to earn more and meet the needs of his family. Sahib thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan Q. is 23 years old and he is already the young father of an adorable daughter. He says he loves her more than life and does all possible to make her future as happy as he can.

Ruslan's main business activity is selling mobile phones. He has four years of experience in this field. Ruslan is a very polite man and professional in selecting mobile phones for every taste of every client.

His income is just enough to cover family needs, but to expand his business he need more sources of income. As the mobile store is the only financial source for his family Ruslan has decided to expand the scope of his business and for this purpose he has applied for $US1,200. Ruslan thanks everyone who supports him and his family.

loans.use: To expand the scope of his mobile phone business.

loans.name: Bakhruz

texts.en:
Bakhruz Q. is a 21-year-old man who has run his own business since 2006. With the help of his father who lent him money for startup, he opened a store where he sells mobile phone accessories and provides computer service.

Now Bakhruz needs an additional $US1,200 to expand his business which has worked very well for the last two years. Bakhruz hopes for your support.

loans.use: To expand his phone accessory business.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim M. is a 41-year-old man who keeps a veterinary drug store. He has eight years of experience in this field. He is married and has three daughters.

Rasim has applied for $US1,200 to expand his business. Drug stores are one of the more profitable businesses in the southern regions of Azerbaijan as the majority of people keep livestock and injections are necessary to avoid illness.

loans.use: To expand his veterinary supply business.

loans.name: Nizam

texts.en:
Nizam A. is 35 years old, married with two sons. He is a very wise and hard-working man. This entrepreneur dedicates himself to the sale of electrical goods such as CD and DVD players, phones, electric kettles and other stuff.

Little by little, Nizam has expanded his inventory and thanks to the good service he offers his business is growing rapidly. He says that with income from his activity he is able to provide education and food for his children. This business is the only financial source for his family.

Now Nizam needs a loan of $US1,200 which he will use to buy new inventories for his store. This will help to meet the demand of his customers and continue growing his business. He is committed to paying back this loan in 15 months. This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve the quality of life of Nizam's family.

loans.use: To buy new items for his electrical goods store.

loans.name: Qorkhmaz

texts.en:
Qorkhmaz A. has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with two daughters. He has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as sweets, soft drinks, juices and other items.

Qorkhmaz began this enterprise five years ago in order to support his family and parents. To this date, he is the only support for his parents.

Today Qorkhmaz needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he sells. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of $US1,200. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he sells.
